Primary.Name: The Manticore
Primary.Info:
Manticore is a void exotic submachine gun that allows the user to glide over combatants while raining bullets from above!

Weapon hits on combatants builds up Antigrav Repulsors. Firing the weapon while airborne suspends the wielder in  the air; allowing them to freely glide.

While gliding, this weapon deals more damage and extends the Antigrav Repulsors meter. Once the meter is depleted, the wielder will fall back to the ground.

The Manticore's catalyst allows the wielder to build void overshield on combatant final blows and weapon hits on powerful enemies, as well as reduce the accuracy of combatants targeting you.

Chest.Name: Armamentarium
Chest.Info:
This Titan chest exotic allows the user two grenade charges. 

While this exotic does not do anything special, the SkyBreach Void Titan Build makes very special work of this exotic!

HowItWorks:
The SkyBreach Void Titan build is all about floating above your enemies, gaining and keeping Volatile Rounds proc'd, and keeping Devour up at much as possible in combat!

Grenade final blows kickstart the entire gameplay loop. The grenade final blow activates Volatile Rounds which allows void weapons to do more damage. These rounds will also periodically heal you and your teammates as you deal further damage to them thanks to the Void Titan Aspect Controlled Demolition.

The grenade final blow also generates an Orb of Power, which will grant Devour once collected. Devour grants grenade energy on final blow, heals you to full health instantly, and refreshes the Devour timer. 

This gameplay loop alone allows you to summon several grenades and have Volatile Rounds proc'd at all times. But this build can take things to new "heights".

While utilizing the above gameplay loop, mixing in the gliding capabilities from Manticore allows you to rain void munitions down unto your opponents. Final blows and hits on powerful combatants generates a Void Overshield; which grants even more grenade regeneration and buffs your melee ability thanks to Offensive Bulwark! You are also harder to hit while gliding, which can save you from those surprise powerful combatants!

The idea is gliding with Manticore while having Devour, Volatile Rounds, and a Void Overshield for maximum void explosions and weapon damage!
GameplayLoop:
1) Get grenade final blow to generate an Orb of Power for Devour and proc Volatile Rounds
2) Build up Antigrav Repulsors from hits on powerful combatants and final blows.
3) Shoot combatants while airborne to begin gliding; doing more damage, generating Void Overshield, and extending Antigrav Repulsors.

Primary.Name: The Lament
Primary.Info: Solar weapons will extend the timers of Restoration and Radiant; The Lament not only does this, but takes advantage of the Strongholds and has built in Anti-Barrier.

Chest.Name: Stronghold
Chest.Info: With season 21 Stronghold got a great update. First off you get resist x4 just by guarding. This is already a huge damage reduction, but when it's combined with Restoration x2 from the Strongholds things get wild!

HowItWorks:
This Build takes advantage of the new Buffs that the Strongholds received! Every time you block with a sword you get resist x4. This alone is a huge B on its own, and you can add even more damage reduction on top of that. The second part of Strongholds is every time you deal damage to an enemy you are granted Restoration x2. When you have resist x4 and restoration x2 you can run through anything in Destiny 2. You just need to block when big damage from a boss comes in. 

Pair this with a Solar subclass because it can make Restoration's timer jump up to 6 seconds with Ember of Solace, and then it can chain all the way up to 12 seconds. Add the Radiant buff from dealing damage with Throwing Hammer. The timers of Radiant and Restoration can be extended  with a Solar Weapon kill with Ember of Empyrean. The Lament is a great option as it takes advantage of Strongholds, is Solar, and has built in Anti-Barrier!
GameplayLoop:
Block with your sword of choice
Activate your sword attack when near an enemy and proc Restoration x2
If needed, guard for the x4 Resist in tandem with Restoration to be unkillable
Throw your Thermite Grenade and using your Barricade when needed
Land kills with a solar weapon to extend the timer of Restoration and Radiant
Just keep swording away and block when big damage comes in

Primary.Name: Trinity Ghoul
Primary.Info: Getting an arc kill loads a chaining arc shot. This can reproc off of itself and is amazing or ad clear.

Chest.Name: Phoenix Protocol
Chest.Info: Getting an arc kill loads a chaining arc shot. This can reproc off of itself and is amazing or ad clear.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to solo the Guardian Games competitive nightfall playlist and achieve a top 10% score.

This is made extremely easy with your two exotics. Trinity Ghoul gives you some of the best ad clear in the entire game to keep your points stacking. Phoenix Protocol will let you have infinite supers when paired with the gold contender’s boon. Getting kills while in your well will also grant you additional points. The only gameplay loop of this is just to pop your well of radiance and get kills with Trinity Ghoul.

Other things to help out is the solo operative artifact perk, which gives you more damage while solo. Revitalizing Blast lets your abilities debuff champions and bosses. With the gold contender’s boon, you will also have infinite abilities.

Arc siphon will allow your Trinity Ghoul to make orbs which you can then pick up to proc your x3 arc weapon surge. Since you can spam your abilities dynamo helps by providing extra super energy when using your class ability. Ashes to assets is also nice by giving you more super energy on grenade kills. You can pair this with touch of flame to make it easier to get those grenade kills.

Note that you get extra points when you emote on a champion before you finish it. For that reason, proximity ward is nice to have since you will be going for finishers a lot.
GameplayLoop:
Pop your well of radiance
Get kills with Trinity Ghoul inside of your well
Refund all half your super energy
Get kills with grenades for extra super energy
Use your class ability for extra super energy
Use your abilities to debuff bosses or champions

Primary.Name: New Pacific Epitaph
Primary.Info:
This is the only kinetic slot Wave-Frame which opens up the energy slot for a wide array of options. On top of that is has access to solid perks and a top tier Origin Trait in Restoration Ritual which will give an emergency auto-reload after a finisher kill or reviving an ally. This lets you shoot the weapon twice in a row with no reload. This effect works when the weapon is stowed.

Harmony and Demolitionist are the top perks to look for.

Chest.Name: Felwinter's Helm
Chest.Info:
Powered melee final blows or finishers create a void explosion that will weaken enemies hit by the explosion by 30%.

This synergizes with Echo of Cessation which makes nearby enemies Volatile after a finisher and creates a Void Breach.

This pair gives immense value to finishers.

HowItWorks:
With the Fragments and Felwinter's Helm this build receives a lot of benefits from using a finisher on an enemy. On a finisher Felwinter's Helm will make nearby enemies weakened 30%, Echo of Cessation will release an explosion that makes nearby enemies Volatile and create a Void Breach, and makes you invisible with Echo of Obscurity. The other benefit of a finisher is that it will give an emergency reload to New Pacific Epitaph from its Origin Trait Restoring Ritual. This allows you to quickly shoot this Wave-Frame Grenade Launcher weapon twice in a row.

The Fragment Echo of Harvest creates an Orb of Power and Void Breach when defeating a weakened enemy which will happen when cleaning up nearby enemies after performing a finisher. The final Fragment is Echo of Undermining which will weaken targets 15% from a Vortex Grenade. Grenades and Child of the Old Gods are good means of weakening an enemy from afar, and the 15% weaken will NOT override the 30% weaken from Felwinter's Helm.

All of the Orbs of Power and Void Breaches created are leveraged through mods and the Artifact. The Artifact will give a shield when picking up a Void Breach from Protective Breach. Multiple Void Breaches will also give armor charge stacks with the Elemental Charge mod. Orbs of Power will give New Pacific Epitaph a damage boost with Stasis Weapon Surge.
GameplayLoop:
Lower an enemy's health to finisher range
Use a finisher on that enemy to make nearby enemies weakened, Volatile, create a Void Breach, and give New Pacific Epitaph a stored auto-reload
Shoot two New Pacific Epitaph shots to kill or damage weakened/Volatile enemies
Use a finisher on low health enemies to restart the cycle
Collect Void Breaches and Orbs of Power that created
Use Vortex Grenade or Child of the Old Gods as a backup source of weaken if enemies are at a distant

Primary.Name: Riptide
Primary.Info: One of the top special weapons in the kinetic slot of PVE content mainly for its ability to role the perk Chill Clip - which can slow and eventually freeze targets, taking care of both Overload and Unstoppable Champions.

Chest.Name: Pyrogale Gauntlets
Chest.Info:
What was once just an exotic equipped only for its buffs to the super, the Pyrogale Gauntlets are now the primary catalyst to this build!

This exotic transforms your Burning Maul super into a one-off, VERY high damage slam that leaves flaming cyclones in its wake!

The Consecration Solar Titan aspect also leaves a flaming cyclone in its wake!

HowItWorks:
The IMPYRE Solar Titan build revolves around creating as much fire and explosions as humanly possible!

Defeating a target with your sidearm creates fire and explosions due to Incandescent
Your charged melee creates fire and explosions
Dragon's Breath creates fire and explosions
Your super DEFINITELY creates fire and explosions!

Aside from burning the entire battlefield, this build excels and keeping you Radiant and under the effects of Restoration with the fragments Ember of Empyrean and Ember of Torches.

Ember of Ashes increases the amount of scorch stacks you apply to targets from all sources (this includes scorch stacks applies from Incandescent of your sidearm and stacks applies by Dragon's Breath!) - allowing from even more Ignitions to occur!

And Ember of Searing allows your more charged melee uptime while also creating a Firesprite that grants grenade energy!

Lastly, this build can stun all Champions this season!

Anti Barrier - stunned via Piercing Sidearms Artifact Mod and Radiant buffs

Overload - stunned via Chill Chip rounds from the top half of Riptide's magazine

Unstoppable -  stunned via ignition from Consecration, Dragon's Breath, or three rounds hit from Riptide with Chill Clip!
GameplayLoop:
For Groups of Rank-and-File (Red Bar) Enemies:

Charge towards them, slide, activate your charged melee ability. You will then leap into the air, thrusting a scorching wave forward. Activate your charged melee while airborne to slam the ground - creating a larger wave of damaging solar energy. Enemies hit by both waves ignite!

Using the Heliocentric QSC is also a very good add-clearing weapon - especially if it is rolled with Incandescent!

For Boss Damage:
Open up either your Throwing Hammer and Consecration on the boss to proc Revitalizing Blast, then shoot your Dragon's Breath. Follow up with shooting the boss with your Riptide fusion rifle until the Dragon's Breath is reloaded again. Rinse and repeat. Mixing in your super with warrant MASSIVE boss damage!

For Champions:
1) Stun Champion
2) Activate Throwing Hammer or Consecration to proc Revitalizing Blast
3) Either shoot Dragon's Breath or Riptide until defeated

Primary.Name: Osteo Striga
Primary.Info: Kills will spread poison. Multiple precision hits will spread poison too. Poison kills will overflow the magazine (with catalyst). Bullets track enemies.

Chest.Name: Necrotic Grip
Chest.Info: Melee hits will poison enemies and when the poisoned enemy dies it spreads. The poison ticks up, doing increased damage until the target dies and the poison can spread forever. Synergizes with Osteo Striga, so it can take the effects of the exotic.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to poison, unravel, and suspend everything on the battlefield.

Targets are suspended due to getting weapon kills while weaver’s trance is active. This is proceeded by consuming your shackle grenade with the aspect mindspun invocation. Your poison kills will also proc this due to it counting as weapon damage so you can spread poison and suspend at the same time. Poison will come from your exoitc weapon Osteo Striga and armor Nectrotic Grip. Unravel will come from your arcane needle melee and can be spread indefinitely if enemies are around and the damage overtime is ticking.

With all of that damage going you will be procing thread of generation to refill your grenade energy to reproc weaver’s trance. Thread of continuity will also keep your suspend and unravel up for even longer. Then thread of warding fragment will grant you woven mail on every orb of power pick up. Finally thread of mind will give class ability energy on suspended kills.
GameplayLoop:
Consume your shackle grenade
Proc weaver’s trance to suspend enemies on kills
Use your arcane needle to proc unravel on enemies
Spread poison, unravel, and suspend to everything
Repeat once you need to reproc weaver’s trance or unravel

Primary.Name: The Supremacy
Primary.Info: Good longer range option with Kinetic Tremors for some supplemental champion damage.

Chest.Name: Celestial Nighthawk
Chest.Info:
Turns golden gun into a single shot super dealing 625% damage.
Precision final blows grant between 1.5 - 4.5% super energy.
Final blows with golden gun refund 33% super energy.

HowItWorks:
This build is arguably the best GM build this season.

We build super EXTREMELY fast using polaris lance via precision final blows, damage against higher tier enemies, and through ignitions.

This also has access to deal with Anti-Barriers with Radiant, Unstops with Ignitions, and Overloads with Chill Clip weapons or overload rockets this season.

You can easily get off 10 supers during a GM and the build allows you to play extremely fast or slow and from range!
GameplayLoop:
Shoot enemies with polaris lance to get radiant, cause ignitions, and build super.
Use knife trick to debuff champions
Use celestial nighthawk and other weapons to kill champions
Repeat.

Primary.Name: Wish-Ender
Primary.Info: A great all around bow for damage and dealing with champions which gets a damage boost from the Oathkeeper gauntlets.

Chest.Name: Oathkeeper
Chest.Info: When holding down a bow for a slightly longer duration a damage boost is given to the bow. This takes Wish-Ender, which is one of the highest damage primary weapons in the game, to the next level with the extra ~150% damage boost.

HowItWorks:
General ad clear is carried by Wish-Ender in tandem with Oathkeeper. This bow is a top exotic in the game due to its over-penetration damage, and Oathkeeper adds roughly a 150% damage buff when holding the bow for a few extra seconds.

The subclass has a general gameplay loop of getting Restoration from Healing Grenade and Radiant from Acrobat's Dodge. Acrobat's Dodge and the Radiant timer will get refunded from a precision kill with Weighted Throwing Knife, and the timers for Radiant and Restoration are reset by solar weapon kills with Ember of Empyrean.

Use as many Kinetic Weapon Surge mods as possible to maximize Wish-Ender's damage. To make Orbs of Power for armor charge stacks, land Wish-Ender kills with Kinetic Siphon or get a kill after Acrobat's Ddoge with Reaper.  With Orbs on the ground, Acrobat's Dodge will pick them up with use of Powerful Attraction. This will keep up Wish-Ender's increased damage and even increase Golden Gun's damage as it is increased by Kinetic Surge mods.
GameplayLoop:
Grant Radiant to yourself and allies with Acrobat's Dodge
Get Cure and Restoration with Healing Grenade
Get a precision kill with Weighted Throwing Knife to refund Acrobat's Dodge and melee
Use Wish-Ender for general ad clear and Explosive Personality to reset Radiant and Restoration's timers
Use Acrobat's Dodge to become Radiant once again and collect nearby Orbs of Power for Surge mods
Use Golden Gun which is buffed by Surge mods

Primary.Name: Kept Confidence
Primary.Info: Any Strand weapon for Unravel

Chest.Name: Heart of Inmost Light
Chest.Info: Using an ability (grenade, melee, or Barricade) empowers the other two abilities. Empowered means abilities have faster regen, melees and grenades do more damage, and Barricades have more hit points.

HowItWorks:
This week's Grandmaster is the Birthplace and it has Overload and Unstoppable champions! This makes Arc Builds stand out right off the bat thanks to the Flashbang grenade being able to stun both with ease. So this build is built around getting your grenade back very quickly and also using your strong weapons to apply unravel, Jolt and threadlings for a really fun show of colors and damage! 

Indebted Kindness is a new rocket sidearm this season and I highly recommend you guys get one because it is one of the best special weapons in the game now and with VoltShot it just allows infinite Jolt since it is so easy to secure kills with this weapon! We also add Heart of Inmost Light to keep our ability uptime to the max so we can get those Blinding, Jolting grenades back as quickly as possible with the Build.
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Flashbang Grenade to apply Blind and Jolt to groups of enemies
Use your Thruster next to proc Heart of Inmost Light
Slay Blinded enemies with Indebted Kindness
Reload after a kill to activate Voltshot to apply Jolt over and over
Your Grenade will be back very quickly 
Grab any orbs of power for Unraveling Orbs and healing
Then use your Strand Primary to apply Unravel every once in a while in rooms or to a boss or Champion

Primary.Name: Gunnora's Axe
Primary.Info:
A nice to have, this shotgun of the Arc element that'll benefit from the Arc Surge mods and No Backup Plans damage buffs. Recommended perks are Auto-Loading Holster and Vorpal Weapon.

Having a slug shotgun serves as a backup plan for DPS when out of Acrius ammo, despite the exotic armor implying this build doesn't have a backup plan.

Chest.Name: No Backup Plans
Chest.Info: With an Overshield active, shotguns receive a 35% damage buff and refresh the Overshield on shotgun kills. It also gives a slight boost to shotgun reload speed, helping DPS even more.

HowItWorks:
This is a very easy to use DPS build that utilizes the whopping 35% damage buff that No Backup Plans gives to shotguns when you have an Overshield. To acquire an Overshield cast Barricade, stand in Ward of Dawn, hit an enemy with Shield Throw, or get multiple shotgun kills with melee energy available. From there any shotgun kill will refresh the Overshield.

The main weapon of the build is Legend of Acrius which hits like a truck with damage bonuses from Surge mods and No Backup Plans. Slug Shotguns are an optional addition to the build as well if you are comfortable with hot swapping them. The mods serve to increase the handling and reload speed of Legend of Acrius to improve its usability.

The rest of the fragments serve to boost the neutral game, improves ease of use, and allows you to weaken targets for a 15% damage boost. Scatter Grenades weaken targets with Echo of Undermining which is used for high health targets before using a shotgun. Echo of Starvation grants Devour on Orb of Power pickup. Lastly Echo of Persistence increases the duration of Overshields and Devour, making it much easier to upkeep the great offensive and defensive benefits these provide.
GameplayLoop:
Activate Barricade for an Overshield
If boss has low mobility and protection is needed, cast Ward of Dawn
Throw Scatter Grenade to weaken boss
Use Legend of Acrius and/or Slug Shotguns for DPS
Refresh Overshield by stepping back into the Barricade or using Shield Throw

Primary.Name: Nezarec's Whisper
Primary.Info: A glaive combined with Vesper of Radius turns you into a Tank! An Arc glaive works the best to play into the Subclass for the Blinding Fragment

Chest.Name: Vesper of Radius
Chest.Info: Rifts periodically release Arc shockwaves. Final blows with these shockwaves create an Arc explosion. While an Arc subclass is equipped, the shockwaves and subsequent explosions blind nearby targets. Rift energy recharges faster when you are surrounded by targets.

HowItWorks:
This week's Psi Ops Grandmaster has proven to be quite difficult for a lot of Guardians out there. I would argue the opening payload and the first room are just as difficult as the boss room. So for this episode of Does This Build Carry, we need a Build that can help take all the aggro from the enemies, this includes those Unstoppable Champions but more importantly the Hive Guardian boss with his godly tracking void Shields. 

Well as you can see we can straight face tank those Shields for our teammates. This means they won't get killed by them and just unload their damage safely from wherever they are.

On top of being able to tank everything so well. We are going to be infinitely blinding everything for amazing crowd control. Our rift creates blinding pulses as long as it's on the field and we can get it back in seconds! This includes stunning those pesky unstoppable Champions with those blinding pulses so it takes them out of the fight since the rift lasts so long. Then we add in our Flashbang grenade for a ranged source of blinding that also will jolt everything for us. 

We give infinite arc souls to ourselves and the team which are amplified, so they add a lot of extra damage to everyone on the team. And then we pop a ton of Chaos reach supers adding more jolt and damage and using our hard-hitting heavy weapon to dish out great damage and apply scorch and ignitions. Oh and we still apply unravel to everything and pop out a ton of threadlings for more crowd control and damage.
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Rift to create your Arc Soul and Blind enemies
Hold Block with your Glaive and shoot enemies
That combo alone has blinded everything and made you a Tank
Throw your Flashbang Grenade when needed which Jolts enemies
Your Rift, Grenade, and Arc special kills all Blind!
Use Chaos reach when you have it
Rinse and repeat!

Primary.Name: Tractor Cannon
Primary.Info: When dealing with Bosses or high health Targets, Tractor Cannon is great because it suppresses enemies and debuffs them by 30%, allowing our throwing hammer to do 30% increase damage to enemies.

Chest.Name: Synthoceps
Chest.Info: Synthoceps have always been a staple for the Titan in Destiny 2 and it still holds its power as one of the best Exotics in the game allowing you to do 200% increased damage with our melee abilities!

HowItWorks:
This Build combines a few staple items in Destiny 2 like the Exotic gauntlets Synthoceps with the Solar Titan subclass. This leads to a gameplay loop that is to throw your mini hammer over and over at everything you see. You become unkillable because of Sunspots that apply Restoration and deal great damage with Throwing Hammer thanks to Roaring Flames x3 from the subclass. 

This build is all about that hammer and just using it to destroy everything you see on sight. This is probably the strongest build in Destiny 2 when it comes down to ranking them because it needs no artifact mods. It is a self sustained power house that can solo just about anything in Destiny 2.
GameplayLoop:
Use Throwing Hammer repeatedly
You will create a Sunspot that grants Restoration on Hammer kills
Every hammer kill stacks Roaring Flames to times 3 for extra damage
Activate Healing Grenade if you need Restoration before jumping in
Debuff a higher health target with Tractor Cannon if needed

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: Strand weapon to take advantage of unraveling rounds and can roll with demolitionist for grenade regen and hatchling for threadling generation.

Chest.Name: Swarmers
Chest.Info: Threadlings can now apply the unravel debuff to damaged enemies. Destroying a tangle creates two threadlings.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to have as many threadlings as possible.

Everything in your build will have the ability to make threadlings. Your grenade is able to make three because of the threadling grenade. Your rift is able to make three because of weaver’s call alongside releasing any perched ones. Your tangles can create two when they are destroyed because of your exotic Swarmers. Your weapon can create them by getting kills because of hatchling and the fragment thread of rebirth. Alongside all that, when doing damage to unraveled targets you also can make threadlings with the artifact perk horde shuttle.

Unravel can come from three different sources. First off is your exotic Swarmers, so when a threadling damages an enemy, they become unraveled. Next is your melee arcane needle, when you use it on an enemy, they become unraveled. Finally, the artifact perk unraveling orbs, when picking up an orb you grant your strand weapon unraveling rounds.

Picking up orbs will also grant you woven mail from the fragment thread of warding.

Threadlings won’t only be able to apply unravel to enemies, but they will also have the ability to travel further and do more damage because of the fragment thread of evolution. On top of that, with the aspect the wanderer, when your threadlings get kills they can make tangles. Alongside that, the wanderer will also allow you to suspend enemies when you destroy the tangle as well.

The final fragment to round this build out is thread of generation, so when doing any damage, you generate threadling grenade energy. Pairing that with a weapon that can roll with demolitionist means you get a crazy fast grenade recharge rate, which in return means more threadlings.
GameplayLoop:
Get kills with your weapon to make an orb and a threadling
Pick up orb to grant unraveling rounds and woven mail
Apply unravel to all enemies with your weapon and your threadlings
Make threadlings by shooting the unraveled enemies
Throw your grenade to make threadlings
Shoot tangles to make threadlings
Use super to make threadlings
Use your class ability to make threadlings and to release perched threadlings on you

Primary.Name: Malfeasance
Primary.Info: With the addition of a catalyst that grants Vorpal Weapon, Malfeasance is a great source of DPS when paired with Lucky Pants.

Chest.Name: Lucky Pants
Chest.Info:
A great and easy source of DPS while utilizing a primary weapon.

Upon readying a Hand Cannon it will get a 60% additive damage buff for every hit for 5.5 seconds which caps at 600%. After the 10th shot you will have a 600% damage boost on top of Malfeasance's Vorpal Weapon, Surge mods and other damage buffs. Malfeasance can get in 17 shots during this time frame.

HowItWorks:
This build is entirely based around dealing DPS. There are a few major points that makes this build deal damage. Lucky Pants, Malfeasance, Apex Predator, applying Jolt, and being Amplified.

Lucky Pants and Malfeasance are designed for single target damage. Upon readying Malfeasance, it will receive a 60% damage buff for every shot hit for a 5.5 second duration and caps out at 600% bonus damage. This will stack on top of Surge mods and Malfeasance's catalyst of Vorpal Weapon. You can either run 3 Kinetic Surge mods or 2 Kinetic Surge Mods and 1 Solar Surge mod to also give a damage buff to Apex Predator the other important weapon of the build. Marksman's Dodge will allow you to automatically reload as well as pick up nearby Orbs of Power to fuel the Surge mods with help from the Powerful Attraction mod.

Apex Predator is important because it is what you'll be using when Lucky Pants is on cooldown with the Out of Luck debuff. This is a 10 second timeframe which other weapons will be utilized before switching back to Malfeasance. Apex Predator has Bait and Switch which lasts 10 seconds as well (11 w/ Enhanced perk). When Out of Luck occurs, swap to your secondary, shoot one shot, then swap to Apex Predator and use that weapon until Malfeasance/Lucky Pants can be used again.

What this subclass adds is the ability to Jolt for extra damage and become Amplified reload very quickly to get the most out of Apex Predator and reload Malfeasance before swapping off of it. Jolt targets with the use of Pulse Grenade with Spark of Shock that has an extended duration from Spark of Magnitude as well as when using the Gathering Storm super. Jolting a target is very important as it adds additional damage for everyone who is shooting the Jolted target. This build can also add even more damage if a teammate is using Witherhoard, as Malfeasance will then deal more damage.

When Amplified you'll have quicker ready and reload speeds. Become Amplified by defeating a Jolted target or hitting a target with Disorienting Blow. You can also increase reload speed with just a melee hit from Spark of Frequency.

The weakness of the build is in its neutral game. Overcome this by playing generally safe and utilizing your one source of survivability and crowd control when you need it most in Disorienting Blow. This melee will Blind the target and make you Amplified as well. Being Amplified adds survivability with the Electric Armor artifact mod for increased damage resistance.
GameplayLoop:
Cast Gathering Storm to apply Jolt and deal damage with secondary weapon equipped
If able, melee a target to become Amplified for faster reload speeds
Swap to Malfeasance to activate Lucky Pants' buffs
Shoot Malfeasance until Lucky Pants' timer ends
Reload Malfeasance
Swap to and shoot secondary weapon
Swap to Apex Predator
Shoot 2 shots from Apex Predator, the first will activate Bait and Switch
Use Marksman's Dodge to reload rocket
Shoot Apex Predator
Reload cancel by throwing Pulse Grenade to reapply Jolt
Continue using Apex Predator until Bait and Switch subsides
Swap back to Malfeasance and repeat

Primary.Name: Arbalest
Primary.Info: Great for damage and Barrier Champions

Chest.Name: Starfire Protocol
Chest.Info: Double fusion grenade charges. Fusion grenades refund class ability. Empowered final blows and damage grant increased grenade energy.

HowItWorks:
This build is super strong and extremely easy to use. It pairs well with mostly any weapon combo as well if you want to change things up!

Starfire Protocol still offers great damage output through double fusion grenades often allowing for high damage ignitions as well.

The regen through ember of benevolence, grenade kickstart, innervation, bomber, and damage while in our well of radiance offers really good uptime on our grenades.

Grenade final blows also replenish our rift and give us healing through cure so we can stay alive even in endgame settings.
GameplayLoop:
Use Fusion Grenades
Drop rifts for regen through bomber and ember of benevolence
Collect orbs (this is also done through using rift)
Throw Fusion Grenades
Repeat

Primary.Name: Legend of Acrius
Primary.Info: A good close range option for high burst damage to pair with this build.

Chest.Name: Liar's Handshake
Chest.Info:
Liar's Handshake maximizes the melee damage of Combination Blow for an all out aggressive build.

Assassin's Cowl is a good alternative for a safer style of play as a melee kill will heal you and make you invisible. This is at the cost of less melee damage.

HowItWorks:
Arc Hunter is all about building up Combination Blow for high melee damage. The general gameplay loop involves cycling a melee attack and dodging near enemies as one ability will refund the other, and melee kills will build up stacks of Combination Blow for increased melee damage. This is augmented by the exotic Liar's Handshake which increases melee damage even further. Assassin's Cowl is an alternative option for survivability as it will heal and make you invisible after a melee kill or finisher.

At its baseline the build has survivability from damage resistance from Spark of Resistance and Electric Armor as well as healing from defeating targets with combination blow or picking up Orbs of Power. Gambler's Dodge will pickup Orbs of Power with the Powerful Attraction mod, allowing you to seamlessly heal when performing the string of dodges and melees.

The weapons that pair best with this build are shotguns with the perk One-Two Punch and Legend of Acrius. This is a good means of additional burst damage for higher health targets because at some point you will have to use weapons as higher health targets will survive melee attacks.
GameplayLoop:
Dodge to activate Lethal Current
Melee an enemy to build a stacks of Combination Blow and Jolt the target; a melee kill will create an Orb of Power
Continue cycling dodge and melee to build up combination blow to its maximum of 3 stacks
Utilize Gathering Storm and/or Pulse Grenades for higher health targets

Primary.Name: Final Warning
Primary.Info: This Exotic allows us to apply the Unravel Debuff even after Season of the Wish is over. But during this season any Strand weapon works.

Chest.Name: Briarbinds
Chest.Info: Your Void Souls have a longer duration. They also gain escalating damage and durability as they defeat targets. You can retrieve your Void Souls by interacting with them, allowing them to be redeployed.

HowItWorks:
This build is powerful and really fun at the same time, and it probably has the coolest colors and explosions you'll ever see in destiny 2. 

Everything starts with your weapon choices and this is SO Important because they will apply all the debuffs we need to allow our Subclass and Exotic Armor Piece to shine when we combine it all

Follow the Gameplay loop when using your abilities and applying your debuffs. This will keep your abilities up and allow you to slay out using your weapons!
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Rift to create your Void Soul
Shoot an enemy to send the Void Soul out
Throw your grenade into the weakened area of the Void Soul
The Void Soul or the Grenade will get a kill and proc Devour for us
Grab an Orb of Power to proc Unraveling Orbs
Use your Strand Weapon to apply Unravel
Use your Jolt weapon to get kills next since we no longer need to apply unravel
Repeat using your Rift, Grenade and Jolt Weapon.
You only need to apply Unravel once in rooms since damage from the Void Soul spreads it around for us

Primary.Name: IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3
Primary.Info: This is an abilities based build, but a good primary weapon to have is one with the perk Voltshot for the benefits applying Jolt provides.

Chest.Name: Point-Contact Cannon Brace
Chest.Info:
Allows Thunderclap to be used on a loop as defeating a target with the melee ability restores it. Use near targets to Jolt them as well. This allows for a continuous cycle of Jolting targets and using Thunderclap which will then create an Ionic Trace from Spark of Ions.

Alternatively, you can use An Insurmountable Skullfort and swap your big damage Thunderclaps for more frequent ones.  Skullfort will refresh your melee on kill and provide health regeneration.  Be sure to stack effects that boost you when you get melee kills, like Hands-On, Heavy Handed and Impact Induction.

HowItWorks:
The newly buffed Point-Contact Cannon Brace has greatly increased the efficacy of Thunderclap. This is a very offensive build that relies on the melee ability to outright kill targets to refund itself and/or leaving enemies with a small amount of health to be quickly cleaned up. Melee Kickstart mods hasten the melee's cooldown when it does not kill an enemy as a contingency plan. The melee will also kickstart health regeneration due to the Knockout aspect. Survivability is supplemented by Electric Armor from the artifact and Spark of Resistance.

Survivability is a weak point of this build despite these few means of health regeneration and damage resistance, so be careful in diving head first into harder hitting enemies at lower health. An Insurmountable Skullfort is a good option if you are having difficulty with survivability due to its health regeneration capabilities. This exotic offers a similar playstyle that sacrifices the high damage punches for the ability to punch more often.

When using Thunderclap near enemies they will be Jolted. This in turn feeds Pulse Grenade because Spark of Ions will give Ionic Traces for defeating Jolted targets.

Pulse Grenade is self sufficient in that it will create Ionic Traces on its own and its cooldown is greatly reduced from the Lightning Strikes Twice mod. The grenade is a great supplement to Thundercrash for high health targets.
GameplayLoop:
Use Thunderclap in groups of enemies
Clean up targets who are Jolted and have a small amount of health remaining with Thunderclap or a weapon
Use Thundercrash and Pulse Grenade for higher health targets
Keep Clapping away

Primary.Name: Wish-Keeper
Primary.Info: Deals 50% bonus damage to Suspended enemies.

Chest.Name: Foetracer
Chest.Info: This exotic increases weapon damage to weapons matching your subclass when damaging them with an ability. This allows Wish-Keeper to deal 193 damage on a precision shot.

HowItWorks:
This build allows you to one-shot enemies with the Wish-Keeper exotic bow. The first step of the process is to get an enemy suspended with an ability. This is done with Ensnaring Slam or Shackle Grenade. If this is done with Ensnaring Slam it is ideal as it will create an Orb of Power on kill from the Reaper mod. If this is on cooldown, you will have 2 Shackle Grenade charges from the Widow's Silk aspect.

If an enemy is hit by Shackle Grenade or Ensnaring Slam they will activate the perk in Foetracer which will increase Strand weapon damage. This damage bonus plus the bonus damage of Wish-Keeper hitting Suspended enemies will make it deal 193 damage in the Crucible. This is enough to one-shot low-resilience enemies, but it is enough to kill because Ensnaring Slam and Shackle Grenade deal a small amount of damage. It is important to know that the Suspend from Wish-Keeper does NOT activate Foetracer and does not work with this combo.

The first fragment of the build are Thread of Continuity to suspend enemies for longer. Next is Thread of Generation to get grenade energy back quicker. Thread of Wisdom to create an Orb of Power on a kill of a suspended enemy. Lastly is Thread of Warding to get Woven Mail when you pick up an Orb of Power. Two Orbs of Power are created if you use Ensnaring Slam and one with Shackle Grenade. Orbs activate Woven Mail, heal from Recuperation, and give ability energy back.
GameplayLoop:
Ensnaring Slam or Shackle Grenade an enemy to Suspend them
One-shot the enemy with Wish-Keeper and create an Orb of Power
Finish the target with Treaded Spike if you did not hit a precision shot
Pick up the Orb of Power for Woven Mail, to heal with Recuperation, and gain class/grenade energy
Repeat

Primary.Name: Coldheart
Primary.Info: This Trace Rifle synergizes with Arc builds very well due to its creation of Ionic Traces. Ionic Traces work well with Warlocks especially as they track to you, allowing you to remain safely in your rift.

Chest.Name: Fallen Sunstar
Chest.Info:
Ionic Trace creation is a strong component of arc builds that give ability energy. This exotic increases their tracking, efficacy, and gives allies ability energy from Ionic Traces as well.

Potential replacements are Crown of Tempests for ability generation from Jolted targets or Getaway Artist to lean more into Arc Souls.

HowItWorks:
This build offers a little bit of everything. Good wave clear through the use of the buffed Arc Soul, single target damage with Pulse Grenade and Coldheart, survivability with the Electric Armor seasonal artifact, and crowd control with the blinding of Spark of Beacons and Spark of Brilliance.

The general rotation of the build involves starting off with a Rift to have access to the highly buffed Arc Soul. Use the Arc Soul, Pulse Grenade, and Coldheart to kill enemies; in which the latter two create Orbs of Power and Ionic Traces. This will supplement ability energy, and with the Powerful Attraction mod, the next Rift used will collect all nearby Orbs of Power allowing you to play safer in cover in a Rift.

The seasonal artifact mods tie this all together with Coldheart being able to stun Overload Champions, Thunderous Retort increasing super damage, Lightning Strikes Twice increasing grenade uptime, Shock and Awe for spreading Jolt, and Electric Armor for survivability while being Amplified.
GameplayLoop:
Cast Rift for healing and an Arc Soul
Utilize Coldheart to kill enemies and create Ionic Traces for ability energy
Create Orbs of Power with Pulse Grenade kills
Cast Rift to pick up Orbs of Power with the Powerful Attraction mod to activate Arc Weapon Surge mods

Primary.Name: Tractor Cannon
Primary.Info: Can have a tractor cannon here to swap to if need be. Would need to use Zaouli’s Bane for a solar hand cannon to free up the exotic slot.

Chest.Name: Wormgod Caress
Chest.Info: Melee final blows increase melee damage and weapon damage for a short duration.

HowItWorks:
This build is easy to use and revolves around keeping stacks of Wormgod Caress up high.

The increased melee damage and increased ability damage through roaring flames allow you to easily 1 - 2 hit most enemies in the game with ease.

Sunspots offer healing over time through restoration, orbs of power offer healing with recuperation, and grabbing our hammer after hits grants cure.

All this allows us to stay alive in endgame content while also steam rolling most enemies due to the stacking damage increases.
GameplayLoop:
Get ability final blows to stack roaring flames for increased ability damage.
Get melee final blows to increase wormgod stacks for melee damage.
Throwing hammer is used for harder-hitting melees and healing
Base melee can be used to IGNITE enemies and help add clear.

Primary.Name: Final Warning
Primary.Info: Weapons are completely up to you, but a strong Strand weapon only helps as it can get unraveling rounds to play into the overall build

Chest.Name: Radiant Dance Machines
Chest.Info: Radiant Dance Machines got a nice change in season 21 and this is to allow you to extend the buff timer up to 10 seconds by getting kills. You can get the kills from any source, making it very easy to get a kill in 10 seconds to extend the timer.

HowItWorks:
This Build combines a ton of new buffs to the Strand Hunter in Season 21 to make for an awesome gameplay loop and basically makes you invulnerable as well. With the Buffs to the melee ability, Threaded Spike, you can throw rope dart over and over to make for some great fun that also happens to be very strong! 

Combine this with Radiant Dance Machines that also received a buff where kills keep refreshing its timer, giving infinite melee abilities and infinite dodges as well! The build still brings 2 Shackle Grenades for crowd control and with in a few mods it really sends it over the top because these mods will provide infinite Woven Mail and Healing on every single dodge activation from auto-collecting the Orbs of Power on the ground created from Heavy Handed and Reaper.
GameplayLoop:
Start off by using the buffed Melee ability to sever targets 
Activate your class ability to proc the Threaded Specter aspect and Radiant Dance Machines
This will give unlimited Melee abilities and class abilities that can be looped
Use Melee Spike to destroy everything and keep dodging to get it back.
Every dodge procs the Powerful Attraction Mod. This gives Woven Mail and heals as well from Recuperation because there will always be a Orb of Power on the ground from Heavy Handed or Reaper Mod

Primary.Name: Wish-Ender
Primary.Info: Used to scout for enemies with its ADS draw and deals a massive burst of damage. This is used to team shot with enemies or to swap to a hand cannon for a clean up.

Chest.Name: Oathkeeper
Chest.Info: Using Oathkeeper allows you to keep the bow indefinitely held for wall-hacks and increases the damage for an easy cleanup kill.

HowItWorks:
This build is based on using Wish-Ender to scout enemies and then kill them with a quick swap. Oathkeeper exotic gauntlets allow you to hold the bow indefinitely to search for enemies through walls. Once you have found an enemy you shoot them with Wish-Ender for a precision hit over 150 damage, and then swap to a 120 RPM Hand Cannon with Quickdraw to finish them with a body shot.

When using a build like this you are normally exposed to being rushed down by close-range weapons. This is countered by the use of Threaded Specter and Threadling Grenades. You will get 2 charges of Threadling Grenades from the Widow's Silk aspect. If an enemy is rushing you down throw a Threadling Grenade at your feet and dodge backwards to create space and spawn a Threaded Specter.

The Fragment of the build that is mandatory is Thread of Evolution to buff the Threadlings you create. Thread of Generation is nice to have to get more grenades as is Thread of Ascent to have better in-air accuracy when you are backing away from a rushing enemy. The final Fragment is optional and is best used to boost a stat.
GameplayLoop:
Hold a Wish-Ender shot to get wall-hacks
Hit an enemy with Wish-Ender
Swap to 120 RPM Hand Cannon with Quickdraw and finish the target
If getting rushed down throw a Threadling Grenade and Dodge to summon a Threaded Specter

Primary.Name: Funnelweb
Primary.Info: Fast firing Void Weapons are best for this build as they proc the Volatile Rounds from Gyrfalcon's Hauberks at a greater frequency.

Chest.Name: Gyrfalcon's Hauberk
Chest.Info:
Grants Void Weapons Volatile Rounds for 10 seconds after exiting invisibility. This effect will proc no matter the means in which invisibility was initially activated.

This exotic also grants bonus damage and a reserve Overshield for you and nearby allies when performing a finisher while invisible.

HowItWorks:
Becoming invisible is the the starting point of the build. Trapper's Ambush is used because of the ability to make teammates invisible alongside you and grants an extra 2 seconds of invisibility when using Quickfall compared to Vanishing Step. Invisibility is so important because the exotic used, Gyrfalcon's Hauberk gives all of its benefits when performing a finisher while invisible or simply exiting invisibility. When exiting invisibility you will gain Volatile Rounds for your Void Weapons. When performing a finisher while invisible the exotic will give a damage boost and an Overshield to you and nearby allies. The Fragment Echo of Obscurity compliments this well as performing a finisher will make you invisible, allowing this loop to be easily repeated.

The other Fragments of the build are Echo of Starvation for gaining Devour on an Orb of Power or Void Breach pickup, Echo of Persistence to extend the duration of Overshields, Invisibility, and Devour, and lastly Echo of Harvest to create an Orb of Power and Void Breach on a weakened enemy kill. This final Fragment pairs very well with the Season 21 Artifact mod, Unto the Breach which creates a Void Breach when defeating Void debuffed targets. this effect will occur essentially every 4 seconds as that is the Void Breach's generation cooldown. The other Artifact mod to look at is Protective Breach which will grant a Void Overshield when picking up one of the endless Void Breaches this build creates.

The general gameplay of this build is to utilize dodge to activate Reaper and reset the cooldown of Snare Bomb, Quickfall or throw Snare Bomb to make yourself and potentially allies invisible, then use a finisher on an enemy to chain invisibility and/or utilize void weapons for the Volatile Rounds they create. Either way you will become invisible once again via Echo of Obscurity or Stylish Executioner. 

This loop will create Orbs of Power and Void Breaches that give armor charge, and the former of which can be collected by dodging because of use of the Powerful Attraction mod. With the full suite of mods and Orbs on the ground, Gambler's Dodge will refund Smoke Bomb, proc Reaper, give a 10% Void weapon damage buff, fully heal you from Recuperation, acquire Devour, and refund grenade energy.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Quickfall or Snare Bomb to become invisible
Use finisher on an enemy to chain being invisible and receive an Overshield and damage buff
Exit invisibility for Volatile Rounds
Kill an enemy with Volatile Rounds to become invisible once more from Stylish Executioner and create a Void Breach and Orb of Power
Dodge near an enemy to pickup all Orbs of Power on the ground which will fully refund Smoke Bomb, proc Reaper, give a 10% Void weapon damage buff, fully heal you from Recuperation, acquire Devour, and refund grenade energy
Continue the loop using the automatic invisibility from Stylish Executioner or a finisher with Echo of Obscurity; if neither are available utilize Quickfall/Snare Bomb

Primary.Name: Tommy's Matchbook
Primary.Info: With the Changes to Tommy’s we can now survive while holding down the trigger as long as we have restoration x1. This can be from your Healing Rift, Healing Grenade, and Well of Radiance. We will have these available all the time to keep us healthy!

Chest.Name: Phoenix Protocol
Chest.Info: Kills and assists we make while in our well of radiance return super energy, we easily end our well with about 75% super back with no orb pickups. This is straight kills and damage while in our well.

HowItWorks:
This Solar Warlock Build is all about being able to help your fireteam through difficult content like a Grandmaster Nightfall. The goal is to have nearly 100% uptime on our Well of Radiance. We have 3 ways to heal with this Build and these 3 ways can all heal our teammates too! 

We start off with Tommy’s Matchbook as our Exotic. Since the Burn was changed to where it doesn’t do as much damage to us anymore, restoration x1 is enough to counter the burn. This means we can lay on the trigger and do great Primary Weapon damage which in turn gives us the most Super energy back on Damage dealt. Since we will be in a Well of Radiance dealing even more damage and combining it with Phoenix Protocol as our Exotic Armor, we can easily have over 75% of our Super back after we use it. 

In between Well uses we keep throwing our Healing Grenade and using our Healing Rifts. This will Proc Ember of Benevolence to keep up abilities and we proc Ember of Singeing for infinite Class ability with Tommy’s Matchbook since it Scorches on hit as part of its update a while back. So as soon as you have your Well you use it! You will be dropping 15 Wells easily in Grandmasters for your team!
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Rift to have Restoration
Shoot Tommy’s at targets; the scorch from Tommy’s will give us our Rift back from Ember of Singeing
Use your Healing Grenade for Restoration x2 when needed
Use your melee ability right after your grenade for an instant ignition and to increase our restoration x2 easily with ember of empyreon
Use Well of Radiance when it's available. You will get 50% back just from kills and assists
You will easily get another 25% while in your well from the Primary Weapon damage of Tommy’s Matchbook since Exotic Primaries give the most Super energy back based on damage dealt.
Keep dropping your well the moment you get it!

Primary.Name: Tommy's Matchbook
Primary.Info: This weapon roughly double damage after firing 20 shots at the cost of self damaging. Every 5 shots this weapon will apply 21 scorch stacks to an enemy. This will lead to roughly double damage and Ignitions with sustained fire and activating the effects of the Ember of Singing Fragment.

Chest.Name: Mantle of Battle Harmony
Chest.Info: With super fully charged, landing a solar weapon final blow will grant a 25% weapon damage bonus for 10 seconds. This buff doesn't stack with Surge mods, but it stacks with Well of Radiance and Radiant.

HowItWorks:
Tommy's Matchbook benefits from sustained fire by applying 21 scorch stacks every 5 shots and gaining a 99% damage buff after firing 20 shots. This is balanced out by the weapon self damaging once the latter  is active. This build counteracts that by utilizing Healing Grenade and Ember of Empyrean. By using Healing Grenade before utilizing the weapon, you'll have restoration which will be refreshed by landing a solar weapon kill from Ember of Empyrean.

Mantle of Battle Harmony is the another damage buff used here, and grants a 25% damage buff when super is fully charged after a solar weapon kill. This promotes playing with super active for the additional buff until a damage phase or when a high health target needs to be taken out. When a damage phase comes around use Well of Radiance which will stack with the buff from Mantle of Battle Harmony, allowing you to deal massive damage while this two buffs overlap one another.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Healing Grenade to activate restoration
Get kills with Tommy's Matchbook to upkeep restoration with Ember of Empyrean
With sustained fire from Tommy's Matchbook gain increased damage and negate the self burn with restoration
With super fully charged, utilize the damage buff from Mantle of Battle Harmony
Cast super for a 25% damage bonus from Well of Radiance which will stack with the remaining 25% damage buff from Mantle of Battle Harmony

Primary.Name: The Navigator
Primary.Info: Use the alternate fire mode to create a Grapple Point to infinitely Grapple Melee off of to deal damage.

Chest.Name: Wormgod Caress
Chest.Info: With max stacks, you can get up to 275% melee damage bonus for your Grapple Melee and Frenzied Blade.

HowItWorks:
This build abuses the strength of Grapple Melee on the Titan. The buff to Wormgod Caress allows up to a 275% increase in melee damage with max stacks. Pair this with a One-Two Punch shotgun to increase by another 100%. The final boost to melee damage is Banner of War which grants a bonus 40% to melee damage when active. Overall this gives over a 10x multiplier to melee damage.

The purpose of The Navigator is its catalyst which allows you to create a Grapple Point with its alt-fire mode. This allows you to repeatedly Grapple to the created point and Grapple Melee a target for damage.

First, build up stacks of Wormgod Caress and Banner of War. Then create the Grapple Point. From there you continuously hit the target with the One-Two Punch shotgun and then Grapple Melee. With Thread of Ascent there is no need to worry about reloading the shotgun, and you can continue this loop until the Grapple Point vanishes.

The neutral game of this build is also very good in the strength of Frenzied Blade for clearing waves of enemies. Continuously create Tangles for melee energy and continue this cycle.
GameplayLoop:
Get Melee kills to build up stacks of Wormgod Caress, Banner of War, and create Orbs of Power
Alt-Reload with The Navigator and create a Grapple Point
Fire shotgun at target to activate One-Two Punch
Grapple to Navigator's Grapple Point
Grapple Melee
Repeat steps 3-5

Primary.Name: Trinity Ghoul
Primary.Info: A great Arc weapon for clearing groups of enemies, with Spark of Discharge each kill has a chance to create an Ionic Trace.

Chest.Name: Vesper of Radius
Chest.Info: Your Rift will recharge faster when surrounded by enemies and emit an Arc shockwave every 5 seconds which deals 200 damage. When an enemy is killed by the shockwave they will explode and deal an extra 100 damage and blind nearby enemies. This is great for area damage and crowd control with the blind effect.

HowItWorks:
With Vesper of Radiance being the exotic used here, the build revolves around the use of Rift. With this exotic Rift will emit shockwaves that deal damage to enemies and if an enemy is killed by the shockwave they will explode, damage nearby enemies, and blind them. Landing a precision kill on a blinded enemy will create an Ionic Trace from Electrostatic Mind and another blinding explosion with Spark of Brilliance.

Trinity Ghoul is the exotic used and is good for landing these precision kills as well as chain lightning for clearing out waves of enemies. Cycle using Rift and Trinity Ghoul for AoE damage and continuously blinding enemies.

The mods of the build are for getting back Rift as quickly as possible. Melee and grenade hits, collecting Orbs of Power, and casting Rift will give back Rift energy. Use these methods to your advantage to have a very high uptime of a very buffed Rift.
GameplayLoop:
Cast a Rift near a group of enemies to deal damage to via shockwaves and summon Arc Soul
An enemy killed by the shockwave will explode, which will blind and damage nearby enemies
Get a precision kill on a blinded enemy to create an Ionic Trace as well as another blinding explosion with Spark of Brilliance
Collect Ionic Traces for ability energy

Primary.Name: Rose
Primary.Info:
Any Hand Cannon with Quickdraw is best for the Kinetic Slot to clean up an enemy with a body shot after Lethophobia breaks their shield. 

Opening Shot is the ideal second perk as this build only requires one shot from a Hand Cannon to finish the target.

Chest.Name: The Dragon's Shadow
Chest.Info: Increases movement speed and weapon handling after dodging. This gives a 0.7x ready and stow duration multiplier allowing you to hot swap from Lethophobia to a Hand Cannon even faster.

HowItWorks:
The abilities and subclass of the build are rather flexible as the main components of the build are in the weapons. 

Lethophobia can roll Disruption Break which increases Kinetic Damage to a target by 50% for 5.5 seconds. This allows you to swap to a kinetic Hand Cannon for a clean-up kill with a body shot. Ideally, the Hand Cannon should have the perk Quickdraw to give it improved ready time to do this as quickly as possible.

It is important to know that this increase in kinetic damage is from all sources, even teammates. This can be used in team scenarios such as Trials where you can team shot with an enemy to quickly kill an enemy.

The Dragon's Shadow is the exotic in this build as it further improves Weapon Handling with a scalar, allowing for even quicker swapping on top of Quickdraw.

As mentioned before this can work with any Class and abilities, but Solar Hunter is chosen as its ability to use The Dragon's Shadow and it being able to cover those rushing you down with Throwing Knives. This build's weakness is in its close-range capabilities, and Throwing Knives paired with a Bow and Hand Cannon shot help cover this weakness.
GameplayLoop:
Headshot an enemy with Lethophobia to activate Disruption Break
Swap to Hand Cannon
Hit the target to finish them off with a body shot or headshot
You can also finish off an enemy with a Throwing Knife to become Radiant

Primary.Name: Outbreak Perfected
Primary.Info: Precision hits spawn Nanites, with Chromatic Fire precision kills will make nearby enemies weakened, and the Nanites spawned will then deal more damage to nearby enemies making this combo fantastic for clearing groups of enemies.

Chest.Name: Chromatic Fire
Chest.Info: This exotic will make precision kills from a kinetic weapon create an explosion apply a status effect damaged by the explosion. In the case of a void subclass, these enemies will be weakened.

HowItWorks:
This build is great for clearing waves of enemies with the unique combo of Outbreak Perfected and Chromatic Fire. With a void class Chromatic Fire will make an explosion that damages and weakens nearby enemies from a precision kill. Outbreak Perfected will spawn Nanites on precision hits. This combination will lead to one precision kill weakening all nearby enemies that will be attacked by Nanites that deal increased damage.

If a weakened enemy is killed by a precision hit they will spawn an Orb of Power and a Void Breach with Echo of Harvest. Pick up the Orb to activate Devour and pick up the Breach for ability energy. With Devour active continue utilizing Outbreak Perfected to upkeep the healing and rolling over red bar enemies.
GameplayLoop:
Land a precision kill with Outbreak Perfected, weaken nearby targets making Nanites deal more damage, and spawn in an Orb of Power.
Land precision final blows on the weakened enemies to create Orbs of Power and Void Breaches from Echo of Harvest
Collect an Orb of Power to activate Devour
Continuously clear out groups of enemies with Outbreak Perfected and extend Devour

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: Any weapons work with this build as it is ability based.

Chest.Name: Severance Enclosure
Chest.Info: Powered melee final blows unleash a damaging explosion. Finishers and final blows against more powerful targets increase the radius and damage of the explosion.

HowItWorks:
We all know that Strand Titans excel as a Champion and Boss killer with Synthos or Worm Gods with a 1 2 Punch Shotty, but what if they also had the best AOE Add clear Build as well!

We have an infinite grapple Punch that can take out entire rooms filled with enemies in a single Punch, all while still proc’ing Banner of War and Woven mail to make us Unkillable. So this means strand titans have the best End game boss killer build, and the best area of effect, Add killer Build.

The other build that comes to mind when talking AOE Add killer is the Sunbracer Solar Warlock that has reigned supreme for a while. But I really do think this build pushes stands toe to toe with the SunLock.

You have a x4 Banner of war for Healing on Titan and x2 Restoration on a Warlock.
Banner heals the entire team whereas Restoration only heals the Warlock.
Banner gives Melee damage increase which includes our Grapple Melee and our 3 charges of Frenzied Blade. Warlock gets an Ignition proc off their Melee.
Now our punch can clear an entire room but so can a Sunbracer warlock with those Solar grenades.

But I think the most important thing is the ease of use of the Strand Titan. It's a single grapple punch. That's it, The punch procs Banner of war and can easily hit a X3 or x4 in a single punch. It procs our melee damage increase, It procs our Woven Mail as well because our grapple punch creates 2 Orbs of Power off every punch! I thought Bungie said that was no longer possible quite a while back but it definitely is!

Whereas the ease of use of Sunbracers is a bit harder to get the loop down and yes some people struggle with it and that's perfectly fine! Not everyone is a god tier gamer like I know some of you are going to say in the comments that sunbracers are so easy to plunder. 

And the last thing I want to point out is that this Build is well self-sustained from the Mods and Subclass that any weapons will work with it. I ran it with a ton of different options like Monte Carlo for more Melee ability, Bloodline to add Devour to the Build which is just insane, Quicksilver Storm to play into Strand more and even Dragon's Breach for Solar Ignitions to add to the mix. Point is with not requiring a certain weapon
it opens up the Playstyle to whatever fits you best, heck you could add a 1 2 Punch shotty if you wanted too.
GameplayLoop:
Use your Grapple Melee into a group of Enemies
We then proc Banner of War and Woven mail
Next we grab the 2 Orbs of Power that was created from from the Grapple Melee
This will proc our Mods for 50% grenade energy back and Unraveling Orbs.
Reposition yourself for the next grapple and repeat

Primary.Name: CALUS Mini-Tool
Primary.Info: Any solar weapon is key with this build to take advantage of Ember of Empyrean. Incandescent is highly recommended to apply scorch and get the benefits from Ember of Searing.

Chest.Name: Caliban's Hand
Chest.Info:
Grants Proximity Throwing Knife the following buffs:

Applies 60 Scorch Stacks
Causes Ignitions on kills
Gain a 500% melee energy regeneration rate when Proximity Knife is active on a surface

HowItWorks:
The main tool of this kit is the Proximity Throwing Knife that gets buffed immensely from the exotic Caliban's Hand. Throwing Knives will now apply 60 Scorch, cause Ignitions on kills, and grants 500% melee energy regeneration rate when the knife is stuck on a surface waiting to be detonated. The Ignition of Throwing Knife is buffed by the Ember of Eruption Fragment.

The other Fragments play around scorching and healing. Ember of Ashes will increase the amount of scorch you apply. When defeating a scorched enemy you will create a Firesprite and gain melee energy from Ember of Searing. Not only this will help get Throwing Knife back for a greatly increased uptime, but the Firesprite will grant restoration from Ember of Mercy. Ember of Empyrean will allow you to upkeep restoration's timer with solar weapon or ability final blows. Restoration initially lasts for only 2 seconds when picking up a Firesprite, so be sure to quickly reset the timer after picking up a Firesprite.

Due to this interaction with Ember of Empyrean, solar weapons are a must use. It is recommended to utilize a weapon with Incandescent to apply scorch to enemies, and in turn get the melee energy and Firesprite from Ember of Searing.

The means of orb creation are from melee kills from Heavy Handed, solar weapon kills from a Siphon mod, and any kill after using dodge from Reaper. Not only will a melee kill create an orb, but it will give super energy with Hands-On, and dealing damage with the melee or dodging will give grenade energy.
GameplayLoop:
Get a Throwing Knife kill to create an Ignition and spawn an Orb of Power
Defeat a Scorched Target to create a Firesprite
Pick up a Firesprite to get Restoration
Get a solar weapon or ability kill within 2 seconds to upkeep Restoration
Continue killing enemies with Throwing Knife, solar weapons, or other abilities.

Primary.Name: Wish-Keeper
Primary.Info: Getting kills or landing precision hits will grant a stack of snareweaver. At max stacks, you can shoot a suspending arrow that can leave suspending traps. Deal more damage to suspended targets and gain faster draw time when damaging a suspended target.

Chest.Name: Abeyant Leap
Chest.Info: Spawn two additional suspending projectiles that track more and have a longer range. Grant woven mail when you suspend a target.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to have every enemy suspended at all times.

With Wish-Keeper, you can build up stacks on kills or precision hits to shoot out a suspending shot. Next, Abeyant Leap will transform your aspect drengr’s lash to shoot out three lashes when you place your class ability to suspend enemies. Finally, your shackle grenade will have the ability to suspend enemies. With that, you have two abilities and your weapon able to suspend.

To keep those abilities up and running, the fragment thread of mind will grant you class ability energy upon killing a suspended enemy. This will work from any source of suspend that is listed above. Next is thread of generation, so any time you deal damage from any source, you generate shackle grenade energy. Suspend will even last longer from every source because of the fragment thread of continuity. 

For survivability, the aspect into the fray will grant you woven mail whenever you destroy a tangle near you or pop your super. You can also be granted woven mail whenever you suspend a target with your exotic Abeyant Leap. Finally, whenever you pick up an orb, you are also granted woven mail because of the fragment thread of warding. While woven mail is active from any of these you will also generate frenzied blade energy so you can sever targets more often.

Your artifact will also be able to grant you unraveling rounds when picking up an orb. Pairing that with horde shuttle when you deal damage to the unraveled targets, you can spawn threadlings for additional damage. Finally, with dragon’s bite, when you break a shield with Wish-Keeper, you have a chance to suspend them, which will be the fourth and final way of suspending.

Since you can spam your class ability a lot, taking armor mods like dynamo for extra super energy or bomber for extra grenade energy is also extremely nice.
GameplayLoop:
Use your class ability or grenade to suspend enemies
Get precision final blows on suspended targets to grant stacks for Wish-Keeper
Suspend enemies with Wish-Keeper and kill those for class ability energy
Pick up orbs to grant woven mail and unraveling rounds
Use shackle grenade if Wish-Keeper and class ability are on cooldown
Chain suspend over and over to crowd control everything

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: Any weapons with Demolitionist are highly recommended to compliment the Skip Grenades of this build.

Chest.Name: Shinobu's Vow
Chest.Info:
These gloves give 4 huge buffs to Skip Grenades:

Grant an additional grenade
Increase Skip Grenade projectile count from 4 to 5
Increases the tracking of Skip Grenades
Each projectile hit refunds 10% of grenade energy (up to 50% per grenade)

These buffs paired with the rest of the build allows you to spam Skip Grenades at will.

HowItWorks:
This build is first and foremost a Skip Grenade build. Skip Grenades are buffed immensely by Shinobu's Vow and they will grant an additional grenade charge, increase their projectile count from 4 to 5, improve their tracking, and refund 10% of grenade energy for every projectile hit. This final point will refund half of a Skip Grenade's cooldown if all 5 projectiles hit. The rest of the build will fill in that other half through a few other means.

The first of those is through Ionic Traces, these refund 12.5% of grenade energy and are created when killing a jolted enemy thanks to Spark of Ions. Enemies are jolted by Skip Grenades with the Fragment Spark of Shock. Grenade kills and kills after dodging will create Orbs of Power. The initial dodge will give grenade energy from Bomber, and collecting these will in turn refund grenade energy with the Innervation mod. Orbs also have the added bonus of healing with Recuperation. The final boost to grenade energy is from 2 Grenade Kickstart mods. These mods utilize the extra armor charged from Stacks on Stacks and will refund roughly 50% of grenade energy with 4 stacks of armor charge.

If grenade is not available, this build can always fall back on the Combination Blow and Gambler's Dodge arc hunter combo. With Lethal Current you'll be able to chain together a dodge then a melee to build up stacks of increased melee damage, have dodge and Combination Blow refund one another on use, jolt enemies, and blind jolted enemies. Lastly when killing a jolted enemy you will become Amplified from Flow State.

The Fragment Spark of Amplitude takes advantage of being Amplified and will create an Orb of Power with rapid kills while Amplified. The final Fragment Spark of Resistance gives a 25% damage resistance buff when near 3 or more enemies. This final Fragment can potentially be replaced with Spark of Recharge for even better grenade recharge if the damage resistance is not needed.

The weapons of the build are quite flexible as this is a very ability dependent build. One recommendation is to utilize weapons with the Demolitionist perk. This compliments the build very well as Demolitionist weapon kills give grenade energy, and throwing a grenade will automatically reload the weapon.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Skip Grenade to jolt enemies and create Orbs of Power on kills
Refund remaining grenade cooldown by collecting Orbs of Power, getting kills with Demolitionist weapons, and utilizing dodge
Continue throwing grenades utilizing the armor charges to fuel Grenade Kickstart
If grenades are not available utilize the dodge and Combination Blow melee cycle

Primary.Name: Unforgiven
Primary.Info: This SMG with Demolitionist and Frenzy is arguably the best grenade regen primary weapon in Destiny 2 and is perfect because it gets volatile rounds

Chest.Name: Nothing Manacles
Chest.Info: Double Scatter Grenades. Scatter grenade submunitions have better tracking.

HowItWorks:
This build focuses on making sure you have a scatter grenade at ALMOST all times.

We get a TON of regen for our grenades through Devour Kills, Demolitionist Weapon Kills, Orbs of Power, Grenade Kickstart, Bomber, and Child of the Old Gods Damage.

This combined with double grenades allows us to capitalize on all these regen sources and use our scatter grenades to debuff enemies, kill large groups, focus damage on majors, and keep us alive through devour.
GameplayLoop:
Use your grenade to generate orbs, void breeches, and proc devour.
Collect orbs of power to feed into grenade regen, devour timer, and grenade kickstart.
Use rift for more grenade energy.
Shoot large groups of enemies and kill them while child of the old gods is applied for ability energy
After grenade final blows use void weapons with volatile rounds in combination with reaper to generate additional orbs of power

Primary.Name: Apex Predator
Primary.Info: This will be the main DPS weapon of the build. Use other weapons to activate Bait and Switch on this rocket, and use Radiant Dance Machines to continually reload it.

Chest.Name: Radiant Dance Machines
Chest.Info: These boots are used to continually dodge and reload Apex Predator continuously during a damage phase. With one kill during after the initial dodge, you reload Apex for the entirety of Bait and Switch's duration

HowItWorks:
Apex Predator and Cold Comfort are the new kids on the block in terms of DPS. Both of these rockets have access to Bait and Switch which is a 35% damage buff, the largest a rocket launcher can get. Either rocket can be used in this build, just be sure to match the 2 or 3 Weapon Surge mods on your boots to the element of the rocket.

This build maximizes the ability of these rockets to output damage by utilizing Radiant Dance Machines in combination with Marksman's Dodge. Radiant Dance Machines allows you to continuously dodge which will proc Marksman's Dodge and reload the currently equipped weapon. At its base form the multi-dodge lasts for 5 seconds, but getting a kill will extend it to 10 seconds.

During a damage phase use Witherhoard and your energy weapon to start the Bait and Switch activation, then dodge to activate Radiant Dance Machines' multi-dodge and collect nearby Orbs of Power with Powerful Attraction to fuel Weapon Surge mods.. Next get a kill with Knife Trick on a nearby low health enemy that should be left alive before the damage phase. This will grant both the Radiant buff and extend Radiant Dance Machines' timer to 10 seconds. This coincides with the Bait and Switch timer on Apex Predator which should be drawn after landing the Knife Trick kill.

From here continue to shoot Apex Predator and dodge to completely circumvent reloading the weapon as it has a 35% damage boost from Bait and Switch, plus Radiant's 25% damage bonus, and the 17% or 22% damage bonus from 2 or 3 Weapon Surge mods.
GameplayLoop:
Shoot Witherhoard
Swap to secondary weapon, shoot it once
Dodge to activate Radiant Dance Machines
Throw Knife Trick at a nearby low health enemy to become Radiant and extend Radiant Dance Machines' timer.
Swap to Apex Predator
Shoot Apex Predator to activate Bait and Switch
Dodge to reload Apex
Repeat steps 6 and 7

Primary.Name: Sunshot
Primary.Info: Best in slot solar weapon for extending radiant and restoration timers

Chest.Name: Karnstein Armlets
Chest.Info:
Melee and finisher final blows instantly grant cure and provide restoration for a short duration

Melee gives Cure x3 and Restoration x1
Finisher gives Cure x3 and Restoration x2

HowItWorks:
This build is GREAT for getting easy healing effects while on warlock!

Restoration x2 and Cure x3 are easily accessible with zero cooldown, since they are not reliant on using your abilities. This is extremely easy to extend the duration of with ember of empyrean and solar weapons too.

This build is also great for getting x2 restoration, then swapping to other solar builds that wouldn’t be able to get restoration x2 otherwise.
GameplayLoop:
Get a finisher final blow
Hit an enemy w/ a melee ability
Get solar weapon and ability final blows to maintain radiant and restoration x2.
Get melee or finisher final blows when low on health for a full refund.

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Strand exotic that takes advatnage of everything in your kit and can also make tanagles!

Chest.Name: Abeyant Leap
Chest.Info: The aspect Dregnr’s Lash will spawn 3 projectiles instead of 1 and they now track to enemies. You also gain woven mail when you suspend targets.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to make you enemies never be able to fight back. We are going to be doing this through the suspend mechanic.

Your class ability will spawn a ripple that will go forward and suspend enemies due to the Drengr’s Lash aspect. The exotic Abeyant Leap will enhance that by sending out three ripples and that track. These boots will also give you woven mail from suspended targets. You also have your shackle grenade to suspend targets whenever your class ability is on cooldown.

To help with your class ability cooldown the fragments thread of mind will give you some extra energy on suspended enemy kills. Thread of warding will also apply woven mail on you when you pick up and orb of power so that will help you have permanent 60% damage reduction. Thread of generation will also refill your shackle grenade whenever you are doing any damage. Finally thread of continuity will keep for suspended targets in the air for longer.

Quicksilver Storm is the star of the show with it’s recent change to now work on red bars and autos now doing 20% more damage. This weapon alone can tear through everything in the game but you probably still want to have a decent dps option for bosses.
GameplayLoop:
Use your class ability to suspend targets
Gain woven mail from the suspended targets
Use Quicksilver to do damage and build up grenade charges.
Use grenade charges on large ads or major targets
Use shackle grenade if you class ability is on cooldown
Repeat and suspend the entire battlefield!

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: You just need a Strand Weapon here to apply the Unravel debuff and to create threadlings.

Chest.Name: Orpheus Rig
Chest.Info: Provides ability energy for each target tethered by Deadfall anchors. Moebius Quiver has an additional shot.

HowItWorks:
This has to be the greatest Void Hunter Build that has ever graced the presence of Destiny 2. Devour for health on every kill no matter the source of that kill, Weaken for a 15% debuff on every enemy,  Unravel applied to all enemies and champions, and a ton of threadlings popping out for further damage to everything. All while gaining Volatile rounds as well to create these great purple and green explosions that are so satisfying to see. But what makes it even better is we have a super available for every single group of enemies if we choose to use it thanks to not needing Gyrfalcons anymore and using Orpheus Rig. 

Our Shadowshot adds a 30% weaken  and Suppresses everything it touches which allows us to go to town with our weapons and abilities to trigger everything! You also will create so many Orbs of Power and Void breaches that when you're done killing a wave they will be left lying all over the ground. 

You start by throwing your smoke bomb at a single enemy. Then kill that enemy with your weapon. So this one kill triggers everything. That Kill will make you go invisible because of Stylish executioner. We then move to where we kill that weakened enemy and grab the Orb of Power and the Void Breach that the single kill created thanks to Echo of Harvest, where defeating weakened targets creates both for us. 

We now have procd Devour thanks to Echo of Starvation where picking up either one will activate it. Now you position yourself somewhere to fire off a few shots with your strand weapon.
