This will apply the unravel debuff for us! Once you apply Unravel, throw your Vortex grenade, this will group up the enemies, cause damage which will proc, and spread Unravel to all the enemies. 

Try and let your Vortex grenade get one kill so we can proc Volatile rounds for 10 seconds. Then switch to your Bloodline and go to town with it. Using your heavy machine gun when needed to proc Repulsor Brace as well for Void Overshields. I can’t stress enough on how powerful this Void Hunter Build is and once you get it down you will never have a better time playing Destiny 2 right now.
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Smoke Bomb to weaken a single enemy
Kill the weakened enemy with Bloodline, This Procs Stylish Executioner and we go invisible
Grab the Orb of Power and the Void Breach that was created from the Weakened enemy that we killed
This will proc devour and Unravelling Orbs.
Reposition yourself to apply the Unravel debuff with your Strand weapon.
Once applied to a few enemies, Throw your grenade, that will proc Volatile rounds.
Switch to your Bloodline and go to town with Devour, Weaken, Volatile, Unraveling, and Threadlings. 
Grab every Orb of Power and Void Breach because you will be creating so many and these will keep the loop up forever!

Primary.Name: Blood Feud
Primary.Info: Using this or any other Weapon with the perk Headstone will provide the most benefits to this build. Through Headstone you are able to use the effects of your fragments such as Whisper of Shards to regenerate your grenade even faster.

Chest.Name: Cadmus Ridge Lancecap
Chest.Info: Using this exotic you will enhance your Diamond Lances. They will create stasis crystals on impact and this is scaled up when hitting bosses and vehicles. Rapid precision hits as well as combatant final blows with a Stasis weapon while being behind a rally barricade will create a Diamond Lance near you as well.

HowItWorks:
Start by throwing your Glacier Grenade to create crystals and proc grenade kickstart as well. Then destroy one or two crystals to proc Whisper of Shards so that you start regenerating your grenade faster and to create orbs of power through your firepower mod from killing enemies. In general you want to keep the effect of Whisper of Shards going. The time you can have at once is limited up to 10s.

Whenever you need a little more energy for your grenade to throw, use your barricade which will use your bomber mods to give you a big chunk of your grenade back at once. You can also start killing enemies from behind your barricade to spawn stasis crystals near you because of your exotic armor piece.

Every kill you will make with anything stasis related (Stasis Weapon or Ability kills) will create a Diamond Lance which is enhanced through your exotic. Utilize Diamond Lance into enemies and bosses for heavy damage and to create stasis shards.

While destroying your stasis crystals either from your grenade or weapon you will also create stasis shards which will grant you an overshield when at full health or give you back health when damaged from Whisper of Rime.

Pick up any orbs of power to enhance the effect of grenade kickstart to gain even more grenade energy at once the next time you use your grenade to keep this build going.
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Glacier Grenade to create crystals.
Destroy one or two crystals to start regenerating your grenade faster and to create orbs of power.
Whenever you need a little more energy for your grenade to throw just use your barricade which will use your bomber mods to give you a big chunk of your grenade back at once.
Every kill you will make with anything stasis related (Stasis Weapon or Ability kills) will create a diamond lance which is enhanced through your exotic.
Whenever you can, use your Diamond Lance and throw it into the enemies or bosses for even more stasis crystals and damage.
While destroying your stasis crystals either from your grenade or weapon you will also create stasis shards which will grant you an overshield when you are full health or heal you when missing health.
Pick up the orbs of power you and or your teammates created and repeat.

Primary.Name: Gjallarhorn
Primary.Info:
The primary weapon for DPS to buff the Rocket Launcher of Allies with Wolfpack Rounds.

The other weapon slots can be any ad clear of supplementary damage weapons.

Chest.Name: Aeon Swift
Chest.Info: Use Sect of Insight to create Heavy Ammo for your fireteam when using a finisher on a Champion.

HowItWorks:
This build is for Raids, Dungeons, and Nightfalls with Champions to support your teammates. Weapons of the build will change slightly based on whether there is a need for boss DPS or not.

If there is a boss to DPS use Gjallarhorn paired with general add clear weapons that can double up for champions. If there is no boss to DPS focus solely on weapons for Champions and add clear. The Aeon Swift gauntlets play into both of these scenarios with their ability to make Heavy Ammo from finishers on Champions with Sect of Insight. On top of this, the mods Heavy Ammo Scout and Finder are used to help with the team's Heavy Ammo economy. Echo of Obscurity is used for safety during these finishers to go invisible.

In the neutral game, support comes from the ability to make teammates Invisible by throwing Snare Bomb at them or using Trapper's Ambush near them. 

During boss DPS this build offers support with the Wolfpack Rounds from Gjallarhorn, a 15% weaken to enemies with Vortex Grenade with Echo of Undermining or Snare Bomb, and a 30% weaken with Shadowshot: Deadfall. Use Shadowshot first in a rotation to activate Radiant Light to give teammates an Armor Charge to fuel Surge mods.
GameplayLoop:
Neutral Game:

Weaken Targets with Grenades
Get champions to low health
Use finisher on Champions to create Heavy Ammo for your team and go Invisible
Use Trapper's Ambush or throw Snare bomb on allies in danger to make them invisible

Boss DPS:

Fire Shadowshot at boss to weaken by 30% and grant allies an armor charge
Fire Gjallarhorn to give allies Wolfpack Rounds
Use Marksman's Dodge to reload Gjallarhorn
When Shadowshot expires cycle between Snare Bomb and Vortex Grenade to weaken boss by 15%

Primary.Name: Wish-Ender
Primary.Info: Kinetic Exotic weapons give super energy based on damage dealt, and since Wish-Ender hits so hard it returns a lot of super energy. Tether shares applies damage to every target that is tethered, making tether and Wish-Ender give tons of super energy on hits.

Chest.Name: Orpheus Rig
Chest.Info: These boots give half of your super back by tethering targets, and Wish-Ender amplifies this for the other half.

HowItWorks: This Build combines two Exotics that create a super machine. Orpheus Rig will give half of your Super back when you tether a group of enemies. Now since tether shares its damage between all enemies tethered, when using Wish-Ender as the Exotic weapon the normal super energy you get back from Wish-Ender from a single enemy will be amplified by all the other enemies that are tethered. This means you can get tether back before the previous Super runs out and throw out infinite tethers as long as there are enemies to do this on!
GameplayLoop:
Gather super energy by using Wish-Ender
Activate your super and fire Tether into a group of enemies which will proc Orpheus Rig and return half of your super energy
Use Wish-Ender on a high health target to share the damage to all enemies and back the remaining half of super instantly because it is damage from Wish-Ender
Shoot your tether out again and continue the loop!

Primary.Name: Verglas Curve
Primary.Info: Getting a kill loads a stasis arrow than be used to freeze enemies or make a stasis crystal

Chest.Name: Osmiomancy Gloves
Chest.Info: Grants a second coldsnap grenade. Coldsnaps travel faster and further. When hitting an enemy gain grenade charge back.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to freeze everything on the battlefield.

With Osmiomancy Gloves, you are going to get two coldsnap grenade charges that can be used as stasis turrets or normal grenades. Both of these will freeze enemies efficiently, and direct impacts with the normal coldsnap will grant grenade energy back.

With Verglas Curve, getting kills will load stasis arrows, which can be used to freeze enemies or make crystals. The crystals that are made from this can also freeze enemies, and getting kills with them will load even more stasis arrows.

For aspects, taking iceflare bolts is a must because when you shatter frozen targets, you will spawn seekers that can go out and freeze more enemies. Since everything in your build can freeze, this just means you are getting double the value. To make the stasis turrets mentioned earlier, you will need to run the bleak watcher aspect. With this, you can hold down your grenade button to convert it.

For fragments whisper of fissures is great since you are freezing everything and making crystals. This means you will do more damage with the shatter and it will have a bigger explosion. The next fragment is whisper of shards, so when you destroy a stasis crystal, you will get 500% grenade regen. Having more grenades means more turrets and more freezing. Whisper of chains is very strong for your survivability because you will get 40% damage reduction when standing near frozen targets or crystals. The final fragment is whisper of rending, so your primary weapon does more damage to frozen targets and crystals. This will make Verglas Curve pretty decent at doing single-target damage in harder activities and you can destroy crystals easier with it.

For artifact perks, hail the storm is great because when destroy a crystal, you spawn slowing shards that go out and damage enemies. On top of that, shattering them or frozen targets will do more damage, which pairs well with whisper of fissures. The next main perk is pillar of ice, so when you defeat a frozen target, you will spawn a stasis crystal. 

Every single frozen target or stasis crystal you make from all of this will synergize and play into your subclass.
GameplayLoop:
Throw a grenade or turret to start freezing enemies
Get kills with your bow to load stasis arrows
Use those to make crystals to destroy for grenade recharge
Stand near frozen targets or crystals for damage reduction
Repeat this for ad clear and the additional benefits

Primary.Name: Unforgiven
Primary.Info: Any weapons work as the build mostly revolves around finishers.

Chest.Name: Severance Enclosure
Chest.Info: Finishers and powered melee final blows cause a damaging explosion.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to make everything explode with your finisher alone.

Severance Enclosure will make enemies explode when you finish them alongside echo of cessation which makes enemies around you become volatile. Pairing those together with the aspect controlled demolition, which makes your volatile spread and heal you and your teammates, makes you a walking mini nuke. Survivability also comes from echo of starvation which procs devour and echo of obscurity which makes you invisible after a finisher.

Your other aspect bastion will provide you with an overshield when you use your class ability. With things like void breaches, bolstering detonation, and utility kickstart you will be getting your class ability back fast. You can use this for protection to get a finisher or have for getting out of a sticky situation.

Devour will also be healing you to full on every kill while also supplying you with extra grenade energy to proc some of the mods.
GameplayLoop:
Get an enemy weak with your weapon of choice
Use your finisher ability on that enemy
Apply volatile and explode everything with your exotic
Finish any other weak enemies from first finisher
Use bastion overshield to escape or secure a finisher

Primary.Name: Scatter Signal
Primary.Info: This Fusion will apply the Sever and Unravel strand debuffs for us. Which allows us to spawn threadlings by damaging the unraveled target.

Chest.Name: Verity's Brow
Chest.Info: Weapon final blows with a damage type matching your subclass energy grant Death Throes, which provides a grenade damage bonus and grants you grenade energy. When you have Death Throes and throw a grenade, nearby allies gain greatly increased grenade regeneration for a short time.

HowItWorks:
This Void Warlock Build truly encompasses what Destiny 2 Builds should be all about. Thanks to a few new weapons in Season of the Wish and a couple of mod changes, we now have a VoidLock Grenade build that dips into 3 different subclasses while still maintaining that classic VoidLock feel and providing us with infinite grenades that hit harder that a x5 Dragon’s Breath rocket! 

Our Strand Fusion Rifle applies the Sever and Unravel debuffs along with now creating threadlings. Our Void Bow allows for infinite Void Overshields and Volatile Rounds, we also get a 50% damage buff on this bow pretty much 24/7 so we don’t need surge mods on the boots. Then our Solar Heavy rocket launcher applies Scorch and Ignitions for us on any target. Plus if we get a multi-kill with it, which is easy thanks to the ignitions, it will make us radiant thanks to an artifact mod. 

From our VoidWalker subclass we get access to Weaken and Devour, so everything is debuffed by 15% and we get a full heal on every kill thanks to the improved devour on the Feed the Void Aspect along with grenade energy on every single kill. Then to top it off our Vortex grenades hit harder than Dragon’s Breath and can create multiple orbs of power per grenade. Since we can generate an orb every second now with a Grenade and these orbs will give us 25% energy to our Grenade ability every time we pick one up. 

So just to name off exactly what you get when this Build is played right, a grenade that hits harder than an Exotic Rocket Launcher and this list of Buffs & Debuffs! Enjoy Guardian! Weaken, Volatile Rounds. Devour, Void Overshield, Unravel, Sever, Threadlings, Scorch, Ignitions and Radiant.
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Vortex Grenade to proc Devour.
Slay out using our Void Bow to proc Verity’s Brow, Repulsor Brace, and Devour.
Pick up any Orb of Power for 25% Grenade energy.
As soon as your grenade is back, Use it. You should have 5 Stacks of Veritys at this point.
Use your Strand Fusion to occasionally apply the Sever and Unravel Debuffs.
Use your grenade every 5 seconds or so and keep firing that bow!
Use your Dragon’s Breath for Boss damage and combine it with the Strand debuffs and your Vortex grenade that hits as hard as your Dragon’s breath.

Primary.Name: Malfeasance
Primary.Info: With the Mid Season buff Hand Cannons got a nice 20% Damage buff, and this means Malfeasance as well! Pair this with Lucky Pants to further buff the Hand Cannon.

Chest.Name: Lucky Pants
Chest.Info: Lucky Pants gives Kinetic Hand cannons a 600% Damage buff when Stowed Hand cannon is readied. This pairs so nicely with Malfeasance because this damage boost is to the Taken explosions as well that comes from landing 5 shots in a row!

HowItWorks:
This build combines two Exotics that turn it into a Champion Eater! With Strand being so strong on the Hunter, what better way to take advantage of that infinite suspension than with Lucky Pants! 

Suspended targets are easy to hit now, and you don’t have to worry about being shot at while unloading a 20 Round Malfeasance. This makes for the perfect pairing with Lucky Pants' 600% damage increase to Malfeasance that already hits like a truck! 

All that is needed is to Suspend a Champion with Shackle Grenade, then whip out Malfeasance and this will proc Lucky Pants and allow you to kill any champion in one clip. With the recent 20% Hand cannon buff to Malfeasance as well and the Kinetic Surge mods, you can stack great damage while being on an amazing crowd control subclass with Strand.
GameplayLoop:
Use Shackle Grenade to Suspend
Activate Lucky Pants by pulling out Malfeasance
This will proc Lucky Pants Combined with Malfeasance to eat Champions
Throw grenade as soon as you need to and just go to town with Malfeasance
Grab Orbs of Power which will heal you and provide a Damage Boost
Continue this loop for infinite High damage Malfeasance rounds

Primary.Name: Sunshot
Primary.Info:
A strong solar weapon to play into Gunpowder Gamble and Ember of Empyrean

Zailou's Bane is an alternative hand cannon

Chest.Name: Ophidia Spathe
Chest.Info: Gain a second knife per charge. Getting a final blow with a throwing knife grants consecutive knives a temporary stacking damage bonus. Gambler's Dodge refreshes the bonus timer.

HowItWorks:
If you want to be the most destructive hunter out there with 5 on demand ignitions while still getting that infinite restoration and healing, with a 400% ability regen to our healing grenade and dodge, then this build will do that and much more!

This is the way I enjoy playing solar hunter the most and I think in most activities especially as you move up into harder content, the build starts performing better and better. The reason for this is we have 5 sources of on demand Ignitions and you all know how strong Ignitions are. They are room clearing explosions and when combined with revitalizing blast and solo operative when your're solo, that adds a 30% damage buff to all these Ignitions and since we have so many on demand, that's what makes the combo truly powerful this season and even when your not solo, you're still getting the bonus from revitalizing blast and the infinite 400% ability regen for our healing grenade and dodge ability.

Now the harder content you push the more our knife trick melee starts to fall off, you have to be really close to land all the knives and they normally won't kill in master or Grandmaster content. So we go with a weighted throwing knife instead because hitting a scorched target will cause an ignition. With this season's artifact any Solar weapon we choose will be able to scorch targets thanks to the mod. We're always radiant from our knives so this is easy. Our knife is now a guaranteed ignition and we can scorch a target and hit them with our knife from a safe distance in difficult content. Next we add in gunpowder gamble. Which would make the 5th ignition to the overall build. We also have this available all the time as we are getting so many ignition kills from the 4 knives.
GameplayLoop:
Use your melee for an Instant Radiant Proc.
This allows any solar weapon to scorch on hit this season thanks to Kindling Trigger.
With your weapon Scorching, any throwing knife hits will cause an Ignition.
Our Exotic gives us 2 knives per charge and when we dodge near an enemy we can get 2 knives back instantly.
That’s 4 knives to cause ignitions with and our dodge is up infinitely thanks to ember of singeing.
Those ignition kills or your solar weapon kills will quickly stack gunpowder gamble for a 5th ignition that will be up every 6 seconds!

Primary.Name: Acasia's Dejection
Primary.Info: Any solar weapon with Incandescent works with this build.

Chest.Name: Ashen Wake
Chest.Info: Will cause Fusion Grenades to instantly explode and grenade kills will refund 25% of grenade energy for minor kills, 50% energy for orange bars, and 100% energy for minibosses, bosses, and Champions. Mods add on to the grenade return.

HowItWorks:
Titans can spam Fusion Grenades too! Ashen Wake lets solar Titans throw endless Fusion Grenades by refunding grenade energy on kill. Fusion Grenades will also instantly explode on impact. Grenade energy is refunded based on the enemy type that is defeated with a grenade, from Grenade Kickstart mods, and from picking up Orbs of Power that are created from grenade via Firepower, kills after casting Barricade via Reaper, and 2 solar weapon kills via Solar Siphon. With all these avenues of grenade regeneration, you will be able to continuously throw Fusion Grenades on demand.

Grenade kills will create Orbs of Power from Firepower, create Sunspots which gives Restoration, and builds up to 3 stacks of Roaring Flames which increases ability damage. If Fusion Grenade is not available, Throwing Hammer is a great alternative to use in the meantime. It will create Sunspots, grant the Radiant buff for a 25% weapon damage boost, and maintain Roaring Flames as well. Sunspots are fantastic for healing and regenerating abilities faster. 

Getting a solar weapon or ability kill will extend the timer for Restoration and Radiant with Ember of Empyrean, allowing for continuous healing and improved weapon damage. Allies will also receive the Radiant buff, which gives the extra bonus of 200% ability regeneration rate from Ember of Benevolence. Ability regeneration is further supplemented by Ember of Searing creating Firesprites when defeating Scorched enemies, which when picked up reduce cooldowns.

The weapon of the build are best with the Incandescent perk. This will ensure the weapon is solar so it activates Ember of Empyrean, and it will scorch targets to activate Ember of Searing to create Firesprites.
GameplayLoop:
Continuously throw Fusion Grenades to refund grenade energy on kills, create Orbs of Power, build stacks of Roaring Flames, and create a Sunspot.
Stand in a Sunspot for Restoration
Get any solar ability or weapon kill to extend the timer of Restoration
If grenade is on cooldown, utilize Throwing Hammer to get a 25% weapon damage buff, maintain Roaring Flames and create Sunspots until Fusion Grenade is off cooldown
Use Hammer of Sol when available

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info:
Any Strong Strand weapon will work! I personally like Quicksilver Storm as the Grenade Launcher Form deals some serious damage.

Other potential options are:

The Navigator
Final Warning
Rufus's Fury

Chest.Name: Osmiomancy Gloves
Chest.Info: Your Coldsnap grenades have an additional charge that recharges quicker on direct impact. The seeker spawned from Coldsnap grenades travels further.

HowItWorks:
The Stasis Warlock in Season of the Wish has to be the best version of the Stasis Lock that I have ever seen. It has always excelled at crowd control and freezing entire rooms of enemies, but this season it got a couple buffs and we can actually add damage to the build for once to make it the best of both worlds!

We combine several different subclasses like Solar and Strand to make this Build but in the most work it's ever been able to do and I think you guys will be really surprised with how this build performs for you!

There are 3 Key things that we need to cover in order for you to experience this Build at its full potential.

The first thing is weapon choice because they play a big part in this build, we want to take Strand and Solar weapons to make this build into something special and there are 2
different ways to go about this. You either take a Strong Strand weapon that will do the bulk of the work for you, or a strong Solar weapon as your main and the secondary strand weapon as a way to just apply debuffs. I found the best route was to take a strand weapon as my primary because I have just been playing with sunshot way too much this season. So I would go with Quicksilver Storm like you're seeing in most of the Gameplay, This thing hits like a truck and when you pair our freezing capabilities and freeze a ton of enemies, the Grenade launcher form can clear out mobs of enemies at once and really makes you feel powerful when this happens!

Some other honorable mentions are The Navigator, I used it in a run of the Coil and being able to apply woven mail and also sever the high health targets were great! So if you have this weapon try it out! Final warning is also a great option and is Anti barrier and then a great Legendary is Rufus's Fury.

Now that weapons are out of the way let's talk about 2 Fragments because you need to choose between 45% more damage or 40% more survivability based on the activity you are doing! The other 3 fragments will stay the same and the 4th is chosen between Whisper of Chains that grants us 40% damage reduction when were near Stasis Crystals or Frozen targets and then Whisper of Rending that allows our primary weapon to hit Frozen targets 45% harder. So on something like the grenade form of Quicksilver, you are doing massive damage to anything frozen. So in easier activities I would take Rending, but in harder ones I would switch to Chains.

The last thing is our Artifact mod choices and how we play into those! The first 2 are the Stasis mods Pillar of Ice and Hail the Storm. What these do is cause our Shatter damage from frozen targets and stasis crystals to hit harder for roughly a 15% damage buff for both. When we kill encased targets, they will spawn a Stasis Crystal for us. This is huge as now we have a way to spawn crystals without Headstone or glacial grenade. 

The next 2 mods are Unraveling Orbs and Horde Shuttle. When we pick up an Orb of power this allows our strand weapons to apply the unravel debuff which again is just added damage on a target and while we're damaging a unraveled target, Threadlings will pop off them and either damage that same enemy or seek out another. Once again this is just more overall damage to anything! We also take the 2 Solar mods for Radiant and Scorch but these aren't as important if you have chosen the strand route, But if you're using the Navigator for example like I was, then my secondary was Zailou's Bane and I would have Radiant up quite often for my weapons! Then Switch to The Navigator to apply the strand debuffs and buffs.
GameplayLoop:
Use your Rift; This is to proc Reaper and help with survivability
Use your Coldsnap or Stasis turret to freeze everything!
Grab the orb of power and go to town with your strand weapon
This will get your class ability back thanks to the fragment Whisper of Refraction
Your weapon spreads Unravel and Threadlings to everything
Use your grenades as needed and the grenade launcher form of Quicksilver storm

Primary.Name: Salvager's Salvo
Primary.Info:
Any strong Arc Weapon works for this build to make Orbs of Power from a Siphon mod.

Having Demolitionist as a perk is also a great option due to being able to reload from the constant grenades this build has access to.

Chest.Name: Armamentarium
Chest.Info: Gain a second grenade charge with this Exotic. It doesn't seem like much on paper, but being able to generate another 6 Ionic Traces on demand is very powerful!

HowItWorks:
The Arc Titan has some great synergy within it’s subclass with the Touch of Thunder Aspect allowing Pulse Grenades to generate 6 Ionic Traces while damaging an enemy! This entire build takes advantage of this to its fullest. Make sure to get your mods correct as listed above because those are what will allow you to have infinite grenades and barricades in even grandmaster content! 

The gameplay loop is very simple, yet strong! Tag an enemy with your Pulse Grenade then pop your barricade and let the grenade and Ionic traces do all the work for you. You will have infinite Grenades as long as you hit a target. These are strong Jolting grenades because they get bonus damage from Touch of Thunder. They hit hard and clear all red bars thanks to the Jolt debuff!
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Pulse Grenade at Champions or High Health targets
Use your Towering Barricade for damage mitigation
Collect 4 Ionic Traces while safely behind your Barricade
Rinse and repeat. This is one of the easiest builds you will play!

Primary.Name: Verglas Curve
Primary.Info:
A Strong Stasis Weapon, preferably one that can Freeze targets or create extra crystals.

Alternative options are:

Cryosthesia 77K
Wicked Implement
Ager's Scepter

Chest.Name: Precious Scars
Chest.Info: Final blows from weapons with a damage type matching your subclass energy create a burst of healing around you that grants allies restoration. After reviving or being revived, you gain an aura that provides overshields to you and nearby allies.

HowItWorks:
This Build is all about the Shattering we can do with Stasis Crystals on the Behemoth Titan! Our Grenade, Melee, and Stasis weapon can all create Stasis Crystals This allows our Shatter damage to be something to be feared and then we also have 3 different ways to proc Whisper of Shards where we get a 500% Grenade regen all the time. 

All of those Stasis Crystals also leave behind Stasis Shards that we can collect for infinite Melees and Overshields. The gameplay loop above explains how we can always have any ability available and we pair all of this with the Exotic Precious Scars. 

This will give us Restoration on a Stasis Titan, making it much more viable now since it always missed that healing source! If you're looking for a different way to play Destiny 2 during this long season of the wish then give this build a shot and I know you won’t be disappointed!
GameplayLoop:
Throw Glacier Grenade and Shatter it with your weapon.
This procs Whispers of Fissures for a 500% Grenade regen.
Melee to create even more Crystals. This again will proc all our fragments as well.
Secure kills with a Stasis weapon in between to proc our Exotic Precious Scars for 3 Seconds of Restoration on each Kill.
Verglas Curve is great with this because the crystals from the weapon will also proc the healing if they get a Kill.
Cycle your abilities off cooldown and you will always have at least one.

Primary.Name: Cryosthesia 77K
Primary.Info: Aside from the generous aim assist, good range, and 0.7 second time to kill. This sidearm will slow and freeze enemies after a kill.

Chest.Name: Mask of Bakris
Chest.Info: With dodge becoming a longer distance shift. This exotic allows you to quickly disengage and create space between you and nearby enemies or get up close and engage enemies. When shifting you are invulnerable which can be used to avoid supers, shotguns, and more.

HowItWorks:
This build is based around 3 pillars: Duskfield Grenade, Cryosthesia 77K, and Mask of Bakris.

Duskfield Grenades are buffed by the Touch of Winter Aspect as they last longer and create a Stasis Crystal in the middle. When possible, shoot the central crystal to increase grenade regeneration rate from Whisper of Shards. Whisper of Torment will also help get Duskfield back passively. The general use case of these grenades are to zone off areas of the map and objectives such as revives or capture points, slow down and bait enemies pushing you, force enemies out of cover and away from Rifts and Barricades.

Mask of Bakris is what makes this build akin to guerilla warfare. The shift this exotic provide lets you quickly engage or disengage into a fight. With the Winter's Shroud Aspect enemeis will be slowed when class ability is used near them. Use this to get an advantage in fights or even freeze enemies who already have slow stacks from Duskfield Grenade.

The most important portion of the build is Cryosthesia 77K. In its base form this sidearm is fantastic, and after a kill a frozen bullet can be loaded to freeze an enemy, setting up an easy kill. Cryosthesia can be used for kills on frozen enemies as Whisper of Rending is used, increasing the damage primary ammo weapons do to frozen targets. Letting you set up another frozen bullet.
GameplayLoop:
Isolate a target
If necessary, slow the target with a Duskfield or a well timed dodge
Kill the enemy with Cryosthesia 77K
Reload the sidearm with a freezing bullet
Freeze another target with the frozen bullet
Repeat

Primary.Name: Sunshot
Primary.Info: Any solar weapon works here to proc Precious Scars and Ember of Empyrean.

Chest.Name: Precious Scars
Chest.Info: Final blows from weapons with a damage type matching your subclass energy create a burst of healing around you that grants allies restoration. After reviving or being revived, you gain an aura that provides overshields to you and nearby allies.

HowItWorks:
Have you ever wished you could use all 3 Aspects on the solar titan in a Single Build, that would be The Consecration Slam that provides room clearing Nukes, The roaring flames buff that allows our Consecration slam and our grenade to hit like a truck, and we still get infinite restoration even with taking a offensive grenade like the Thermite grenade. 

How about we take it even a step further than that though! We're already an offensive Juggernaut with our Slam and damage bonus from roaring flames, but we can now shoot our weapon and get a kill, that's it, which instantly activates all 3 of these buffs, a 400% ability regen that's up infinitely. Radiant for a 25% damage buff on all our weapons, and you guessed it, infinitely. Then apply restoration to ourselves and extend it infinitely just by our weapon! Then to add the cherry on top we're applying restoration to the entire fireteam and doing this endlessly to boost survivability for everyone! Just imagine how much you can help your team, while still dishing out the damage yourself with infinite abilities and everything is triggered by shooting your weapon and getting 1 single kill.

I hope my point is clear on how strong I think this build is and the potential it has on your fireteam!

We start off by taking Burning Maul because it's the best super when we don't have sunspots to extend our throwing hammers. Choose the offensive grenade of your choice, not the healing grenade that you see in most Solar builds. I like the thermite grenade personally for ignition procs. We then take roaring flames so our abilities do massive damage and add clear and the second aspect is the Consecration Slam! This thing is so powerful if used right and has always been one of my favorite abilities since its release.

Now Fragments are really important in what they do so pay attention

Searing for melee energy on every single kill
Torches for radiant for the fireteam
Empyrean for infinite restoration and radiant for yourself.
Benevolence for a 400% ability regen that will be active 24/7 since we're applying restoration 24/7 to the entire fireteam.

For weapons take a strong Solar weapon. This is key to make the build feel smoother.

For exotic we take precious scars and yes I know it looks hideous, but the good outweighs the bad here. This grants you restoration and your fireteam restoration every 3 seconds on a kill with a weapon matching your subclass! This has a 15 meter reach in any direction so it reaches far, we extend restoration ourselves through Empyrean and just kill a enemy every 6 seconds or so to keep re-proc'ing ember of benevolence. In between the weapon kills we use the powerful Slam and grenade that gets boosted by roaring flames so they hit hard then we continue to shoot our weapon and kill enemies like normal!
GameplayLoop:
Use Consecration slam and your Thermite Grenade.
Your Slam alone should proc roaring flames x3 for great damage!
Get a kill with your solar weapon
This activates restoration for you and your fireteam and procs Ember of Benevolence.
Pick up any Orbs of power you created through the 5 Different mod sources.
Get a Kill every 6 seconds to keep up Ember of Benevolence all the time.
Rinse and Repeat!

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info: This exotic shotgun really compliments the build well with how many ignitions you can pull off in rapid succession in combination with ignitions from firebolt grenades.

Chest.Name: Hallowfire Heart
Chest.Info:
Improves the recharge rate of your solar abilities and greatly improves the recharge rate while your super is active.

At Baseline: 75% Additional Base Grenade and Melee Regeneration Rate

With Super Charged:
350% Additional Base Grenade and Melee Regeneration Rate

This exotic really helps with firebolt grenade uptime, especially when your super is active - allowing you to ignite more targets.

HowItWorks:
This build is very good at creating Orbs of Power and Firesprites!

Throwing Hammer creates Orbs of Power from Final Blows due to Heavy Handed.

Due to the Throwing Hammer's "throw and pick back up" nature, you will essentially ALWAYS have it ready. Even if you lose the hammer, you will quickly have it back due to the increase recharge rate from Hallowfire Heart!
Final blows from Throwing Hammer build stacks of Roaring Flames, causing you to deal more damage to enemies, allowing you to get more final blows and create more Orbs of Power.
Having 2x Charged Up Mods of your chest armor grants you more Armor Charge with a longer timer from 2x Time Dilation Mods on your Class Item.
Defeating scorched targets from either Firebolt Grenade or from Incandescent on Calus Mini Tool also grants melee ability energy and creates a Firesprite (Ember of Searing)!
Firesprites grant grenade energy when picked up!

Barrier Champions

Causing damage with your Throwing Hammer will make you and nearby allies Radiant (Ember of Torches).
While Radiant is active, your weapons deal increased damage to combatants and pierce the shields of Barrier Champions!
GameplayLoop:
When close to high health enemies (excluding bosses)
1. Lead in with Conditional Finality Stasis Shot (Freezing target)
2. Use Throwing Hammer to Shatter target (causing Shatter Damage, If target is an Unstoppable Champion, damage applied from Shatter will stun them!)
3. Follow up with Conditional Finality Solar Shot (Igniting the Target)
4. Make direct impact with Firebolt Grenade
5. Reload Conditional Finality and repeat the above steps or until target is defeated

When Enemies are at a distance:
1. Throw Firebolt Grenade
2. Final blows on enemies from solar abilities grant stacks of Roaring Flames, allowing your Solar abilities to deal more damage (Stacks up to 3x).
3. Final blows from Firebolt Grenade and Throwing Hammer create Sunspots - granting you Restoration!
4. Extend Restoration indefinitely by defeating targets with Solar Weapons and/or abilities (Ember of Empyrean).

Primary.Name: Renewal Grasps
Primary.Info: Your Duskfield grenades have a much larger effect radius. Allies inside the Duskfield take reduced damage and targets inside the area deal reduced damage.

HowItWorks:
This Stasis Hunter Build is the best version we have seen so far in Destiny 2 thanks to some additions in Season of the Wish! The Renewal Grasp Hunter has always been strong with crazy Damage resist and crowd control with massive Duskfield Grenades! 

But the one thing it lacked was healing! Well, we can now apply Devour on demand and this turns this build into an absolute menace! With Healing on every single kill we get from any source like abilities or weapons we can finally survive inside our duskfields, we also get grenade energy on every kill as well to further enhance any type of grenade build! We get Devour from the Buried Bloodline Exotic which I urge you guys to farm for this weapon! It will turn any build that lacked survivability into an absolute power house in end game content!
GameplayLoop:
Proc Devour with Buried Bloodline, 1 yellow bar kill works.
Lead with your Duskfield grenade next and jump inside for insane damage resistance and healing from any kill we get.
Use your 2 withering Blade Melees to proc mods and slow/freeze priority targets.
You will have your grenade back in less than 10 seconds and can throw another one.
Shoot the previous crystal or any extra crystals for damage and great grenade regen.
Rinse and Repeat!

Primary.Name: Found Verdict
Primary.Info: One-Two Punch is the main perk that is sought after for a shotgun. Found Verdict has Slideshot and Surplus available in the other column which makes this a good choice to be paired in this melee build.

Chest.Name: Assassin's Cowl
Chest.Info:
Melee kills and finishers provide healing and invisibility, making a CQC build survivable in all content in the game. Different enemy types give varying effects:

Melee Invisibility:

Minor: 6.8 s | Major: 9.8 s | Miniboss: 12.8 s | Boss: 13.3 s

Finisher Invisibility:

Minor: 9.8 s | Major: 12.7 s | Miniboss: 15.8 s | Boss: N/A

HowItWorks:
There are a lot of moving pieces to this build, but what it ultimately comes down to is landing high damage melees which give a plethora of effects on a kill, making this up close and personal melee build very survivable. The interaction between Gambler's Dodge and Combination Blow is most important to learn. Gambler's Dodge will refill Combination Blow when near an enemy, and defeating a target with Combination Blow will completely refill Gambler's Dodge energy.

The benefits of using a melee on an enemy are plenty. The first is tied in an Aspect, Lethal Current, which is activated after dodging and increases melee lunge distance, Jolts, and creates an aftershock that damages nearby enemies. The exotic Assassin's Cowl makes melee kills and finishers restore some health and grants invisibility. Mods will make melee kills create Orbs of Power as well as replenish super and grenade energy.

The other two abilities in the build, Gathering Storm and Pulse Grenade, are nothing to scoff at. Gathering Storm is a very strong single target damage super, and Pulse Grenade is strong in its own right, but is extended with Spark of Magnitude and Jolts targets with Spark of Shock. Be sure to utilize these abilities when possible.

The last bit of the build is in weapons. Using a shotgun with One-Two Punch will increase melee damage even further, and is strongly recommended in this build. The other two options are quite flexible. With Combination Blow being the primary means in which enemies are damaged, using two special weapons is best, and the other slot can be occupied by Witherhoard, Arbalest, a Trace Rifle, or a grenade launcher. Using two special weapons will also create more heavy bricks for the heavy weapon of your choice.
GameplayLoop:
Dodge to activate Lethal Current and refill melee energy if needed
Melee an enemy to build a stack of Combination Blow, Jolt the target, create a damaging aftershock, heal, refill Dodge energy, spawn an Orb of Power, and go invisible
Repeat steps 1 and 2 until Combination Blow is at maximum stacks (up to 3 stacks)
Continue chaining dodges, melees, and finishers to keep Combination Blow stacks up and receive all of the benefits from melee kills and Assassin's Cowl
Damage down and Jolt higher health targets with Pulse Grenade and Gathering Storm when they are available as well as utilize a One-Two Punch shotgun to increase melee damage

Primary.Name: Scatter Signal
Primary.Info:
This strand fusion rifle is new to the rapid-fire frame family in Destiny 2 and, in my opinion, is among the best in class!

Despite this, we are mainly going to be using this fusion rifle to Sever targets with its new perk Slice!

Chest.Name: Peregrine Greaves
Chest.Info:
These exotic boots allow you do INSANE amounts of damage to mini-bosses, Tormentors, and Champions!

When applying the right debuffs to these targets, you can ONE-SHOT them! And for Champions, you won't even need to stun them first!

HowItWorks:
The Knee-ruption Solar Titan Build is very simplistic in nature: build up stacks of Roaring Flames and ONE-SHOT the entire battlefield!

The Peregrine Greaves got reworked this season (Season of the Wish) to allow for them to deal INSANE amounts of damage from one blow against the most powerful combatants in the game!

Aside from dealing with these enemies, everything else about the build is either helping us deal with the ad-clear of rank-and-file enemies, dealing good damage against bosses, or getting our melee ability back as fast as possible!

Sunshot is the KING of ad-clear and is also great for granting Radiant from multiple precision final blows thanks to the artifact mod Flint Striker, igniting targets thanks to the artifact mod Rays of Precision, and dropping Orbs of Power all over the battlefield to feed your super and grant armor charges!

The Peregrine Greaves will not apply the 1000% damage to actual bosses, though. This ONLY applies to mini-bosses, Tormentors, and Champions. However, this build does have great boss damage potential!

Apex Predator is among the highest damaging rocket launchers in the game due to it rolling with the perk Bait and Switch! Pairing this with the weaken from the Revitalizing Blast artifact mod, severing the target with our Scatter Signal strand fusion rifle through the Slice perk while being Radiant allows this build to put out very optimal damage! Solar Weapon Surges on our leg armor will also carry your damage to new heights as well!
GameplayLoop:
For mini-bosses, Champions, and Tormentors

While having Roaring Flames, charge towards to the enemy while airborne to strike them with a melee attack deal 1000% bonus damage!

Primary.Name: Wavesplitter
Primary.Info: Picking up an Orb of Power created from Reaper will activate Supercharged Battery which will reload the weapon, make it shoot at its maximum damage, and Suppress enemies.

Chest.Name: Fr0st-EE5
Chest.Info: These boots will passively recharge all abilities simply by sprinting. Because of this you do not have to actively think about or change your playstyle in anyway to benefit from this exotic.

HowItWorks:
The Reaper mod is a top PvP mod to take advantage of. This mod will create an Orb of Power on any kill after using your class ability. Orbs of Power can activate so many effects amongst Fragments, mods, Weapons, and more. When collecting an Orb of Power, the build will receive the following:

Devour from Echo of Starvation
Supercharge Battery on your Wavesplitter
Void Weapon Surge to further improve the damage of Wavesplitter
The ability to Suppress enemies with Wavesplitter
The ability to generate a Void Breach on any enemy you suppress with Wavesplitter from Echo of Domineering

An Orb of Power does so much, and the rest of the build is made to make landing that kill to create an orb as easy as possible. Radar manipulation will give you a jump in fights and can be done by throwing a Snare Bomb to create a ping on the enemy radar. The other is going invisible after throwing a Snare Bomb via dodging and Vanishing Step. This plays perfectly with Reaper as the means to activate this mod is the same as the means to get an upper hand in fights which is dodging and going invisible. FR0ST-EES will make these tools available more often by improving grenade and melee recharge rate by 100% and 200% dodge regeneration rate when sprinting.

The mods will only add fuel to the fire with the use of multiple Void unflinching, targeting, and weapon surge. The first two will be active at all the time and increase the ease of use of Wavesplitter. Feel free to swap the third targeting and unflinching mods based on the element of your kinetic slot weapon. The weapon surge mods will increase the damage of Wavesplitter even more when picking up an Orb of Power, so use as many as possible. This bonus damage effect is extended by the use of 2 Time Dilation mods.
GameplayLoop:
Get near enemies, and if you want, throw a Snare Bomb to alter enemy radar
Dodge to activate invisibility, disappear from radar for 5 seconds, and activate Reaper
Get a kill to create an Orb of Power on the body
Collect the orb to receive the following:
Devour
Supercharge Battery on your Wavesplitter
Improved Wavesplitter damage from Surge mods
The ability to Suppress enemies with Wavesplitter
The ability to generate a Void Breach on any enemy you suppress with Wavesplitter
Repeat the process

Primary.Name: Le Monarque
Primary.Info:
Very strong for endgame content and poison can apply volatile. 

Note: any void weapon will work with this build.

Chest.Name: Contraverse Hold
Chest.Info: Charging your grenade will grant damage reduction. Hitting enemies with your charged grenade grants grenade energy.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to buff your vortex grenades and be able to spam them all the time.

This is achieved by running chaos accelerant so you can charge your grenade up so it lasts longer and has a bigger radius. Since you can charge your grenade, running Contraverse Hold is a must because you will get damage reduction while doing so and grant a large portion of your grenade energy back. Taking echo of remnants will also further increase the duration of your vortex grenade. Finally, for your grenade taking echo of undermining will now let it apply a weaken effect.

Your grenades aren’t only huge and able to apply effects, but they also help you out on kills. With feed the void, when you get an ability kill, you are granted devour. Devour will heal you to full on every kill and grant grenade energy. To keep devour up longer, echo of persistence will increase the duration of it. On top of procing devour, getting grenade kills will also grant volatile rounds for your void weapons. 

Any void weapons will work in this build, but Le Monarque is very good for endgame content. The poison from the weapon can proc volatile on enemies and even cause detonations for massive explosions if a bunch of enemies are around.

You don’t have to take advantage of artifact perks with this build, so that means it is future-proof, and you can take it into other seasons.
GameplayLoop:
Charge your grenade and through at a large group of enemies
Get kills with your grenade to gain back grenade energy and proc devour and volatile rounds
Get kills while devour is up to heal to full and gain grenade energy
Pick up orbs to grant armor charge for void weapon surge
Keep slaying and throwing grenades to keep devour up and weakening everything

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Any Strand weapon synergizes well with Strand builds as it will activate the artifact mods Untangler and Threaded Blast from Tangles the build creates.

Chest.Name: Heart of Inmost Light
Chest.Info: Frenzied Blade has 3 charges to it and HoIL will activate on all of them. HoIL gets more value out of being able to be activated more often from an increase in abilities, and the Fragments and mods which lead to those abilities being available more often.

HowItWorks:
This build is based around two major pillars, the first being the strength of Woven Mail and the second being the amount of abilities Strand Titan has to activate Heart of Inmost Light. Woven Mail is acquired from picking up Orbs of Power created by melee or Strand weapon kills from Firepower and Siphon mods. Woven Mail gives a 60% damage reduction boost for great survivability.

In order for Heart of Inmost Light to work its best, abilities must be readily available. Strand Titans have 3 charges of Frenzied Blade which will recharge Barricade and Grapple. To get back melee energy, utilize Grapple and Barricade or deal damage with Tangles which are created when killing an enemy while Woven Mail is active from Thread of Transmutation.

The only thing to think about with this build is the upkeep of Woven Mail through the creation of Orbs of Power from Frenzied Blade, Grapple Melee, or weapon kills matching the equipped Siphon mods. From there the build plays itself as abilities are passively regenerated from Heart of Inmost Light, dealing damage, and damaging enemies with Tangles.
GameplayLoop:
Melee kill an enemy via Frenzied Blade or Grapple Melee to create an Orb of Power
Pick up the Orb of Power to obtain Woven Mail for a 60% damage resist as well as healing and ability energy from mods
Utilize abilities when available to empower and boost the regeneration rate of each ability
Destroy Tangles that are created for melee energy from Thread of Fury

Primary.Name: Sunshot
Primary.Info: Weapons in this build are based on preference.

Chest.Name: Severance Enclosure
Chest.Info: Powered melee final bows unleash a damaging explosion. Finishers and final blows against more powerful combatants increase the radius and damage of the explosion.

HowItWorks:
This build is SUPER fun and uses your charged melee ability and finisher final blows to add clear large groups of enemies.

These kills trigger high AOE explosions which increase in damage and size when doing finishers and when killing higher tier combatants.

Throwing a hammer with roaring flames is GREAT for this because we have infinite melee uses. Even if we lose the hammer, with roaring flames our base melee ability counts as a charged melee so we can ALWAYS trigger explosions!
GameplayLoop:
Throw a thermite grenade for roaring flames stacks
Stand in sunspot for ability regen and restoration
Get melee / finisher final blows
repeat.

Primary.Name: Thunderlord
Primary.Info: The name of the build is "Lord of Thunder", Thunderlord has to be in here. Regardless of using it for namesake, Thunderlord is a great all around weapon that is fantastic for clearing waves of enemy, and with the Catalyst is a very good, easy to use DPS option.

Chest.Name: Heart of Inmost Light
Chest.Info: After using an ability, this chest piece will buff the damage and regeneration rate of the abilities that were not used. The best way to use this is to use abilities in ascending order of what you want buffed the most to get empowering x2 on your best ability. In this case using class ability, then melee, then grenade, as Pulse Grenade is very strong with this build.

HowItWorks:
Although it was changed, Heart of Inmost Light is still a very potent exotic if played around correctly. Getting the empowered x2 buff for all abilities won't be as it was, but getting the x2 buff for Pulse Grenades is possible, and is the best way to play due to the strength of Pulse Grenades. In order to do this prioritize using abilities in the order in which you care about them from least to most. To get the most out of grenades, use class ability, then melee, and finally the grenade. This way Pulse Grenade will have the best buff when they are used.

Pulse Grenades will create Ionic Traces for ability regeneration from Touch of Thunder, Jolt targets from Spark of Shock, and last longer from Spark of Magnitude. On top of those buffs, the mods are based around the grenade via Firepower for making Orbs of Power, Bolstering Detonation and Momentum Transfer for class/melee energy on grenade hits, and Bomber and Innervation for grenade energy when using Barricade or picking up orbs. Seismic Strike has the utility of blinding Enemies which can handle Unstoppable Champions. As for class ability, if the content is easier, Thruster is a viable option because of its cooldown. Otherwise Barricade is the safer play.

The two weapons to have are Thunderlord and a Void energy weapon. Thunderlord is a jack of all trades and can create Ionic Traces with Spark of Discharge.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Barricade to empower melee and grenade
Utilize Seismic Strike to empower grenade to x2 and class ability and blind nearby enemies
Throw x2 empowered Pulse Grenade which will empower melee and class ability, make an Orb of Power on a kill, and reduce cooldowns via mods and Ionic Traces
Collect Orbs of Power for healing from Recuperation and ability energy from Absolution and Innervation
Repeat the ability cycle and utilize and Thunderlord as you see fit

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: Any strand weapon benefits from the Unraveling Orbs and Dragon's Bite artifact mods

Chest.Name: Severance Enclosure
Chest.Info: Powered melee final blows unleash a damaging explosion. Finishers and final blows against more powerful targets increase the radius and damage of the explosion.

HowItWorks:
This Solar TitanBuild will turn you into a Walking Nuke in most content in Destiny 2. With the changes made in Season of the Wish to the Exotic armor piece Severance Enclosure, Bungie buffed the damage and size of the explosion, allowing us to clear entire groups of enemies even 15 power levels below the recommended. 

This is thanks to the Solar Titan subclass where we have infinite Charged Melees, Infinite healing with Restoration from Sunspots, and great damage thanks to roaring Flames x3. The survivability and damage together are the biggest things we need since we will be somewhat close for the melees that we need to kill enemies with to cause the Severance Explosion for us! 

The entire Build is pretty simple at its core. It requires you to ramp up your Roaring Flames by getting solar ability kills, we only need 3 of these. Next, we throw our mini hammer or use our regular melee because it’s considered a powered melee thanks to the roaring flames buff. Every melee kill will also spawn sunspots for unlimited healing and we keep chaining this over and over.
GameplayLoop:
Use your Melee and Grenade to stack Roaring Flames x3.
This Buffs our Solar Abilities greatly and allows our Unpowered melee to still count as a Powered Melee.
Throw your melee or punch things to activate Severance Enclosure
Watch everything disappear in front of you!
Pick up the Orb of Power from heavy handed to proc the 2 Strand mods from the artifact.
Use your Strand primary to apply the Unravel debuff and watch the Nukes happen when you melee everything in your path.

Primary.Name: Jötunn
Primary.Info: The other exotic option that can be utilized with this build in lieu of Conditional Finality. Jötunn will one shot enemies that are frozen and spread damage to others.

Chest.Name: Osmiomancy Gloves
Chest.Info: With two Coldsnap charges, better seeking, grenade energy on hits, and the Iceflare Bolts Aspect, Osmiomancy Gloves can endlessly freeze opponents and set up easy kills.

HowItWorks:
The only ability of this build that can't freeze a target is the jump ability... 

The primary means of freezing a target is with Coldsnap Grenades paired with the Osmiomancy Gloves which give an extra grenade charge, gives energy back on hits, and makes the seekers travel farther. Penumbral Blast will freeze a target when hit. Healing Rift paired with Frostpulse will freeze enemies nearby when casting Rift. And of course Shadebinder will be able to freeze enemies as well. All of these freezing sources are enhanced by Iceflare Bolts which will chain freeze enemies near a frozen enemy that was shattered.

There are two exotic weapons that can be used with this build. The choice is based on preference and availability. The first is Conditional Finality which is adds another freezing source to the build and will be able to kill multiple frozen enemies in close proximity. The other is Jötunn which is better for landing longer range kills on frozen enemies. Whichever you choose use the equipped exotic to easily clean up enemies frozen from abilities and send Iceflare Bolts to other enemies.

The mods of the build are geared towards returning grenade energy quickly with Bomber and Grenade Kickstart as well as buffing the primary weapon in use. Be sure to change the Unflinching, Targeting, Loader and Surge mods to match the element of the primary weapon that is in use.
GameplayLoop:
Throw a Coldsnap Grenade at an enemy to freeze them and any other nearby enemies via Iceflare Bolts
Kill a frozen enemy with the paired exotic: Conditional Finality or Jötunn
Use Rift with Frostpulse or Penumbral Blast as alternative means of freezing enemies

Primary.Name: Scatter Signal
Primary.Info:
Overflow + Controlled Burst
Used for supplemental damage and for building super energy fast.

Chest.Name: Shards of Galanor
Chest.Info: Throwing Knife final blows decrease the cooldown of your Super. Hits and final blows with Blade Barrage will return Super energy after the Super ends

HowItWorks:
This build is great for endgame level add clear, dealing with champs, and dealing damage against bosses.

Shards of Galanor make it super easy to build super through melee kills and returns half your super almost guaranteed during damage phases. Dragons Breath pairs well with this to get off passive damage and auto-reloads when an ignition is triggered.

Finally a Fusion Rifle offers INSANE super regen as you damage bosses, which helps build super extremely fast and usually lets hunters get off 2 blade barrages in a single damage phase.
GameplayLoop:
Shoot Dragon’s Breath at boss to start DOT
Land Throwing Knifes to trigger Ignition and debuff the boss
Cast Super.
Spam Fusion Rifle for damage and super energy gains.
Shoot Dragon’s Breath when it auto-loads
Dodge and use Knife Trick again if enemies are nearby
Cast super a 2nd time
Repeat

Primary.Name: Wish-Ender
Primary.Info: Wish Ender is one of the strongest end game weapons in Destiny 2, and it plays perfectly into Building our Super quickly! It gives 4x the super energy on damage since it is a Exotic Primary and it does a ton of damage per shot to further enhance that!

Chest.Name: Star-Eater Scales
Chest.Info: With the Strand Hunter subclass being so good at refunding Class ability and grenade energy we can take an Exotic that enhances our super, and Star Eaters does just that! Quicker super with a lot more damage!

HowItWorks: This Build is all about getting your Super as fast as possible and letting it do some big damage on targets. The Strand Hunter subclass is amazing on its own, so you don't have to take a exotic that does anything ability wise thanks to the fragments. The combo of Wish Ender and Star Eater Scales allows you to get supers fast, and once you have super use it any opportunity! All while suspending the entire battlefield because the strand hunter subclass has 2 grenades and a dodge that suspends. You get those back very quickly thanks to 2 fragments that give grenade energy and class ability back! The gameplay loop is simple with this one, but very very Strong!
GameplayLoop:
Use normal dodge to proc the reaper mod
Throw grenade to suspend and let Wish-Ender go to town which will create 3 Orbs of Power on 2 kills thanks to mods and fragments
Throw grenade and use Wish-Ender again to make more orbs
The gameplay is simple but very strong and effective

Primary.Name: Scatter Signal
Primary.Info: With overflow and controlled burst, this makes a great secondary DPS option. Since it’s strand, it also plays into strand scavenger.

Chest.Name: Karnstein Armlets
Chest.Info: Getting a melee kill will grant x3 cure and x1 restoration. If you get a finisher it will instead apply x2 restoration while also still providing a x3 cure.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to never die and have restoration at all times.

This can be achieved because of your exotic Karnstein Armlets and its recent buff. Getting a melee kill or finisher will cure you and apply restoration. You can keep the restoration up with ember of empyrean, so with each solar weapon or ability kill, it will extend the timer. While this is up or when you proc your cure, you are pretty much unkillable. Remember, Karnstein can also reproc the restoration and always apply the cure on every melee kill or finisher.

With this build, you can also spam your abilities to help keep you alive and do massive damage. With ember of singeing every time you scorch an enemy, you will be granted increased class ability regeneration. Taking phoenix dive is the play because you can have an instant cure to help keep you alive, and it comes back almost immediately. With ember of searing, every scorch target you defeat will grant you melee energy and create a firesprite. Picking up the firesprites will grant you grenade energy, and you can further increase this by taking the mod innervation, so picking up orbs will also grant grenade energy.

Having your abilities is great because you can apply debuffs to bosses with the artifact perk revitalizing blast. Other perks to help out are flint striker so you can always be radiant alongside restoration and kindling trigger so your solar weapons can apply scorch to targets. These will stack with everything else we went over.

For aspects, touch of flame is a must so your fusion grenade can explode twice to deal massive damage. Icarus dash is also very nice for mobility to get out of any sticky situation you might be in. The final fragment is ember of ashes to apply more scorch stacks from everything in this build. Finally, running a heavy ammo finder is almost a must for solo content, and your Sunshot will be able to make a ton for you since it’s exotic.
GameplayLoop:
Get a melee kill or finisher on an enemy to cure and restoration
Keep restoration up by getting kills with Sunshot or your abilities.
Be aware that you can reapply restoration on a non-powered melee kill and finisher and also grant cure
Look for ammo to proc overflow on both your weapons.
Look out for orbs and firesprites to refill your grenade energy
Use your abilities on bosses to apply a debuff

Primary.Name: The Immortal (Adept)
Primary.Info: The top weapon in the meta right now. When paired with Peacekeepers it is only stronger. Rangefinder and Target Lock with maxed out range is the recommended roll. If you don't have the Adept version, the regular version works nearly as well.

Chest.Name: Peacekeepers
Chest.Info: Submachine Guns are very hot right now. The Immortal is the most used weapon in the crucible with good reason. Peacekeepers amplifies the efficacy of the SMGs by reloading them when stowed, readying them instantly, improves handling, improves movement speed when wielding one, and increases airborne effectiveness with them.

HowItWorks:
This build has quite a few things going for it. First Titans are the best class for utilizing The Immortal and other strong Submachine Guns because of the Peacekeepers. Second is Thundercrash is the best shutdown super in the game and has a lower cooldown. Lastly, Arc Titan has the means to buff and gets two charges of Lightning Grenades.

In terms of weapons paired with Peacekeepers, The Immortal is the recommended smg to use with this build. The smg to use is based on availability and preference, but some alternative options are the Ikelos smg, Tarrabah, Shayura's Wrath, and The Title. For the weapon to pair with an smg, there are quite a few options. A sniper would be good to balance out range, a wave frame grenade launcher to weaken enemies to close in on, or a shotgun can be used for full-on close-quarter aggression.

The abilities to build around are Barricade and Lightning Grenades. Barricade is great for taking map control, shutting off choke points, and securing objectives, revives, and heavy ammo. Lightning Grenades are great for forcing enemies off of areas. With Touch of Thunder, two charges are granted, and the initial blast will Jolt enemies and can lead to chaining multiple kills from just one grenade. Lightning Grenades can be built into even more by substituting Spark of Feedback with Spark of Shock so any hit with a Lightning Grenade will Jolt a target.

The neutral game is rounded out with the melee ability, which is buffed by Knockout and the Spark of Feedback Fragment. With the use of Submachine Guns, being in melee range is common, and once an opponent's shield is broken, Knockout activates, which will increase melee lunge distance, melee damage to 150, and start health regeneration on a melee kill. With Spark of Feedback active, melee damage increases to 150 after being hit with a melee or breaking a shield. This means landing just a couple smg shots instead of a double melee will win any double melee fight rather than trade.

Finally Thundercrash tops off the build as it can shut down Ward of Dawn and Well of Radiance in objective capturing or any roaming super. Thundercrash has a low cooldown time which will ensure it is available before most other supers.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Barricade for map control
Zone an area off using Lightning Grenades
Finish enemies who are Jolted and damaged with The Immortal
Utilize Seismic Strike to quickly escape or change directions if needed

Primary.Name: Tractor Cannon
Primary.Info: 30% debuff to increase melee damage.

Chest.Name: Peregrine Greaves
Chest.Info:
225% Damage increase to airborne shoulder charge.
1000% increase to airborne shoulder charge against Mini-Bosses, Champions, and Tormentors and refunds melee on hit.

HowItWorks:
This build is extremely easy to use and should be capable of 1-Shotting champions in GM’s when they release in season 23.

Peregrine Greaves offers 1000% increased damage against champions, minibosses, and tormentors. A void overshield gives another 100% increase in melee damage through offensive bulwark. Then a debuff like tractor cannon or tether offers another 30%.

This build easily grants 2500% increased melee damage through this stacking method along with devour and overshields for increased survivability.
GameplayLoop:
Gain an Overshield through barricades or echo of vigilance
Apply tractor cannon to a champion, miniboss, or tormentor
Perform an Airborne Shoulder charge
Repeat

Primary.Name: Deliverance
Primary.Info: Recommended Perks: Demolitionist & Chill Clip

Chest.Name: Heart of Inmost Light
Chest.Info: Even though Heart took a nerf at the beginning of Lightfall it is still one of the strongest exotics to use in ability based builds on the Titan. Heart gives 800% increased grenade and melee regeneration at a X2 as well as increased grenade and melee damage to top it off!

HowItWorks:
This build is all about the Consecration Slam on the Solar Titan. This Slam ability has amazing AOE Damage with its instant Ignitions and also provides some of the strongest single target damage thanks to the empowered x2 melee damage buff from Heart of Inmost Light. With the launch of Lightfall it has actually gotten a lot better thanks to the Slam being able to create Firesprites and Orbs of Power. 

Both of which feed the overall ability loop because Firesprites give grenade energy and the Orb of Power gives all ability energy on top of feeding armor charges for the Melee Kickstart mod. It is one big ability loop that has the best destructive power feeling you will find in Destiny 2.
GameplayLoop:
Use powered melee Slam to cause a Ignition and create a Sunspot
Stand in the Sunspot for healing and ability regen
Grab the resulting Orb of Power and Firesprite that Slam created
Throw grenade to keep Heart of Inmost Light’s buff up 
If needed, use class ability to proc Heart of Inmost Light again and mods
Repeat over and over. Slam then grenade

Primary.Name: Sunshot
Primary.Info: Changes burning maul to do only one slam that does massive damage and creates multiple cyclones. Consecration now creates a cyclone on it’s second slam.

Chest.Name: Pyrogale Gauntlets
Chest.Info: Changes burning maul to do only one slam that does massive damage and creates multiple cyclones. Consecration now creates a cyclone on its second slam.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to be unkillable while also having ridiculous ad clear and single-target damage.

Getting rapid kills or precision shots with your Sunshot will proc flint striker to grant you radiant. While radiant, you will get more damage and have the ability to scorch enemies with your weapon due to kindling trigger. On top of that, if you land a precision kill, you will also proc an ignition, which pairs well with Sunshot’s exotic trait for insane ad clear. This is because of rays of precision.

Defeating scorched targets will make sunspots due to the aspect sol invictus. Sunspots will grant you restoration and faster ability cooldowns while also dealing even more scorch damage to enemies. The radiant (from above) and restoration provided can be easily kept up because every kill you get will add time due to the fragment ember of empyrean. 

The other aspect, consecration, will let you turn your melee into a wave of scorch damage that you can slam down on to ignite. With your exotic Pyrogale Gauntlets, you will also make a cyclone on the second impact that can do more damage. With Pyrogale, you will also change your burning maul to be a one-slam super that does way more damage and then makes even more cyclones. Heart of the flame can also buff your super damage when teammates are around on cast.

With all the scorch in this build, taking advantage of ember of singeing for faster class ability cooldown is a must. Ember of searing will also grant you melee energy on defeating scorch targets which is nice to get consecration back faster. With that, you will also make firesprites that can refill your healing grenade. Then if you go back to sunspots you will get even more ability regeneration paired with everything here.

The final things to help the build out are things like ember of ashes to apply more scorch to enemies. Since you can spam your class ability taking dynamo for even more super energy is also very nice. Finally, a heavy ammo finder paired with Sunshot is also very good with the amount of easy kills you will be getting.
GameplayLoop:
Get kills with Sunshot to proc radiant
Scorch everything with your Sunshot, consecration, and sunspots
Look for orbs and firesprites
Refund all your ability energy
Use your throwing hammer to debuff a boss
Pop burning maul for massive damage

Primary.Name: Main Ingredient
Primary.Info: Recommended Perks: Under Pressure and Tap the Trigger

Chest.Name: Armamentarium
Chest.Info: Simply gives a second charge to Scatter Grenade. This is good to have because of the synergy these grenades have with the Fragments and Controlled Demolitionist Aspect.

HowItWorks:
There are two primary components to this build. The first is Scatter Grenades and the second is the Fusion Rifle, Main Ingredient. Scatter Grenades deal multiple bursts of damage which allows it to leverage Echo of Undermining and Controlled Demolition in unique ways. The first bit of damage from a Scatter Grenade will weaken the target and make them Volatile. This makes it such that the following bursts of damage from the Scatter Grenade will deal extra damage and cause an explosion from the Volatile application which will then heal you and nearby allies. Armamentarium is used to grant a second charge of this grenade.

Main Ingredient is in a very strong spot in the current meta. It has the appropriate range to deal with sub machine guns and shotguns. When ammo is available, utilize this weapon as much as possible.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Barricade for an Overshield
Throw Scatter Grenade to make enemies weakened and Volatile
Kills on enemies with depleted shield will give an Overshield from Echo of Vigilance

Primary.Name: Succession
Primary.Info: An alternative DPS option while Dragon's Breath is auto-loading

Chest.Name: Dawn Chorus
Chest.Info: Your Daybreak projectiles deal more damage and scorch targets on impact. Your scorch is improved and you gain a small amount of melee energy when your scorch damages a target.

HowItWorks:
This Solar Warlock Build helps you solo flawless pretty much anything in Destiny 2. That’s because of a new combo this season with the new Exotic Dragon’s Breath. Since it applies a constant Scorch damage with Ignitions we can play into this on the Warlock. We add in Ember of Singeing which means we can always get our rift back infinitely because this fragment gives us a 300% increase in class ability regen! 

So when we shoot a rocket off and switch to our Special for damage. We are getting that class ability back and our rocket is auto-loaded thanks to the Ignitions going off since we added in Dawn Chorus and Ember of Ashes.The Daybreak Super hits hard with Dawn Chorus. So you pop your rift, shoot off a Rocket, pop your super and throw all your blades. 

Then when you come out of your super, fire off another rocket and switch to your special. By the time the 2 rockets are done damaging you will have your rift back. This allows infinite healing on any damage phase. So when you're trying to solo flawless something this build will make it 10 times easier for you. No crazy ability rotation or weapon rotation for bait and switch or anything. We also never swap Builds or Exotic Armor. It’s a great simple Build!
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Grenade to Proc Restoration.
Use your Melee to Proc Radiant.
Solar Final blows will extend both of these
Use your Rift before firing Dragon’s Breath
The Scorch damage from Dragon’s Breath will give us a full Healing Rift back.
Use your Daybreak super right after dropping your rift and firing Dragon’s Breath.
Infinite rifts will keep you alive on any damage phase or platform.

Primary.Name: Skyburner's Oath
Primary.Info: Other solar options work very well such as Polaris Lance, Sunshot, Prometheus Lens, etc. Most kills will be from abilities, so this slot is mostly per preference.

Chest.Name: Ophidia Spathe
Chest.Info: Grants two charges of Knife Trick. This exotic works differently from other exotics that grant two charges of an ability as when the ability is refreshed by Gambler's Dodge or the Knock 'em Down Aspect both charges of Knife Trick are refunded rather than just one.

HowItWorks:
This build is able to take out waves of enemies utilizing Knife Trick for the vast majority of kills as they are refunded from the Knock 'em Down Aspect or through Gambler's Dodge. Ophidia Spathe is being used for two charges of Knife Trick, and when either a Knife Trick kill is secured or dodging near an enemy is performed, both charges of Knife Trick will be fully replenished. This allows these knives to be thrown on demand at all times. As a final means of getting melee energy back, One-Two Finisher will grant melee energy on a finisher and Invigoration will do so when picking up an Orb of Power. 

With Ember of Ashes, landing all 3 knives in Knife Trick will apply 90 Scorch stacks and will increase weapon damage through the Radiant buff from Ember of Torches. A second Knife Trick or a weapon that generates Scorch will then cause an Ignition.

With double Hands-On mods, Blade Barrage, one of the highest damage and fastest charging supers in the game will be available often. The other ability in use Healing Grenade, is there for added survivability. Paired with Ember of Empyrean, a Knife Trick kill or solar weapon final blow will extend the timers of Restoration from Healing Grenade and Radiant. Bomber and Grenade Kickstart are utilized for getting Healing Grenade back as soon as possible if the effects of Restoration end.
GameplayLoop:
Utilize Healing Grenade when hurt to grant Restoration
Throw Knife Trick to kill enemies, become Radiant, spread Scorch, regenerate super energy, and create Orbs of Power
Secure a kill with Knife Trick or a solar weapon to get additional time on Restoration and Radiant's effects through Ember of Empyrean
Pick up Orbs of Power for ability cooldowns and to generate Armor Charge stacks
If no Knife Trick is available, dodge near an enemy or utilize a finisher to replenish melee energy.
Utilize Blade Barrage as needed as the cooldown will be very fast from collecting Orbs of Power and Hands-On mods

Primary.Name: Dragon's Breath
Primary.Info: Dragon’s Breath is a perfect heavy weapon to add to the Build as it is all based around Ignitions and Scorch,

Chest.Name: Shards of Galanor
Chest.Info: Throwing Knife final blows decrease the cooldown of your Super. Hits and final blows with Blade Barrage will return Super energy after the Super ends.

HowItWorks:
This Solar Hunter Build is all about getting 15 Second Supers with the Exotic Shards of Galanor. These give us half our Super back when hitting targets and the other half comes from Throwing Knife Kills and damage dealt to enemies. 

In one phase of boss damage we can easily throw 3 Blade Barrages in and it really doesn’t require kills either. Just hits on the Target then damage over time. When you're dealing with just red bar enemies use Throwing Knife to proc the extra super regen from Shards of Galanor. Then pair that with hands-on and heavy handed mods to get a large chunk of Super per knife final blow! It is a very easy and simple build that is very powerful if you get your rotation down to keep up Restoration and Radiant all the time!
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Grenade to Proc Restoration.
Throw your Throwing Knife to Proc Radiant.
Extend both Restoration and Radiant with a Throwing Knife or Solar Weapon kill
Use your Dodge to keep up On Your Mark Stacks and your Melee ability
Get as many kills with your Melee ability as you can for Endless Supers.

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info: With the ability to freeze a Target Bonus damage can be added to throwing Knife!
