Chest.Name: Athrys's Embrace
Chest.Info: With This Exotic armor piece combined with the freezing of a target a knife can hit over 300K damage, which means they can 1 shot champions!

HowItWorks: This Build is all about a specific combo that allows you to one shot almost anything in the game. First we need to proc our Exotic Athrys’s Embrace by landing a few precision hits. Next stun a large enemy or champion. Then freeze the target using any source like Chill Clip, but Conditional Finality works the best here. Then make sure to land a precision hit with your throwing knife! This will deal over 300K damage to all enemies and can even 1 shot champions. Then repeat this process over and over. You can also use Throwing Knife on red bars to 1 shot them as well!
GameplayLoop:
Start by shooting a enemy with a few shots to procs Athrys’s Embrace
Throw your knife at red bars and 1 shot them to get it back with Radiant
Stun a Champion them, then freeze, then Throwing Knife them
This can 1 shot champions and give refund knife back
If you lose your knife, dodge near a target to get it back or scorch targets.
Repeat this combo to always have a throwing knife that deals over 300K damage

Primary.Name: Riptide
Primary.Info: Slow from chill clip can stun overload champions.

Chest.Name: Dawn Chorus
Chest.Info: Your Daybreak super does more damage and now applies scorch. Your scorch now does more damage, and when the scorch is ticking, you gain melee energy.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to spread scorch everywhere and cause ignitions all the time.

Our scorch damage will be buffed due to our exotic Dawn Chorus while also granting us melee energy per scorch tick. On top of that, your super will do more damage and apply scorch as well. With our exotic weapon, Polaris Lance getting 4 precision hits, will load a 5th shot that explodes and applies scorch. If you are running the kindling trigger artifact perk shooting an enemy will apply scorch while radiant, and then once the Polaris Lance explosion procs you will get an ignite. This is extremely nice because you essentially get an ignite every five shots from your exotic weapon.

Ignites are going to be extremely common because of that and because of the artifact perk rays of precision. Now while radiant, every precision kill you get will cause an ignite as well. Taking the fragment ember of char means that ignition will also apply scorch just like your Polaris Lance explosion. This will lead to ever more chaining ignites and massive scorch damage.

To be radiant at all times, the artifact perk flint striker will allow you to become radiant when getting rapid precision hits or solar weapon kills. This is nice because of how you are going to be using Polaris Lance. The fragment ember of empyrean will also help keep radiant up because you only need to get a solar weapon or ability kill to extend the timer. This is also nice because our healing grenade will apply restoration to us, and this will be extended as well because of the fragment. To buff the healing grenade, we'll take the aspect touch of flame for more cure and even stronger restoration.

Artifact perks like heart of the flame are nice to grant allies and yourself radiant while also increasing your super damage when you pop your super. This pairs nicely with Dawn Chorus. The final artifact perk is revitalizing blast, so your solar abilities can apply a debuff to bosses and champions.

Then the final things to round the build-out are going to be ember of ashes, so all the scorch stacks we apply will apply more. This leads to faster ignites and more damage. Since we will scorch everything the fragment ember of searing is nice because we will now make firesprites and grant even more melee energy. 

A final cool note is that if you run something with the chill clip perk, you have access to stun every champion. Chill clip will slow which stuns overload, radiant will stun barrier, and ignites can stun unstoppable champions.
GameplayLoop:
Get multiple precision final blows to proc radiant
Get multiple precision kills to proc ignites and spread scorch
Rapidly hit bosses or champs with precision hits to proc your scorch explosion
This explosion, paired with your scorch from kindling trigger, will cause an ignite
Use your buffed super on any boss for massive damage

Primary.Name: An Insurmountable Skullfort
Primary.Info: The Skullfort exotic will grant you 100% melee energy upon getting a kill whilst triggering health regeneration, allowing you to rush into groups of enemies spamming your melee to wipe out the room and gain continuous healing whilst at it.

HowItWorks:
The goal of the build is to use our melee to get our thundercrash back in less than 30 seconds.

We will rush into a room and if we are within 15 meters of 3 enemies, damage resistance is increased from Spark of Resistance. Following this we spam out melee, granting us absurd amounts of super energy depending on the tier of enemy we kill.

If we miss our melee and it does not kill, we have a backup plan. First you want to use your Thruster to activate the 2 outreach mods granting you 15% melee energy back. Then we throw our Pulse Grenade. The grenade will be extended from the Spark of Magnitude Fragment allowing for more pulses. Going from 6 to 8.

Every time the grenade pulses and deals damage it will create an Ionic Trace which grants us 12.5% Grenade + Melee Energy and 15% Class energy. If all 8 of our pulses hit, we should have full ability’s back for everything.

We can also use Spark of Shock to Jolt enemies, with Spark of Ions to spawn an Ionic Trace from the dead enemy, this allows us to fully maintain all of our abilities, allowing for absurd super regeneration, ability spam from innervation and survival from Skullfort and Recuperation that we spawn from melee kills.
GameplayLoop:
Run into a room and spam melee attacks to activate Skullfort and Knockout, granting you 20% bonus damage to charged melee attacks
If you miss a kill, throw a pulse grenade, the grenade will spawn Ionic Traces as long as you deal damage with each pulse, helping you regain melee energy
Use Thruster to help with both melee and grenade regen if needed

Primary.Name: Rufus's Fury
Primary.Info: Any strand weapon works here to take advantage of Unraveling Rounds

Chest.Name: Karnstein Armlets
Chest.Info: Vampire's Caress: Melee and finisher final blows instantly grant cure and provide restoration for a short duration. This is a 8 second Duration and the Cure is a X3 which is strong! A Finisher provides Restoration X2 as well and any glaive melee kill after that keeps proc'ing Restoration X2 back up to 8 Seconds

HowItWorks:
The 4 Subclass build combines 4 different Subclasses into one unique build that we have never seen before and it is very strong. There are so many moving parts to this build that you need to read the gameplay loop and understand it to see what is truly possible with this Build. By using a lot of updated gear and mods we can take Restoration x2 from the Solar subclass, Woven mail from the strand subclass, Void overshields from the Void subclass, and then Freeze and shatter from the Stasis Subclass to create this incredible monster of a build! 

Go around Glaive Meleeing anything that gets in your way and you can do this in difficult content with champions as you can see from the gameplay! You could also use a legendary Glaive if you don’t want to give up your Exotic slot, but you will lose one of the Subclass buffs for it. The Overshiled from Void or the Slow and Freeze from Stasis.
GameplayLoop:
Drop your Rift to activate the reaper Mod
Get a Kill with your Glaive and it will Spawn an Orb of Power, Proc Cure x3, Restoration, and Woven Mail
Block with Vexcalibur and Glaive away to add a Void Overshield
Every Melee Kill resets the Void Overshield, Restoration, and Cure x3
Every 10 seconds use the Projectile from Vexcalibur to get a double kill to spawn an Orb and Proc Woven Mail again for you.
Add in your Arcane Needle Melee to debuff enemies with Unravel.
Hit Unravel targets to spread Unravel and spawn a ton of threadlings from Horde Shuttle
Consume Shackle grenade to add in Suspend Burst on Every single Kill

Primary.Name: Prolonged Engagement
Primary.Info: Recommended Perks: Feeding Frenzy and Headstone

Chest.Name: Fr0st-EE5
Chest.Info: These boots give 100% increased melee and grenade recharge rate and give 3.5% of dodge's cooldown per second while sprinting. This will help keep abilities up often as it stacks multiplicatively with similar buffs.

HowItWorks:
This is a heavy utility build focused on keeping you alive while slowing, freezing, and shattering enemies. With its freezing capabilities, this build can handle champions without the use of anti-champion weapons.

Duskfield Grenade is the primary ability to look at. This grenade has its duration increased from 7 to 9 seconds with Whisper of Durance, will apply a 6 second freeze to enemies in its area for 1 second, and has a larger area plus a Stasis Crystal in the center with the Touch of Winter Aspect. This ability will lockdown the battlefield and be available often due to the use of Whisper of Shards which increases its regeneration rate by 500% for 6 seconds when destroying a Stasis Crystal. This effect is doubled while sprinting due to the use of FR0ST-EES. The use of FR0ST-EES will reduce the cooldowns of abilities immensely due to how often sprint is used in general play.

The build also makes use of the Whisper of Chains Fragment which will give 40% damage resistance when 10 meters or less from a Stasis Crystal. Duskfield Grenade gives this because of the Stasis Crystal it creates, which makes the grenade both offensive and defensive. This effect can also be activated through weapons with Headstone or being near any target that is frozen from abilities.

Withering Blade is another means of easily freezing targets as it applies 60 stacks of slow, and Revenant carries two charges of this ability. Both charges can be thrown to immediately freeze any target. Due to the strength of this mechanic, Gambler's Dodge is opted for to recover a charge of Withering Blade on a Dodge near an enemy. The other main means in which this cooldown is supplemented is by the use of the Grim Harvest Aspect which creates Stasis Shards when defeating Slowed or Frozen targets and gives melee energy when they are collected. These shards will also give healing and shields from the Whisper of Rime Fragment.

The mods and stats are the last bits of the build to look at. Due to the use of Whisper of Hedrons, freezing an enemy gives a 60 point increase to mobility, resilience, and recovery as well as weapon usability buffs for 11 seconds. This allows you to prioritize other stats as many opponents will be frozen when utilizing this build.

The mods of the build creates an Orb of Power for the first kill after dodging from Reaper. An orb will give energy to all three abilities, start health regeneration, and will fuel Grenade Kickstart through Armor Charges, giving grenade energy on its next use. For the other mods in use be sure to match the Siphon and Reserve mods with the weapons that are used.
GameplayLoop:
Throw a Duskfield Grenade to lockdown an area with Freeze and Slow effects
Kill frozen enemies to create Stasis Shards from Grim Harvest and to proc shatter AoE damage to destroy the small stasis crystal to gain 500% grenade regeneration rate from Whisper of Shards
Sprint towards the Stasis Shards to double the effect of the 500% regeneration rate increase and gain the shield, healing, and melee energy the Stasis Shards give.
Use Withering Blades at an enemies to refund grenade energy from Impact Induction, and to slow them and thus produce additional Stasis Shards when killing them
Dodge near an enemy to fully refund one charge of Withering Blade
The next kill after dodge will create an Orb of Power from the Reaper mod
Collect the orb for health, ability regeneration, and to improve the efficacy of Grenade Kickstart

Primary.Name: Swordbreaker
Primary.Info: A shotgun with One-Two Punch is a good option to have to increase melee damage.

Chest.Name: Shards of Galanor
Chest.Info: In Season of the Wish this exotic was buffed to give super energy with Throwing Knife kills. Build up a top tier damage super extremely quickly with this exotic using infinite Knife Trick.

HowItWorks:
This build is all about building up one of the best supers in the game, Blade Barrage. In season 23 Shards of Galanor got a buff which gives super energy when getting a kill with Throwing Knife. The Knock 'em Down aspect is the Aspect of this build which buffs Blade Barrage to deal more damage and allows for infinite Knife Trick.

Knife Trick is important to this build as it is the primary means of building up super energy and ad clear. The Ember of Torches fragment gives a 25% weapon damage buff by making you Radiant. Knock 'em Down makes Knife Trick refund itself on a kill while Radiant. This allows you to continuously throw Knife Trick to quickly build up super.

The defensive aspects of this build are through acquiring Restoration via the Ember of Searing and fragments which create a Firesprite when killing a scorched target, and when picked up grants Restoration. The time of Restoration can be continuously refreshed with the Ember of Empyrean fragment from getting a solar weapon or ability kill.
GameplayLoop:
Kill an enemy with Knife Trick to activate Ember of Torches and refund Knife Trick
Continue killing enemies with Knife Trick to build up super energy
Use Blade Barrage when available
Defeat Scorched targets to create a Firesprite
Pick up Firesprites to activate Restoration
Continue the Restoration and Radiant by getting kills with solar abilities or weapons

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info: With the ability to freeze a target, we can add crowd control to this already amazing Arc Hunter build.

Chest.Name: Liar's Handshake
Chest.Info: With the Nerf to one-two punch shotgun perk, Assassin’s Cowl no longer puts out enough damage to handle Champions in high end content. That is where Liar’s Handshake comes in! With a huge 200% increase in melee damage and changes to mods to add even more survivability, Liar’s is the play moving forward

HowItWorks: With the Nerf to the one-two punch shotgun perk, Assassin’s Cowl no longer puts out enough damage to handle Champions in high end content. That is where Liar’s Handshake comes in! With a huge 200% increase in melee damage, healing when punching, and the changes to mods to add even more survivability, Liar’s is the play moving forward with Arc hunters since we have insane damage in tandem with insane survivability and can loop in our grenade and super so much since we will be getting them so often! This Build is all about that aggressive playstyle and speed, getting in the face of enemies to let the Cross Counter perk from Liar’s Handshake work its magic!
GameplayLoop:
Punch red bar enemies to gain stacks of Combination Blow
Dodge in between to get a powered melee and a stack of Combination Blow on next kill
When on a champion smash that melee button
Work in Pulse Grenades since you will always have one
Throw your super because it will be up all the time as well.
Continue meleeing and dodging

Primary.Name: Monte Carlo
Primary.Info: You only need this if you are using your melee on red bar enemies.

Chest.Name: Peregrine Greaves
Chest.Info: All shoulder charge abilities (Seismic Strike, Hammer Strike, or Shield Bash) deal bonus damage when activated in the air. Damaging mini-bosses, Tormentors, or Champions with your shoulder charge refunds your melee.

HowItWorks:
The Hammer Strike Build takes advantage of the recently buffed Peregrine Greaves. With Season of the Wish they received a huge damage buff and along with that, when you damage a mini-bosses, Tormentors, or Champions with your shoulder charge it refunds your melee ability. This means you don’t even have to kill our target, but it will most likely die just because of the crazy damage shoulder charge does anyways! 

There are 2 main components to this build. The Exotic Boots and the 2 Aspects used. Roaring flames gives you your Big boy damage boost that lasts for 20 seconds and can stack up to 3 times! This damage along with the Exotic allows you to 1 Hit Kill. Next, take Sol Invictus because this increases Survivability with Restoration. If you can’t survive then no reason to go flying in like a crazy person!
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Grenade to get kills and Stack Roaring Flames X3
Use your melee Hammer strike on High health targets
With Peregrine Greaves and being in the air a short time you do insane damage!
Get our melee back for free as long as you damage high health targets!
Mods are for getting grenade back so it's always available to get Roaring Flames Stacks up!

Primary.Name: Round Robin
Primary.Info: The recommended perks are Keep Away for the improved accuracy and +10 Range this gives to the weapon when 15+ meters away and Kill Clip for two taps after a kill which can be activated from a Marksman's Dodge reload.

Chest.Name: Cyrtarachne's Facade
Chest.Info: This helmet gives Woven Mail for 10 seconds when Grapple is used. This gives damage resistance to body shots, making the user tankier.

HowItWorks:
This PvP build takes advantage of the many intricacies that Strand Hunter can utilize around the Grapple ability. The exotic for the build is Cyrtarachne's Facade which gives Woven Mail for 10 seconds each time Grapple is used. This improves survivability by granting damage resistance to body shots. 

The other benefits of Grappling are granted through the Fragment Thread of Ascent which gives the following bonuses after using Grapple: reloads equipped weapon, grants increased Handling, bonus Airborne Effectiveness, and increased Reload Speed. Strand Hunter gets two Grapple charges, so be sure to Grapple to an existing Grapple Tangle to refresh these buffs for free as it will not utilize Grapple's charge if shot at a Tangle.

The other very important Fragment of the build is Thread of Transmutation which creates a Tangle when the user has Woven Mail. Tangles can be shot to create an explosion that can be buffed by the artifact perks Untangler and Threaded Blast to Suspend targets hit by the blast. With the build most kills will create a Tangle due to how often Grapple will be available. Be sure to shoot the resulting Tangle when other enemies are nearby to chain together kills and take out clustered opponents.

On the surface, the super is arguably the weakest part of Strand Hunter's kit, but can be a strong portion if used properly. The Fragment Thread of Binding is used to buff the super by emitting a Suspending burst on super final blows for easier multi-kills. It is important to know that Grapple and Ensnaring Slam can continuously be used while in super. This makes it easier to close the gap on targets and Suspend other supers to win 1v1 super fights. Grapple and Ensnaring Slam can be used in tandem in or out of super, and it is recommended to try to land behind enemies to force them to turn around. Use those abilities to supplement the super and stick to the light attack which has a quicker cast time, one shots enemies, and has a generous hit box.

The final Fragment slot is a flex spot per the users choice. Good options are Thread of Rebirth for a potential Threadling being created on Strand Weapon kills or other Fragments that grant stat bonuses.

The mods of the build are for buffing Strand weapons by boosting Handling, Reload Speed, Accuracy, and reducing flinch. The other important mod to take note of is the use of two Reaper mods. This will create Orbs of Power when getting a kill after a dodge. When two orbs spawn the first will be at the target's location, the second will spawn in the very center of the map.

Strand Hunter is now the fastest subclass in the game with their newly acquired mobility. Leveraging this mobility will allow the user to get the most out of the build. The first thing to know is cancelling the Grapple. To do so use the Grapple then cancel by pressing the Grenade button again or swapping weapons. This allows the user to have a weapon out when engaging rather than waiting on the ready speed. The second tech is to Grapple, shoot, then melee. This lets the user quickly change directions to juke an enemy or even get in a quick melee after a shotgun shot to finish a weakened enemy. The next tech is the swing around which allows the user to quickly traverse the map by singing around corners, to do so shoot Grapple at a corner to be rounded, move the cursor away from the corner, and then steer the cursor along the bend. The final tech is being able to stay in air indefinitely. With two charges of Grapple, shoot one Grapple to create a Grapple Tangle in the air, shoot the Grapple Tangle with the other Grapple charge, Jump (which is refreshed after a Grapple), and repeat. This can be used to hover over corners, get away from supers, etc.
GameplayLoop:
Grapple to quickly Traverse the map, get weapon stat bonuses, reload weapon, and gain Woven Mail
Kill any opponent with or affected by Strand abilities to create a tangle.
Shoot the Tangle to chain together kills.
If Dodge was used prior to the kill collect the created Orbs of Power for reduced grenade cooldown and to begin health regeneration

Primary.Name: Thorn
Primary.Info: With the Buffs to hand Cannons and Thorn being an Exotic, those 2 things combined make Thorn hit like a Truck in End Game Content and spread Poison Damage!

Chest.Name: Necrotic Grip
Chest.Info: Damaging combatants poisons them, dealing increasing damage over time. Defeating a poisoned combatant spreads the condition.

HowItWorks:
The Devouring Broodweaver is all about 3 debuffs that will be happening all over your screen! This is the Suspend debuff, The Unravel debuff, and then the Poison damage from Necrotic Grips. When you consume your grenade it activates Weaver's trance, so every kill you get in the next 25 seconds will create a Suspending burst around it. 

Then throw out one of your melee abilities and this will apply the unravel debuff and the Poison from Necrotic Grips! This poison damage will tick for quite a while and proc the unravel debuff and spread it to enemies. When the poison kills an enemy it will proc the Suspend debuff as well and spread the poison damage to any nearby enemies. As you can see in the gameplay this is a super simple combo to do, but the results we get from it are just amazing!
GameplayLoop:
Consume your Grenade to activate Weavers Trance
Use one of your Melee abilities to spread the Unravel Debuff 
Use Thorn and start slaying enemies!
This will proc the suspending detonation from weaver's trance and also proc Poison from Necrotic Grips and the Poison will continuously proc the Unravel Debuff
Use your Rift ability when needed for survivability in difficult content
As soon as your grenade is back, consume it again and repeat steps 1 through 3

Primary.Name: Final Warning
Primary.Info: Any Strand weapon works here to synergize with the element of the build.

Chest.Name: Verity's Brow
Chest.Info: This exotic gives us a 100% damage increase to grenade damage with 5 Stacks. This also applies to the consumed grenade on Strand with Weaver’s Trance which turns the Suspend blast into chain kills because of the increased damage!

HowItWorks:
We all know how great Weaver’s Trance and the Suspend debuff are. Well this Build takes that to the next level. Our Suspend Burst of damage now deals double the damage and the Unravel debuff creates Suspend Explosions that will kill entire groups of enemies; even when 15 power level under the recommended. 

This is all thanks to Verity’s Brow and the Bonus damage it applies to grenades. This also applies to the suspend explosion because we consumed our grenade and all the Suspend blast’s functions as a Grenade now. Because of this, the Suspend Blast can deal double the damage, it can spawn orbs of power from the firepower mod, and proc other mods like Bolstering Detonation that gives rift energy when dealing damage with a Grenade! All of this combines to make Weaver’s Trance a better offensive weapon and combines it with the Suspend debuff.
GameplayLoop:
Consume Shackle Grenade to activate Weaver’s Trance
Start getting Kills with a Strand Weapon; for every kill, a stack of Verity's Brow is gained which turns the Suspend Blast into Damage
As soon as grenade is back consume it again and repeat
The consumed grenade functions as a Grenade which spawns Orbs, activates Ashes to Assets, and receives the buffs from Verity’s Brow to Chain Kill Enemies.

Primary.Name: Briarbinds
Primary.Info: Your Void Souls have a longer duration. They also gain escalating damage and durability as they defeat targets. You can retrieve your Void Souls by interacting with them, allowing them to be redeployed.

HowItWorks:
The Void Warlock has always been one of the best overall classes in Destiny 2 thanks to the subclass synergy and powerful Exotics to pair with it! With the new Season and the addition of the Briarbinds Exotic Gauntlets there is a new best in slot Exotic for the Voidlock, and man is this thing powerful! 

The entire build centers around healing rift and the Void Soul it creates. Then using the Briarbinds to beef up that Void Soul and make it last longer on the battlefield! This Build is simple as you can see by the ability rotation section, but it is the strongest Voidlock seen so far thanks to these new gauntlets! You have infinite abilities along with infinite Overshields and infinite Healing from Devour and Healing Rifts. The Video on this Page is a Solo Grandmaster and the hardest one at that. So enjoy this Build to your Heart's content!
GameplayLoop:
Use your Healing Rift to spawn a Void Soul and target a Champion
Once the Void Soul reaches its target throw a Vortex Grenade
Let the Void Soul or the Vortex Grenade get a Kill to proc Devour
Shoot your Repulsor Brace weapon to proc Overshields
Repeat

Primary.Name: Nessa's Oblation
Primary.Info: Recommended Perks: Repulsor Brace & Destabilizing Rounds

Chest.Name: Cyrtarachne's Facade
Chest.Info: This Exotic Helmet does not do a ton, but what it does provide is a 60% damage reduction when we activate our Grapple. This comes in the form of the Woven Mail buff and it can not be overstated how strong this damage reduction is in all content!

HowItWorks: We're taking advantage of the double grapple aspect on the Hunter to create grapple points for ourselves and our team. Then we use our Ensnaring Slam on groups of enemies or high priority Targets. Once we suspend everything we either use the grapple point we created to then do endless powered melees from our grapple to destroy everything while spreading the Unravel debuff. We can also use our weapons to take out high health targets like champions. You only need 1 or 2 kills to fully refund your class ability to start the loop all over again. This is how you play Strand Hunter and have the most fun while doing it!
GameplayLoop:
Use Grapple to get into the perfect position 
Next use Class ability that activates Ensnaring Slam
Defeat Suspended targets to get our dodge back quickly
Can grapple to the Grapple point made and perform the powered grapple melee
This spreads the Unraveling debuff and kills all red bar enemies
Grapple and execute Ensnaring Slam on High priority targets.
Rinse and Repeat and make sure to pick up Orbs of Power

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info:
On top of great damage and crowd control aspects it can stun Unstoppable Champs. 

Alternative: Escape Velocity w/ Osmosis - Instead of wasting the Primary Slot with a regular Kinetic you have the option of throwing your grenade to turn it into a Void Weapon and also take advantage of Volatile Rounds and Anti-Barrier Champs.

Chest.Name: Armamentarium
Chest.Info: Perk allows you to have 2 Grenades. With double Scatter Grenades paired with the Controlled Demolition Aspect you can clear rooms with ease, plus it has one of the fastest cooldowns in the grenade slot.

HowItWorks:
Start off an engagement by throwing a Scatter Grenade. This will make targets Volatile (Controlled Demolition) and also will allow for more Super Energy (Ashes to Assets), Orbs of Power (Firepower), gain Melee Energy (Echo of Provision and Momentum Transfer) and give Void Weapons Volatile Rounds (Echo of Instability)

Utilizing a Void Weapon with Repulsor Brace allows for a very high chance for the perk to proc (Volatile Rounds) giving you an Overshield and multi-kills will spawn Orbs of Power (Harmonic Siphon). You can also gain an Overshield from hitting targets with the Shield Throw Melee, cause Volatile (Controlled Demolition) and gain grenade energy (Echo of Exchange).

The main reason for Overshield is gaining the bonuses from Offensive Bulwark: Faster grenade recharge, increased melee range and damage, plus melee kills extend your Overshield duration.

Orbs of Power are important as they will not only allow you to take advantage of Devour (Echo of Starvation) for instant healing on kills and more grenade energy, but you gain bonus Void Weapon Damage (Surge Mods and Time Dilation) and grenade energy (Innervation).

If you really need your grenade you can use your class ability (Bomber x2). Harmonic Reserves will give more Special and Heavy Ammo for Void Weapons.
GameplayLoop:
Throw a grenade to spread Volatile to targets, gain super energy and an Orb of Power on kill, gain melee energy and Volatile Rounds
Use Void Weapons to spread more volatile and create Orbs of Power
Gain Overshield from melee ability, which gives grenade cooldown, or Repulsor Brace Perk
Collect Orbs of Power to proc Devour, Void Weapon Surge x2 and gain grenade energy
Cycle between weapons and abilities to keep up Volatile, Overshield, Devour, and Bonus Void Weapon Damage

Primary.Name: Riiswalker
Primary.Info: With the mobility of this build, this build can easily close a gap to be in shotgun range.

Chest.Name: Transversive Steps
Chest.Info: These boots not only increase sprint speed, but reloads your currently equipped weapon after sprinting a short duration.

HowItWorks:
This build prioritizes efficiency in 3v3 game modes (Trials, Competitive). Everything helps you “win now” by being always active, mobile, and in a good position throughout matches.

Icarus Dash, Transversive Steps, and Heat Rises get you to good positions first with a reloaded gun. At the start of rounds, use Icarus Dash until you’re where you need to be, and then use Heat Rises to get unexpected angles in-air. Remember, even if you don’t consume a grenade, Heat Rises allows you to aim down sights while gliding and gives you +20 Airborne Effectiveness passively. 

120 hand cannons like Igneous Hammer are great for 3v3 because they do high damage at long ranges, which is great for team shooting and staying at a safe distance. If the enemy does get too close, your shotgun can be used to clean them up.
The fragments both help with aerial play and survivability, which should be leaned into to get the most out of this build. They each grant Firesprites, Restoration or bonus airborne effectiveness through solar weapon kills, solar ability kills, or reviving teammates, all of which you will already be doing. Collecting Firesprites grant grenade energy and Restoration, so collecting them should be a priority.

In 3v3 game modes, supers are rare but more impactful. Some 3v3 games are so short that no one gets a super, but by running Well of Radiance, you will ensure that you will always be one of the first to get their super. You can use your efficient movement abilities to get very close to the enemy and drop the Well right next to them, usually securing a few kills. These few kills are enough to win rounds. 

Always be on the move. Transversive Steps will automatically reload your weapon after sprinting for a short time, so use that and Icarus Dash to move where your teammates need you, where your opponents don’t expect you, and to get out of bad situations quickly.
GameplayLoop:
Use the speed from Icarus Dash and Transversive Steps to be the first to good positions
If the map permits, consume a Firebolt Grenade to proc Heat Rises, allowing unsuspecting angles to be held in-air
Phoenix Dive and Icarus Dash can be used for mid-air evasiveness
Use your Igneous Hammer (or a comparable 120 hand cannon) to do large damage at extended ranges
If they get too close, swap to your Riiswalker (or a comparable shotgun) for cleanup kills Sprinting reloads your equipped weapon, allowing you to always be on the move
If you take damage, Firebolt Grenades can be consumed to give a burst of health
Any enemy killed that was scorched by Firebolt Grenades or Celestial Fire will drop a Firesprite, which grant grenade energy and Restoration
If a teammate is down, reviving them grants Restoration for you and all allies around you
Well of Radiance is the fastest charging super in the game, which will likely lead to you being the first to super. Use it aggressively before the other team gets theirs

Primary.Name: No Time to Explain
Primary.Info: Between the time portal on this weapon and Arc Soul, this weapon is a great option for chip damage to lower its TTK.

Chest.Name: Ophidian Aspect
Chest.Info: Greatly increases handling and reload speed of weapons. This is a top neutral game exotic.

HowItWorks:
This build can play well at long and close ranges. Long range duels are played through No Time to Explain. The time to kill of this pulse is reduced through its Time Portal which chips away enemies as well as with Arc Soul which stacks alongside Time Portal. Prioritize Recovery to have access to Rift which is the means of summoning an Arc Soul.

Close range is through the use of a Matador 64 which can be quickly swapped to with Ophidian Aspects. The other close range aspect is Lightning Surge. This is a very strong melee ability that allows you to teleport on to an enemy and deal damage. This goes really well with a shotgun that you can slide, then shoot the shotgun, and then activate Lightning Surge. The chip from the shotgun and an Arc Soul will allow Lightning Surge to easily finish enemies.
GameplayLoop:
Cast Rift for healing and to summon an Arc Soul
Land precision shots with No Time to Explain to summon Time Portal which compliments damage alongside Arc Soul
Land grenade hits to Jolt targets
At close range slide shoot with Matador 64
Finish target with Lightning Surge by activating melee while still in slide after shooting Matador

Primary.Name: Forbearance
Primary.Info: Any good wave clearing option works here. Forbearance is an example of a top weapon in the game for that role.

Chest.Name: Abeyant Leap
Chest.Info: Harnesses the power of Suspend and makes Barricade Suspend more targets. Gain Woven Mail when suspending a target.

HowItWorks:
This build is quite straightforward to play yet is fantastic in end game content because of how well it utilizes the Suspend mechanic. Barricade is the best way to Suspend targets due to the use of the Abeyant Leap exotic boots which make Drengr's Lash track more targets, and track them more aggressively. Shackle Grenade is utilized as well and is the other means of suspending targets. 

When multiple targets are suspended, the use of weapons that match the selected Siphon mods and precision kills will be how this build makes Orbs of Power from double Siphon mods and Thread of Wisdom. The build utilized arc weapons as an example, but feel free to utilize any element weapons in the game, but be sure to match your helmet's Siphon and Weapon Surge mods with the element of the weapons you choose. Precision kills on suspended enemies should not be too hard to achieve because they are... floating in the air and can't move. Kills on Suspended targets will then feed back into getting your Barricade back through the Thread of Mind Fragment.

Once Orbs of Power are collected it will boost your weapon damage. These stacks of Armor Charge will go away once Barricade is used again because of Utility Kickstart. This will give more Barricade energy at the cost of losing the arc damage buff. This build can make orbs so easily that it is worth having Barricade available more often.
GameplayLoop:
Cast Barricade to Suspend multiple enemies
Kill suspended targets with weapons to create an Orb of Power and get class ability from Thread of Mind
Collect Orb(s) of Power for a boost to weapon damage
If Barricade is not available, throw Shackle Grenade to Suspend more targets
Repeat steps 2-3
Repeat steps 1-5

Primary.Name: Judgment of Kelgorath
Primary.Info: Any Glaive works as they activate Karnstein Armlets

Chest.Name: Karnstein Armlets
Chest.Info: Melee kills will instantly restore health and with season 23 these will proc on finishers and grant Restoration.

HowItWorks:
Enter weavers trance via mindspun invocation and you can suspend and get easy health regen via your selected glaive or your melee. Health regeneration on melee kill, or a glaive melee kill via the mighty underused Karnstein Armlets. Featuring some great glaives including judgement of kelgoroth, Vexcalibur and Winterbite. 

You get some huge survivability with this life draining strand Warlock build. Also showing an easy way to get woven mail by killing suspended enemies with the fragments thread of warding and thread of wisdom. Suspend kill easy woven mail backed up by the vampire exotic perk on Karnstein.
GameplayLoop:
Consume your shackle grenade to enter weavers trance
Melee with glaive to start the suspend and health regen.

Thread of wisdom gives orbs for killing suspended targets and thread of warding gives woven mail on orb pickups so easy woven mail on top of the health regen from Karnstein Armlets.

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Weapons are preference for this build. Quicksilver is a good option as it is arguably the best Strand weapon in the game

Chest.Name: The Sixth Coyote
Chest.Info: This chest piece grants two charges of Dodge, which allows you to use Ensnaring Slam more often.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to Suspend as many targets as possible through the Ensnaring Slam Aspect. This Aspect is tied to class ability, so Sixth Coyote is the preferred exotic due to it granting two charges of Dodge. Marksman's Dodge is used for the shorter cooldown as dodge will almost be exclusively used for Ensnaring Slam. 

This playstyle involves diving into groups of enemies, and survivability is tied to collecting Orbs of Power which are created from Grapple Melee kills or through Siphon mods. If playing more difficult content in which Grappling into groups of enemies is more threatening, Shackle Grenade can be utilized for a safer playstyle. 

After Suspending a group of enemies, kill them by means to create an Orb of Power and for more class ability energy from the Thread of Mind Fragment. Picking up an Orb of Power will give Woven Mail from Thread of Warding and a small heal from Recuperation for survivability. 

Weapons of this build are purely preference, just be sure to match the elements of the mods with the element of the weapons you choose to utilize.
GameplayLoop:
Activate Ensnaring Slam into a group of enemies to Suspend them		
Defeat the Suspended targets, preferably with Grapple Melee to create an Orb of Power via Heavy Handed OR a Strand weapon to create an Orb of Power via Siphon mods
Pick up an Orb of Power to gain Armor Charge for Weapon Surge, heal, and gain Woven Mail		
Repeat

BuildTitle: Duddits' Touch of the Quiet One

Primary.Name: Touch of Malice
Primary.Info: The shields of the Void Titan and health regeneration from Mask of the Quite One get around the self damage of shooting this weapon on the final round, allowing you to take advantage of the weapon's bonus damage and health restoration after 3 kills.

Chest.Name: Mask of the Quiet One
Chest.Info: When critically wounded gain max health on kills which pairs perfectly with Touch of Malice which can bring your health to critical range. It has the added bonus of giving ability energy when receiving damage from enemies (does not activate from Touch of Malice).

HowItWorks:
Become invincible with Mask of the Quiet One and Touch of Malice! This build has everything in it with massive damage and being very very hard to kill! 

Featuring devour for huge health and grenade regen. Also featuring controlled demolition for volatile exploding health regeneration on top of devour health regen! PLUS you have more safety with echo of vigilance for a reserve overshield. 

If you pair that with the severely under used exotic on the Titan, the Mask of the Quiet One you get unlimited grenades and class ability regen. Also Mask of the Quiet One gives even more safety via the exotic perk dreaded visage. Mask of the quiet one paired with echo of vigilance and devour seems crazy!
GameplayLoop:
Throw down barricade for overshield
Create Orbs of Power with Touch of Malice or grenade kills
Pick up orbs normally or shoot with shoot to loot weapon 

Orbs then gives you devour so you can go on a massive killing spree whilst gaining health and more grenade regeneration

Primary.Name: Izanagi's Burden
Primary.Info: Reload cancelling and swapping with this weapon gives enough time  for Thread of Ascent's cooldown to be able to reload your rocket launcher again.

Chest.Name: Assassin's Cowl
Chest.Info: Normally meleeing enemies while flying in on a Grapple is very dangerous, this exotic allows you to do this safely and rewards you for doing so by healing you and making you go invisible on a kill.

HowItWorks:
This build has elements for the neutral game and boss DPS. For the neutral game this build leverages the clearing power of Grapple Melee, spawns an Orb of Power, and activates the invisibility and healing from Assassin's Cowl.

As for boss DPS there is a bit of juggling involved here due to having to balance the timers of Izanagi's Burden reload and Thread of Ascent only being able to reload your weapon on an intrinsic cooldown. Thread of Ascent is being used to reload your rocket launcher and is accomplished by shooting your first Grapple to create a Grapple Tangle, and then when your rocket launcher is out of ammo shooting your second Grapple charge at the Grapple Tangle to reload the rocket launcher. Izanagi's Burden takes a while to charge reload and swap to and from which gives just enough time for the intrinsic cooldown of Thread of Ascent to finish, allowing the auto-reload to be performed on Hothead.

The last bit of this build is to be sure to have both Grapple charges available before DPS starts, otherwise you won't be able to take advantage of indefinitely being able to use the second Grapple charge on the Grapple Tangle created from the first Grapple charge.
GameplayLoop:
Activate Grapple and melee an enemy to create two Orbs of Power, partially heal, go invisible, and reduce cooldowns
Shoot first Grapple Charge at the floor where DPS will be done to create a Grapple Tangle
Shoot Izanagi's Burden
Charge reload Izanagi's and reload cancel with a swap to Hothead
Shoot Hothead
Activate Grapple on nearby Tangle to reload Hothead from Thread of Ascent
Shoot Hothead shot
Swap to and Shoot Izanagi's Burden
Charge reload Izanagi's and reload cancel with a swap to Hothead
Activate Grapple on nearby Tangle to reload Hothead from Thread of Ascent
Shoot Hothead shot
Swap to and Shoot Izanagi's Burden
Repeat the Grapple, Hothead, and Izanagi's cycle

Primary.Name: Ticuu's Divination
Primary.Info: Benefits from Ember of Empyrean by being a solar bow. This bow is fantastic for ad clear due to its solar explosions. It also works with multiple people using the bow where one player can hip fire to mark targets, and another uses ADS shots for explosions.

Chest.Name: Oathkeeper
Chest.Info: Allows perfect draws to be held indefinitely, but also provides a ramping damage buff the longer they are held, specifically granting a 37.5% damage increase every 0.5 seconds, up to a 150% total damage buff. Grants 40 airborne effectiveness and a bonus 10 points to your draw time stat to all bows.

HowItWorks:
This build is capable of a 352% damage buff to bows with Oathkeeper, Radiant, and weapon surge mods. Oathkeeper allows for a perfect draw to be held indefinitely and can scale bow damage up to a 150% buff if the bow is held for 4 seconds.

There are a few options for the bow itself. Solar element bows synergize well with the build as they can take advantage of Ember of Empyrean to refresh Radiant and Restoration timers. Ticcu's Divination and Pre Astyanax IV are great solar options. Wish-Ender is a non-solar option that is a great all around bow. If not utilizing a solar bow, swap Siphon and Loader mods as well as Ember of Empyrean to Ember of Solace to increase Radiant and Restoration timers.

The abilities of the build are the means of obtaining Radiant and Restoration. Knife Trick will give a 25% damage boost on a hit by giving you the Radiant buff from Ember of Torches, and the charge will reset on a kill. Knife Trick also scorches targets which activates Ember of Singeing for a 300% increased dodge recharge rate for 3 seconds. Healing Grenade gives Restoration. When killing a scorched target, Ember of Searing grants melee energy and spawns a Firesprite. If using a solar bow and Ember of Empyrean, these timers are reset on a bow kill. When applying these buffs to teammates, Ember of Benevolence gives a 6 second 400% bonus to grenade, melee, and class ability regeneration.
GameplayLoop:
Hit a target with Knife Trick to activate Radiant for a 25% damage boost
Utilize Healing Grenade to activate Restoration
Kill targets with bow to create an Orb of Power and refresh Radiant and Restoration timers
Collect Orbs of Power for 17% damage boost and grenade energy
Blade Barrage any high health targets when available
Utilize dodge near a target to refund Knife Trick if charge is down

Primary.Name: Wavesplitter
Primary.Info: With access to Orbs of Power and Volatile Rounds this exotic gets a damage buff and shreds everything.

Chest.Name: Gyrfalcon's Hauberk
Chest.Info: Gives Volatile Rounds after a Dodge, and will make the user Invisible after a kill due to its synergy with Stylish Executioner.

HowItWorks:
Void Hunter is capable of going invisible essentially on demand. The loop of this build is started by dodge to go invisible and activate the effect of Gyrfalcon's Hauberk which will give you Volatile Rounds. Using Wavespliiter or any other Void Weapon, take advantage of the Volatile Rounds, as killing a Volatile target will activate Stylish Executioner to make you invisible and grant Truesight which lets you see enemies through walls. On top of that defeating a target will spawn an Orb of Power from Reaper, and a Void Breech from the Echo of Cessation Fragment. 

Picking up an Orb will grant Devour, give Wavesplitter its max damage buff, and heal you. The duration of invisibility and Devour are extended with the Echo of Persistence Fragment. The last bit of the build to take note of is its ability to weaken enemies. This can be done by hitting an enemy with Super an enemy, throwing Smoke Bomb at a target, throwing a Grenade at a target, or hitting a target with a melee after activating Stylish Executioner. Shadowshot is one of the few sources of a 30% weaken debuff, making it a great tool for dealing boss damage.
GameplayLoop:
Dodge to go Invisible and gain Volatile Rounds		
Kill an enemy with a Void Weapon to make enemies Volatile, go Invisible, make a Void Breech, and at least one Orb of Power		
Pick up a Void Breech or Orb of Power to get Devour		
Kills with Void Weapons will Heal, spread Volatile, and make you Invisible		
Weaken enemies through melee or Scatter Grenade		
Dodge if you no longer have Volatile Rounds to regain them

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Primary Add clear weapon that can generation tangles.

Chest.Name: Swarmers
Chest.Info: Destroying a tangle spawns threadlings. Threadlings unravel targets.

HowItWorks:
With this build you can let threadlings add clear for you. To do this you can either shoot enemies which send threadlings that are perched to their location, or summon rift to immediately send all threadlings out.

Weavewalk is capable of generating 5 threadings w/ each melee charge you have. Rift can spawn an additional 3 threadlings and so can threadling grenade. Destroying tangles also will spawn 2 threadlings.

At any given time you are capable of spawning 13 - 23 threadlings given that all abilities are fully charged.
GameplayLoop:
Use weavewalk to spawn in 5 perched threadlings.
Use rift to spawn 3 additional threadlings and send all threadlings out towards enemies.
Throw threadling grenade for 3 additional threadlings.
Collect orbs of power.
Weavewalk again to perch 5 more threadlings
Shoot weapons at enemies to send threadlings out to deal damage.
Destroy tangles for additional threadlings and melee energy back.
Repeat these steps using rifts and grenades when they are off cooldown.

Primary.Name: Witherhoard
Primary.Info: A good tool for passive damage while you are throwing endless abilities.

Chest.Name: Young Ahamkara's Spine
Chest.Info: These gauntlets give Tripmine Grenade energy back when dealing damage with any ability, including Tripmine Grenades.

HowItWorks:
This is the Hunter's version of using Fusion Grenades and Starfire Protocol. Young Ahamkara's Spine buffs Tripmine Grenades by making ability energy refund grenade energy. Damage from Tripmine Grenades and Knife Trick helps recover more Tripmine Grenade energy, and allows you to spam Grenades.

The rest of the build revolves around getting buffs from applying scorch and managing ability cooldowns. Knife Trick hits make you Radiant, and fully refunds itself on a kill. If you miss your Knife Trick, use Gambler's Dodge near an enemy to fully refund Knife Trick. Grenade kills will boost the cooldowns of every ability and super, create an Orb of Power from the Firepower mod as well as Cure you through Ember of Resolve.

Scorching targets is the last thing this build does well. Your abilities Scorch targets, and it is recommended to use a primary weapon with Incandescent to scorch enemies on weapon kills as well. Ember of Ashes increases the amount of Scorch you apply, Ember of Searing will create a Firesprite when you defeat Scorched targets, and Ember of Singeing will boost your Dodge cooldown when you apply Scorch to targets.
GameplayLoop:
Throw Tripmine Grenade
Shoot Rocket Launcher
Throw Knife Trick to get Radiant weapon damage buff
Throw Tripmine Grenade to reload Rocket Launcher that has Demolitionist
Shoot Rocket Launcher
Dodge to fully replenish Knife Trick
Throw Knife Trick
Throw Tripmine Grenade to reload Rocket Launcher that has Demolitionist

Primary.Name: Funnelweb
Primary.Info: Main Add Clear Weapon

Chest.Name: Contraverse Hold
Chest.Info:
Charged Void Grenades return grenade energy on hit.

Gives ROUGHLY 50% of your grenade back on the hit w/ a 4s cooldown.

HowItWorks:
Holding in a magnetic grenade turns this into a Handheld Supernova. With Contraverse Hold this is going to return half our grenade on use.

Grenade kills also generate orbs of power and grant volatile rounds to void weapons. Orbs of power give Devour and armor charge stacks.

Devour kills can return grenade energy if need.

After getting 2 orbs of power, using our grenade should NEARLY give us a full refund each time. Allowing us to infinitely chain handheld supernova grenades and then drop our rift when needed to collect orbs and activate bombe
GameplayLoop:
Charge Magnetic Grenade and get a kill
Collect both orbs of power and the void breach to get armor charge stacks and Devour
Get kills until grenade returns w/ volatile rounds void weapon
Get kills w/ grenade again.
Drop rift to collect orbs of power.

Repeat 3 - 5 till everything is dead

Primary.Name: CALUS Mini-Tool
Primary.Info: The Scorch from Incandescent will regenerate Barricade even quicker. Any weapon with Incandescent is a good option.

Chest.Name: Loreley Splendor Helm
Chest.Info: The best exotic in the game for survivability as it will use Barricade to create a healing Sunspot when damaged.

HowItWorks:
The purpose of this build is to stay alive as well as possible in higher-difficulty content. Loreley Splendow Helm will give most of this build's survivability through activating a Restoration Sunspot when your health gets low by using the Barricade Cooldown. 

The other tools of the class are designed to get your class ability back as quickly as possible in order for this effect to be used as much as possible. Scorching targets will give class ability energy through the Ember of Singeing Fragment, which gets activated by a weapon with Incandescent, and melee damage from Throwing Hammer will also give back class energy via Focusing Strike, which you can elect to use two copies of if preferred over stat mods.

Other forms of healing and survivability this class has when the class ability is recharging is from Healing Grenade and the creation of Sunspots on Throwing Hammer kills. Between all of these sources of healing and recovery, enemies will have a difficult time taking you down.
GameplayLoop:
When at low health Loreley Splendor Helm will passively activate to create a Sunspot from class ability energy
Replenish class ability energy by dealing melee damage with Throwing Hammer
Utilize Healing Grenade if your health is low and your class ability is not fully charged

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info: Stasis Exotic Capable of freezing enemies quickly.

Chest.Name: Renewal Grasps
Chest.Info:
Increase the Duskfield Radius by 25%
Enemies in duskfield deal 50% less damage
Allies get 25% damage resist while in Duskfield as well

HowItWorks:
Duskfield Grenades will be paired with Whisper of Chains to offer up to 55% damage resistance in total. These can be used to offer you and your team DR or thrown near enemies to freeze and offer crowd control.

Frozen enemy defeats will generate stasis shards, which will be collected and grant armor charge stacks, feeding into your ability loop.

Orbs of Power created through weapon final blows and the reaper mod will grant armor charge stacks and healing.
GameplayLoop:
Throw your Duskfield Grenade (Either near you or enemies)
If possible, stay in the duskfield to gain damage resistance
Break the stasis crystal for increased grenade regen
Dodge to get grenade energy and collect orbs of power
Repeat.

Primary.Name: Izanagi's Burden
Primary.Info: A high burst damage sniper rifle; be sure to reload cancel a powered shot by switching to another weapon or using an ability.

Chest.Name: Cuirass of the Falling Star
Chest.Info: Increases Thundercrash's damage, increasing overall DPS during a damage phase. Another exotic can be used during general play, and swap to this exotic before a damage phase if swapping is enabled.

HowItWorks:
This build is for dealing heavy DPS as a Titan. Thundercrash buffed by Cuirass of the Falling Star is one of the best DPS supers in the game.

The weapons of choice are Izanagi's Burden and Hothead with Auto-Loading Holster. This is preferred due to the ability to swap between these two weapons by reload canceling Izanagi's Burden and letting Auto-Loading Holster activate on Hothead while shooting and reload canceling Izanagi's Burden. Use Pulse Grenade during DPS as well due to its high damage with the Touch of Thunder Aspect.

When utilizing the neutral game of this build, play around your energy weapon and use Pulse Grenade on cooldown. With the combination of Spark of Shock and Spark of Ions, Jolting targets hit by grenades, and defeating a Jolted target giving an Ionic Trace and as a result you will frequently have Pulse Grenades.

It is highly recommended to have an energy weapon with the Voltshot perk to get back grenade energy more often as this will trigger the Spark of Ions Fragment.
GameplayLoop:
Shoot Izanagi's Burden
Reload cancel Izanagi's Burden by performing the reload animation and throwing Pulse Grenade
Shoot Izanagi's Burden and perform a reload cancel by swapping to Hothead
Shoot Hothead
Swap back to Izanagi's Burden to activate Auto-Loading Holster on Hothead
Use Thundercrash
Juggle between Izanagi's Burden with a reload cancel and Hothead with Auto-Loading Holster until end of DPS phase

BuildTitle: Duddits' Cuirass Of The Falling Star HOIL Mixer Titan

Primary.Name: Wish-Ender
Primary.Info: Bow that deals extra damage from piercing and has Anti-Barrier capabilities.

Chest.Name: Cuirass of the Falling Star
Chest.Info: This chest piece is a must use for dealing max DPS with an Arc Titan due to the extra damage it gives to Thundercrash.

HowItWorks: No need for Heart of Inmost Light with this Titan Build! Using Cuirass of the Falling Star for huge instant damage for dps or getting rid of champs. But the way this build is set up is to get instant grenades quicker than you would using the other popular Arc Titan exotic Heart of inmost light. Do this by utilizing Powerful Attraction and Innervation mods, put down your Barricade and gain instant nades! Best of both exotics combined into one build.
GameplayLoop:
Create Orbs of Power from Arc Weapon and Pulse Grenade kills
Use Barricade to collect Orbs of Power with 3x Powerful Attraction mods
Spam Pulse Grenades when available due to getting energy from Innervation mods

Primary.Name: The Navigator
Primary.Info: Applies Sever to enemies, and grants the user woven mail. Shoot allies to grant woven mail to both of you. After a cooldown, alt-fire to create a grapple point.

Chest.Name: Verity's Brow
Chest.Info: Weapon final blows with damage types matching your subclass give grenade damage and regen boosts through stacks of Death Throes. While using your grenade, while Death Throes is active, nearby allies get a temporary x10 grenade regen bonus.

HowItWorks:
Get kills with the Navigator or any strand weapon to get stacks of Death Throes on Verity's Brow and generate Tangles. Getting kills with strand weapons grants stacks of Death Throes, which enhance grenade regen and grapple melee damage.

Either create a grapple point with the navigator or grapple onto a tangle and use your grapple melee ability. Getting kills with your grapple melee creates multiple orbs of power, which grant you bonus health, woven mail, and a Strand Weapon damage boost. Any orbs of power you pick up grant nearby allies a stack of armor charge, and when you use your grenade charge with stacks of death throes, nearby allies get a temporary x10 grenade regen rate. 

Grappling onto grapple points or tangles instantly refreshes your grenade charge, and picking up tangles generates additional grenade energy. Repeat the loop for infinite high damage grapple melees.
GameplayLoop:
Get kills with the Navigator or any strand weapon
Grapple onto a grapple point, tangle, or anywhere needed
Get kills with your grapple melee ability
Pickup any created orbs of power
Alt fire with the navigator to make a new grapple point
Swap between strand weapon kills and grapple melee kills

Primary.Name: The Lament
Primary.Info: This pairs very well with Stronghold as both The Lament and the exotic gloves get their bonuses from blocking. This sword also has Anti-Barrier intrinsically.

Chest.Name: Stronghold
Chest.Info: These gloves increase the defensive capabilities of swords immensely. These gives swords a maximum guard stat, extra damage resistance when blocking, and gives Restoration after blocking based on the number of hits blocked.

HowItWorks:
With the use of Strongholds, The Lament, and Banner of War this build makes it hard to die, but also can dish out solid damage. Strongholds increase the blocking damage resistance you get and activates Restoration based on hits blocked. The Lament is a great DPS tool, but also heals on dealing damage. Banner of War gives pulses of healing once activated from a sword or melee kill and gives a 10% damage boost to swords and 40% to melees.

Otherwise this build plays like a fairly standard Strand Titan build with suspension from Shackle Grenade which is extended from Thread of Continuity. Defeating a suspended target will create a Tangle as well as an Orb of Power from Thread of Wisdom. Grenade energy is given back from simply dealing damage via Thread of Generation as well as collecting Orbs of Power from mods.
GameplayLoop:
Defeat a target with a melee or sword to activate Banner of War for  healing and sword/melee damage buffs
Suspend an enemy with Shackle Grenade
Defeat the suspended enemy to spawn an Orb of Power from Thread of Wisdom as well as a Tangle
Destroy the Tangle to activate Into the Fray for Woven Mail and increased melee regen
Pick up the Orb of Power for ability regeneration and Woven Mail
Block with The Lament as needed to have nearly 100% damage resistance to take extremely minimal damage

Primary.Name: Unforgiven
Primary.Info: A good void SMG that takes advantages of the buffs to void weapons.

Chest.Name: Nothing Manacles
Chest.Info: This exotic gives an extra charge and aggressive tracking to Scatter Grenade, including its strength immensely.

HowItWorks:
Scatter Grenades paired with Nothing Manacles are a potent tool for clearing groups of enemies due to the gauntlets giving tracking and an extra charge.

With Echo of Expulsion grenade kills make enemies explode, increasing the power of the grenades. If an enemy is not killed by the grenade it is weakened from the Echo of Undermining Fragment. The mods are picked to create Orbs of Power to build up Armor Charge, which will then lead to quicker grenade cooldowns via Grenade Kickstart and Innervation. This will allow you to get grenades much faster.

The survivability of this build comes from Devour which is gained from picking up Orbs of Power or from Void Ability kills. Once Devour is active, if a kill is secured before the timer ends, Devour is refreshed.
GameplayLoop:
Throw Scatter Grenades to create Orbs of Power, activate Devour, generate Super energy, create an Orb of Power, and activate Echo of Expulsion on a kill and to weaken enemies damaged
Pick up Orb of Power to gain Devour, grenade energy, and build Armor Charge
With Armor Charge, throw Scatter Grenade on cooldown to activate Grenade Kickstart
If no grenade is availabe, get a kill with weapons to keep Devour active

Primary.Name: Conditional Finality
Primary.Info: Stasis exotic capable of freezing enemies.

Chest.Name: Osmiomancy Gloves
Chest.Info: Direct hits with Coldsnap Grenades return energy, grants 2 Coldsnap Grenades, and Coldsnaps track further and more aggressively.

HowItWorks:
When using osmiomancy gloves, direct hits with coldsnap grenades grant additional coldsnap grenade energy. Coldsnap by default instantly freeze enemies. When shattered, these enemies will also send out iceflare bolts to spread freeze.

Stasis shards can be generated by freezing enemies which grant melee energy and armor charge stacks when collected. This feeds directly into grenade kickstart mods to give more grenade energy back.

Lastly, stasis weapons capable of freezing enemies allow you to generate iceflare bolts without needing an ability.
GameplayLoop:
Throw a coldsnap grenade near an enemy.
Kill enemies while iceflare bolts are continuing to travel and freeze additional enemies.
Collect Stasis Shards when convenient.
Use stasis weapons / melee when needed to freeze and generate icelfare bolts
Repeat steps 1 - 4

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Weapons are preference in this build. Quicksilver Storm is a good option for the exotic damage bonus and its ability to create Tangles for more Whirling Maelstroms. Be sure to match your Siphon mod to your primary ad clearing weapon and Surge mods to your primary damage dealing weapon.

Chest.Name: Cyrtarachne's Facade
Chest.Info: When using Grapple this helmet gives 10 seconds of Woven Mail which gives 55% damage resistance.

HowItWorks:
This Strand Hunter build is a very fun build and is great for dealing boss damage and ad clear. The build runs through the Grapple ability which is buffed by Widow's Silk to get two charges, Thread of Ascent which gives a free reload and multiple weapon stat bonuses, and using Grapple gives Woven Mail from the Cyrtarachne’s Facade exotic helmet.

Ad clear of this build is primarily through Whirling Maelstrom, the Beyblade. When destroying a Tangle, a Whirling Maelstrom is created which damages and unravels targets. To create Tangles you defeat any Strand debuffed enemy. With Thread of Transmutation, you can create Tangles by killing any enemy with a weapon while having Woven Mail.

Dealing boss damage is accomplished with Marksman's Dodge and Thread of Ascent. With a Rocket Launcher you can shoot a Rocket, Grapple for a free reload, shoot, Dodge for a free reload, shoot, Grapple for another free reload, and shoot once more.
GameplayLoop:
Grapple for Woven Mail and to activate Thread of Ascent for a free reload and weapon stat bonuses
Utilize Grapple melee and create an Orb of Power on a kill
Get a kill with Woven Mail active to create a Tangle
Shoot the Tangle to create a Whirling Maelstrom

Primary.Name: Brigand's Law
Primary.Info: Any primary weapon with the perk Voltshot works well with this build to activate Spark of Discharge and Spark of Ions.

Chest.Name: Geomag Stabilizers
Chest.Info: These boots let you get Chaos Reach very quickly as Ionic Traces give super energy with these equipped.

HowItWorks:
This build is centered around continuously using abilities and spreading Jolt to create Ionic Traces. Targets are Jolted with the use of a weapon with Voltshot and grenades, which Jolt targets with Spark of Shock. Ionic Traces are created when killing arc debuffed targets from Spark of Ions or from any ability kill with Electrostatic Mind. Ionic Traces give ability energy, make you Amplified, and with Geomag Stabilizers they also reduce the energy of Chaos Reach.

The other Aspect in use is Arc Soul. This deals solid passive damage, but this is overcharged when being Amplified. Based off the Ionic Trace production of this build that will essentially be at all times.  Arc Soul also has the added benefit of creating Ionic Traces because it is considered an arc ability.
GameplayLoop:
Cast Healing Rift to summon an Arc Soul
Get a kill with a Voltshot weapon and reload it
Jolt enemies with a Voltshot weapon or Pulse Grenade
Defeat Jolted enemies to create an Ionic Trace
Spam arc abilities and Voltshot to Jolt targets and create Ionic Traces to charge Chaos Reach and all other abilities
Use Chaos Reach on high health targets

Primary.Name: Coldheart
Primary.Info: This weapon creates Ionic Traces when dealing damage.

Chest.Name: Geomag Stabilizers
Chest.Info: When you damage targets with your chaos reach it extends the duration of the super. Picking up ionic traces will also grant you extra super energy.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to have numerous buffed chaos reach supers.

You will be feeding your super energy through doing damage, getting kills, picking up orbs of power, and even picking up ionic traces due to your exotic Geomag Stabilizers. These will also provide the benefit of extending your chaos reach super length when doing damage for even more boss damage and ad clear.

There are a couple different ways you can make ionic traces. First off with your aspect electrostatic mind any ability kill or arc debuffed target will grant an ionic trace. This also has the benefit of making you amplified when picking up ionic traces as well. If you are running the arc soul aspect not only will just your abilities make ionic traces but any arc soul kill will as well. Taking the fragment spark of ions will make it so when you defeat a jolted target you will make an ionic trace and this well stack with electrostatic mind. The final way of making ionic traces is with the fragment spark of discharge so any arc weapon final blow has a chance to make one.

For arc weapons, running any weapon with the voltshot perk works great because when reloading after a kill you can apply jolt to an enemy which when killed will proc electrostatic mind and spark of ions with the chance of also pricing spark of discharge. You can also run Coldheart so when doing sustained damage the weapon itself can make ionic traces. Other than those Delicate Tomb will also be another great option for making ionic traces. Once again since all of these do arc damage they all have a chance to proc spark of discharge.

Since getting jolt kills can make ionic traces running spark of shock so all of your grenade damage can jolt enemies is very strong. This just means now even your grenades can grant super energy and pairing that with the mod ashes to assets you can get energy from getting kills with them as well.

For survivability the fragment spark of resistance is very nice so when surrounded you get a damage reduction. Since you can spam abilities all the time I would highly recommend taking healing rift so you can healing pools that provide arc souls to your entire team everywhere. Running a recuperation mod is also very helpful so when picking up and orb of power you gain some health.

Oh and since you can spam rifts everywhere take a dynamo mod for even more super generation!
GameplayLoop:
Get kills then reload your weapon to proc voltshot
Get a kill with voltshot active to make an ionic trace
Get any ability kill to also make an ionic trace
Spam every ability repeatedly since ionic traces refill your ability energy further making more traces
Pickup all the ionic traces to fill your super chaos reach up extremely fast
Use chaos reach on bosses or any high health targets (it’s also pretty good for ad clear if needed)

Primary.Name: Wicked Implement
Primary.Info: Any Stasis weapon works well in this build. Wicked Implement is a recommendation due to its ability to create Stasis Crystals with Headstone as its catalyst.

Chest.Name: Osmiomancy Gloves
Chest.Info: Your Coldsnap grenades have an additional charge that recharges quicker on direct impact. The seeker spawned from Coldsnap grenades travels further.

HowItWorks:
This Stasis Warlock Build is all about Crowd Control and freezing every single enemy on the Battlefield! Coldsnap grenades combined with the Iceflare Bolts Aspect allow chain freezing to happen off of every enemy that has been frozen! Add in Armor charges with grenade kickstart and the Exotic Osmiomancy Gloves to make sure you always have infinite grenades available. 

Further this by adding Wicked Implement as your weapon. With Whisper of Rending it allows Wicked Implement to hit like a truck and create stasis crystals thanks to the Headstone perk. There are multiple ways of getting grenades back and this is probably one of the easiest, yet strongest builds you will play in end game content. The loop is very simple and you can do it all from safety. You also have infinite healing rifts thanks to a fragment so you can always be sitting in a rift safely in the distance.
GameplayLoop:
Drop your healing rift upon entering a room which should always be available
Throw your Cold Snap Grenades to freeze the entire battlefield with the Iceflare Bolts Aspect
Grab the Orbs of Power and Stasis Shards to keep your Armor Charges up
Your Exotic Osmiomancy Gloves, along with armor charge stacks will create infinite grenades
Create Stasis Crystals with a Stasis Weapon like Wicked Implement for the Headstone perk

Primary.Name: Riptide
Primary.Info: Any fusion rifle with Chill Clip will work.

Chest.Name: Rain of Fire
Chest.Info: Using Icarus Dash will reload all of your weapons. Getting kills with fusion rifles or linear fusions will make you radiant. Provides airborne effectiveness to fusion rifles and linear fusions.

HowItWorks:
The goal of this build is to be a weapon focused and primarly use Vex Mythoclast.

Since Vex Mythoclast is an exotic fusion rifle that shoots primary ammo you can use it to easily proc radiant from your Rain Of Fire exotic boots. Getting kills with Vex Mythoclast will also grant overcharge stacks which can be used to turn it into a linear fusion rifle. If you have the catalyst the overcharge stack will also grant damage, accuracy, and stability.

To make the build easier to play taking the icarus dash aspect makes movement extremely fluid and when it’s performed with Rain Of Fire equipped all of your weapons are reloaded. This is extremly strong for just general play but it gets crazy when pairing it with rockets for dps.

For survivability taking the healing grenade to apply cure and restoration is very strong. You then can take the aspect touch of flame to buff the cure to heal more and the restoration to a x2 restoration. Phoenix dive is also a great choice for a fast cooldown and the ability to cure as well. Cure and restoration can be applied to teammates as well and should be prioritized to proc the fragment ember of benevolence to give you further increase regeneration to your cooldowns.

Fragments like ember of empyrean will make it so when you get Vex Mythoclast kills it will re-proc the restoration timer to make you unkillable. Ember of tempering is nice to have because solar weapon kills will make firesprites that will grant you more healing grenade energy. On top of that it will grant a stacking recovery bonus for you and nearby allies alongside an increase to your airborne effectiveness. The final fragment is ember of solace to further increase the timers of the radiant and restoration so you can always have them proc'd at all times.

The final note is the fact that this setup can deal with every champion. With a chill clip fusion rifle you can stun overloads, when you are radiant you can stun barriers, and unstoppable fusion rifle is an artifact perk this season.
GameplayLoop:
Get a kill with Vex Mythoclast to proc radiant from your Rain Of Fire exotic boots
Use your healing grenade to cure and apply x2 restoration
Use phoniex dive to apply cure
Get Vex Mythoclast kills to keep x2 restoration and radiant up at all times
Apply cure and restoration to teammates to decrease all your cooldowns

Primary.Name: Stronghold
Primary.Info: Blocking grants 50% damage resistance, and will change depending on the sword. 95% for aggressive, 90% for non aggressive. Blocking grants perfect guard, up to 100x which converts into Restoration x2 on attack. 4 seconds at x1 up to 16 seconds at 100x. Not blocking hits for 10 seconds removes all stacks.

HowItWorks:
Start off by blocking damage to gain perfect guard stacks, then at the right moment, throw the glacial grenade at an enemy to freeze them.

After this, you can rush in and destroy the glacial grenade with the Lament or the barricade, this will then cause Stasis Shards to spawn, giving you a 25% chance of getting armor charge. If the enemy in the glacial grenade or around is killed, it will proc firepower and bolstering detonation, giving barricade energy back and spawning an orb which you can pick up for a second armor charge. these shards will also activate fragments:

Diamond lance is the second aspect in this build, when you kill a frozen enemy, it creates a diamond lance you can throw, treat this as an emergency damage resist spear... this will be mentioned later on.

Shards (500% grenade regeneration for 6 seconds per crystal, glacial grenade has 5, so that's 30 seconds of 500% if your manage your grenade crystal destroying correct)
Conduction (Allows shards to come to you, very useful for gaining overshield without going into a risky situation) 
Rime (Shards collected will grant 5 hp overshield from small shards, such as destroying glacial grenade crystals. this would give 25hp overshield per grenade)
GameplayLoop:
Block Damage with Lament to build Stronghold stacks
Throw glacial grenade at enemies
Run in, and destroy the grenade
Pick Stasis Shards up, and the orb from firepower
Attack enemies to trigger restoration x2 and weapon surge

Primary.Name: Quicksilver Storm
Primary.Info: Any strong Strand weapon works well in this build

Chest.Name: Synthoceps
Chest.Info: Increased melee lunge range. Improved melee and Super damage when you're surrounded.

HowItWorks:
This Strand Titan is the Best Build in Destiny 2 currently. It has infinite Woven Mail for a 55% Damage Reduction and Infinite Healing with Banner of War x4. This allows you to survive solo in Grandmasters while being in the face of enemies and mow through them! 

The entire Build depends on keeping up Woven Mail through Tangles and Orbs of Power and you give this buff to your allies as well through Into the Fray. Keep Banner of War up through getting kills as well for infinite Healing for you and your teammates. This means you support the entire team while dishing out some of the best damage in the game to mobs of enemies and single targets like Champions!
GameplayLoop:
Grapple into at least 3 enemies and use your grapple melee to make an orb of power and a tangle on any kill
Grab the Tangle and Orb of Power and throw the Tangle at a group of enemies
Use your normal melee to finish off Champions and 1 shot red bars
Upkeep Woven Mail by throwing Tangles and grabbing Orbs
Upkeep Banner of War by using your grapple and powered melee

Primary.Name: Cartesian Coordinate
Primary.Info: A great supplementary damage source when rolled with Vorpal Weapon

Chest.Name: Starfire Protocol
Chest.Info: Grants double fusion grenades. Weapon hits and final blows while empowered grant increased grenade energy.

HowItWorks:
Starfire Protocol with Touch of Flame and Ember of Ashes makes fusion grenades extremely strong!

This combined with the regen through Firesprites, collecting Orbs of Power, Grenade Kickstart, and Ember of Benevolence yield extremely high uptime for grenades.

The essence of the build is to have MANY ways to return grenade energy, so you almost always have 1 or 2 fusion grenades.

Grenade final blows also cure, so these can be used for healing or just for dealing with tankier enemies!
GameplayLoop:
Use 1 or 2 fusion grenades
Place Rift / Use Phoenix Dive for grenade energy
If Rift, teammates can stand in this to grant ember of benevolence regen
Collect Orbs and Firesprites for grenade energy
Repeat

Primary.Name: Wicked Implement
Primary.Info: Weapons are preference in this build, but be sure to match Siphon, Surge, and Loader mods to your weapon's element.

Chest.Name: Renewal Grasps
Chest.Info: These gloves give Duskfield Grenades a larger area, grant 25% damage resistance when standing in a Duskfield Grenade, as well as make enemies deal 50% less damage when they are in the grenade's area.

HowItWorks:
The main crux of this build is around the Duskfield Grenade which has its area and duration increased as well as a Stasis Crystal that spawns in the center with Touch of Winter, Renewal Grasps, and Whisper of Durance. Not only do the exotic Renewal Grasps increase the radius of Duskfield Grenade, but their main allure is survivability by making enemies in your Duskfield deal 50% reduced damage and granting you 25% damage resistance while in the Duskfield's area. When standing next to a Stasis Crystal which will be in every Duskfield Grenade, you will get 40% damage resistance from Whisper of Chains. Between these buffs, maxed resilience, and damage resist mods you can get up to 90% damage resistance with this build.

Having this survivability is great, but this build also allows you to spam abilities. Duskfield Grenades can be regained in a few seconds by destroying a Stasis Crystal which will grant 600% grenade regeneration rate with Whisper of Shards. Withering Blade can have its cooldown automatically refunded with activating Gambler's Dodge or reduced when picking up Stasis Shards.
